utterances.text: Yes . They usually do it .
utterances.scene: The second speaker confirms that brokers typically handle such matters. The tone is confirming and informative.

utterances.text: Do they charge for that ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker asks about the cost associated with using brokers. The tone is practical and cost-conscious.

utterances.text: Of course . In Europe , they charge a commission of 1 % of the amount of the claim for their service .
utterances.scene: The second speaker explains the commission structure for brokers in Europe. The tone is informative and specific.

utterances.text: Is it the same in America ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker asks if the same charging practice applies in America. The tone is comparative and inquisitive.

utterances.text: They do the work without charge to the importer .
utterances.scene: The second speaker explains that in America, brokers do not charge the importer for this service. The tone is informative and highlights a contrast.

utterances.text: It's part of their service , isn't it ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker infers that this is part of their standard service. The tone is inferential and seeks confirmation.

utterances.text: Exactly .
utterances.scene: The second speaker confirms the inference. The tone is agreeable and confirming.

utterances.text: Is it enough to claim with an on board bill of lading ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker asks about the necessary documentation to support a claim. The tone is specific and seeks clarification on procedural requirements.

utterances.text: No , you must also obtain a statement from the shipping agent certifying that the goods were actually loaded on their vessel for shipment .
utterances.scene: The second speaker explains that additional documentation from the shipping agent is required. The tone is instructional and detailed.

utterances.text: I see . By the way , how do we prove the ownership of our goods ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker acknowledges the information and then asks a follow-up question about proving ownership. The tone is understanding and further inquisitive.

utterances.text: You must provide full original set of ocean bills of lading original insurance policy or certificate and the original commercia invoice .
utterances.scene: The second speaker provides a comprehensive list of documents required to prove ownership of goods. The tone is instructional and thorough.

utterances.text: I see . Thank you .
utterances.scene: The first speaker expresses gratitude for the detailed information. The tone is appreciative.

utterances.text: You are welcome .
utterances.scene: The second speaker responds with a polite acknowledgment. The tone is courteous and customary.

utterances.text: I'll be on business for a couple of days , could you take care of your sister ?
utterances.scene: A parent informs their child about an upcoming business trip and entrusts them with the care of their sibling. The tone is instructional and shows trust.

utterances.text: OK , Mum , when will you be back ?
utterances.scene: The child agrees to the request and asks about the parent's return date. The tone is agreeable and practical.

utterances.text: I'll be back in ten days .
utterances.scene: The parent informs the child about their return in ten days. The tone is informative and direct.

utterances.text: Passport , please , madam .
utterances.scene: A customs official formally requests a passport from a traveler. The tone is authoritative and procedural.

utterances.text: Just a minute , please . It's in my bag . Here it is .
utterances.scene: The traveler, slightly delayed, locates and presents their passport. The tone is a bit flustered but compliant.

utterances.text: Thank you . Please fill out the Baggage Declaration Form .
utterances.scene: The official thanks the traveler and instructs them to fill out a baggage declaration form. The tone is polite and procedural.

utterances.text: All right . Shall I enter all my belongings ?
utterances.scene: The traveler seeks clarification on what items should be listed on the form. The tone is inquisitive and aims for accuracy.

utterances.text: No , only the articles listed on the Declaration .
utterances.scene: The official clarifies that only listed articles need to be declared. The tone is clarifying and specific.

utterances.text: I ’ m hungry , let ’ s go grab a bite to eat .
utterances.scene: A person expresses hunger and suggests getting something to eat. The tone is casual and proposes an activity.

utterances.text: Yeah me too . Oh ! Can we stop at the shop really fast ? I lost my makeup bag at the airport and I want to pick up a few things .
utterances.scene: The other person agrees to eat but eagerly requests a quick stop at a shop to replace lost makeup. The tone is agreeable but also eager and slightly demanding.

utterances.text: Will you take long ?
utterances.scene: The first person, likely anticipating a long wait, asks about the duration of the shopping trip. The tone is slightly impatient and questioning.

utterances.text: No ! Five minutes I promise !
utterances.scene: The second person reassures them with a promise of a very quick stop. The tone is reassuring and tries to alleviate concern.

utterances.text: Come on ! We have been here for almost an hour ! I thought you said you were only going to get a few things ! How long does it take you to pick out a lipstick and some nail polish !
utterances.scene: After a long wait, the first person expresses extreme frustration, accusing the other of breaking their promise about the shopping duration. The tone is highly frustrated and accusatory.

utterances.text: Are you crazy ? You have no idea what you are talking about ! Just for my eyes I have to get eye-liner , an eyelash curler , eye shadow , an eyebrow pencil and mascara . Then I need to get foundation , liquid foundation .
utterances.scene: The second person defensively explains the complexity of buying makeup, listing numerous items. The tone is defensive, exasperated, and tries to justify the time taken.

utterances.text: Whoa whoa whoa ! Are you nuts ? How much is all this going to cost ? I ’ m looking at the price at each one of these little things and it ’ s outrageous ! This is basically a crayon !
utterances.scene: The first person expresses shock and disbelief at the cost of the makeup items, criticizing them as overpriced. The tone is shocked, critical, and disbelieving of the value.

utterances.text: What about you ? You spend as much or more money on your razors , after shave , cologne and gel ! Not to mention how much you spend on clothes and ...
utterances.scene: The second person defensively counter-accuses the first person of spending similar amounts on their own personal care and clothing. The tone is defensive and shifts blame.

utterances.text: Fine ! Get the stupid thirty dollar crayon !
utterances.scene: The first person, exasperated, gives in to the purchase, albeit with a sarcastic comment about the price. The tone is resigned and frustrated, indicating an end to the argument.

utterances.text: Can I borrow five bucks ?
utterances.scene: A person casually asks to borrow a small amount of money. The tone is direct and informal.

utterances.text: No !
utterances.scene: The other person immediately and directly refuses the request. The tone is blunt and unyielding.

utterances.text: Come on ! I'll pay you back on Tuesday .
utterances.scene: The first person attempts to persuade, promising prompt repayment. The tone is pleading and tries to reassure.

utterances.text: Last time I lent you money , you never paid me back .
utterances.scene: The second person explains their refusal by recalling a past instance of unpaid debt. The tone is firm, distrustful, and based on past experience.

utterances.text: I promise if you lend me five dollars today , I will repay you in full next week .
utterances.scene: The first person makes a stronger promise of repayment, emphasizing full repayment next week. The tone is desperate and tries to rebuild trust.

utterances.text: Ok , but I'm taking your skateboard as collateral .
utterances.scene: The second person agrees to lend the money but imposes a condition of collateral. The tone is cautious, conditional, and business-like, showing a lingering lack of full trust.

utterances.text: Fine ! I can't believe you don't trust me .
utterances.scene: The first person agrees to the collateral but expresses hurt and disbelief at the lack of trust. The tone is resigned but also conveys personal offense.

utterances.text: It's nothing personal , just business .
utterances.scene: The second person clarifies that the collateral is a business decision, not a personal one. The tone is detached, business-like, and attempts to depersonalize the situation.

utterances.text: May I help you , sir ?
utterances.scene: A sales assistant politely offers assistance to a customer entering a store, initiating a service interaction with a helpful tone.

utterances.text: Yes , please . I'm looking for a cotton polo shirt .
utterances.scene: The customer gratefully accepts the offer of help and clearly states their shopping objective, indicating a specific product they are interested in.

utterances.text: Any particular colour ?
utterances.scene: The sales assistant, continuing to assist, asks a clarifying question about the customer's preference to narrow down options.

utterances.text: Not really .
utterances.scene: The customer responds with a neutral preference regarding color, indicating flexibility in their choice.

utterances.text: How about this one ?
utterances.scene: The sales assistant presents a specific item to the customer for their consideration, hoping to meet their needs.

utterances.text: I like the design , but don't particularly care for the colour . Do you have that in other colours , too ?
utterances.scene: The customer expresses partial approval, liking the design but not the color, and politely inquires about other available color options, indicating a desire to find a suitable item.

utterances.text: Well , they come in white , pale yellow , aqua , red and green . Will a white one do ?
utterances.scene: The sales assistant lists the available colors for the item and then suggests a common, versatile option to the customer, trying to close the sale.

utterances.text: Yes . I prefer white - and may I see a pale yellow one , too ?
utterances.scene: The customer confirms a preference for white but also expresses interest in seeing another color, pale yellow, indicating a desire to compare before making a final decision.

utterances.text: Why , of course . Let's see ... White ... Pale yellow . Here you are , sir .
utterances.scene: The sales assistant readily agrees to the customer's request and quickly retrieves the requested items, maintaining a helpful and obliging attitude.

utterances.text: I ’ m so surprised to meet you in this remote village . Long time no see .
utterances.scene: Speaker A expresses genuine surprise and happiness at an unexpected reunion with an acquaintance in an unusual location, conveying warmth and nostalgia.

utterances.text: Yeah . How are you these days ?
utterances.scene: Speaker B acknowledges the shared surprise and reciprocates the friendly sentiment by inquiring about Speaker A's well-being, showing continued warmth and interest.

utterances.text: You look terrific and in good shape .
utterances.scene: Speaker A compliments Speaker B on their physical appearance and fitness, expressing admiration and positive observation.

utterances.text: Thank you .
utterances.scene: Speaker B gratefully accepts the compliment, showing appreciation for the positive feedback.

utterances.text: How do you keep fit ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A, impressed by Speaker B's fitness, expresses curiosity and asks about their methods for staying in shape.

utterances.text: I do yoga twice a weeks
utterances.scene: Speaker B answers the question by revealing one of their fitness activities, providing specific information about their routine.

utterances.text: Yoga ? It sounds interesting .
utterances.scene: Speaker A shows interest in yoga, finding the activity intriguing and potentially considering it for themselves.

utterances.text: It was hard at the beginning , but now feel it's really relaxing . It makes me flexible .
utterances.scene: Speaker B elaborates on their experience with yoga, sharing both initial challenges and current positive feelings and benefits, conveying satisfaction.

utterances.text: Anything else ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A, still curious and perhaps impressed, asks if Speaker B engages in any other fitness activities.

utterances.text: Yes , I often go swimming .
utterances.scene: Speaker B provides another detail about their fitness regimen, mentioning swimming as a regular activity.

utterances.text: Are you interested in swimming ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A asks a direct question to gauge Speaker B's personal enjoyment or passion for swimming.

utterances.text: Yes , I like it very much .
utterances.scene: Speaker B affirms their strong enjoyment of swimming, expressing genuine enthusiasm for the activity.

utterances.text: Are you going home now ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A initiates a casual conversation by asking about Speaker B's immediate plans, specifically regarding going home.

utterances.text: No , I'm not .
utterances.scene: Speaker B provides a direct negative answer, indicating they have other plans.

utterances.text: What are you going to do ? Are you going to work late ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A, curious about Speaker B's unexpected answer, probes further into their plans and speculates about working late.

utterances.text: No , I'm not . I'm going to look for an apartment .
utterances.scene: Speaker B clarifies their plans, stating they are not working late but instead plan to search for an apartment, revealing a new objective.

utterances.text: An apartment ? Why ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A expresses surprise and curiosity about Speaker B's decision to look for an apartment, seeking the underlying reason.

utterances.text: I'm going to try to find a place near the office .
utterances.scene: Speaker B explains the motivation behind their apartment search, indicating a desire to live closer to their workplace for convenience.

utterances.text: Where are you living now ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A asks about Speaker B's current living situation to better understand the context of their decision to move.

utterances.text: Out in the suburbs . It's a long trip to work every day .
utterances.scene: Speaker B reveals their current distant living location and expresses the burden of a long daily commute, justifying their desire to move.

utterances.text: How are you going to find an apartment ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A shifts focus to the practicalities of the apartment search, inquiring about Speaker B's method or strategy.

utterances.text: I'm going to buy a newspaper and check the classified ads .
utterances.scene: Speaker B outlines their traditional method for finding an apartment, indicating a concrete plan of action.

utterances.text: Apartments in the city are expensive .
utterances.scene: Speaker A expresses a common concern or offers a cautionary remark about the high cost of city apartments, showing a touch of concern or realism.

utterances.text: I know , but I'm going to enroll in a night school to take a course in business management .
utterances.scene: Speaker B acknowledges the cost concern but reveals an additional, ambitious plan for personal development, implying a financial strategy or future career goal that justifies the move.

utterances.text: no , no , you helped me with my computer last week . I want to repay the favor .
utterances.scene: Speaker A emphatically refuses to be treated, insisting on paying as a way to reciprocate a past favor, expressing gratitude and a desire for fairness.

utterances.text: no , it's definitely my turn to treat you ... you paid last time !
utterances.scene: Speaker B counters with equal insistence, asserting it's their turn to pay based on a previous occasion, indicating a friendly competition over generosity.

utterances.text: oh , that was just a quick bite to eat---that doesn't count !
utterances.scene: Speaker A dismisses the previous payment as insignificant, trying to invalidate Speaker B's argument and maintain their position on paying.

utterances.text: ok , ok , how about we just go Dutch ? It's settled . Listen , I'm still pretty new around here , would it be alright if you found the restaurant ?
utterances.scene: Speaker B, seeking to resolve the playful dispute, proposes a compromise (going Dutch) and then shifts the topic to a practical request, showing a friendly and slightly vulnerable side.

utterances.text: ok ... sure .
utterances.scene: Speaker A accepts the compromise and readily agrees to the practical request, signaling the end of the playful argument and a cooperative attitude.

utterances.text: I am waiting for a fax but just now I found there ’ s something wrong with the fax machine .
utterances.scene: Speaker A expresses frustration and concern, having discovered a problem with a crucial piece of office equipment while waiting for an important document.

utterances.text: What ’ s wrong with the fax machine ? Is it urgent ?
utterances.scene: Speaker B immediately seeks clarification on the nature of the problem and its urgency, showing concern and a readiness to help.

utterances.text: Yes , very urgent . And there is no other fax machine around . And the office of our boss is closed , so I can not use his machine either . And his secretary is out . Do you have any suggestion ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A emphasizes the extreme urgency of the situation and lists multiple obstacles, conveying a sense of desperation while explicitly asking for a solution.

utterances.text: Either call this extension number 0085 or ask them to send the fax to you as e-mail , you print it out .
utterances.scene: Speaker B offers two clear and practical solutions to Speaker A's urgent problem, providing helpful advice and demonstrating resourcefulness.

utterances.text: Hey , Jim . It's time to wake up and get out of bed .
utterances.scene: Speaker A attempts to rouse Jim from sleep, using a direct and insistent tone, indicating the need for him to get up.

utterances.text: Do I have to get up now ?
utterances.scene: Jim responds with a groggy and reluctant question, expressing a desire to remain in bed and avoid waking up.

utterances.text: You'd better get up , or you'll be late .
utterances.scene: Speaker A reinforces the urgency, warning Jim of the negative consequence (being late) if he doesn't comply, maintaining an insistent tone.

utterances.text: What're you talking about ? My alarm even hasn't gone off yet .
utterances.scene: Jim, still disoriented, expresses confusion and disbelief, suggesting his alarm hasn't sounded, indicating he's unaware of the time.

utterances.text: Yes , it did . It went off thirty minutes ago . You slept right through it . You're like a dead person while you sleep .
utterances.scene: Speaker A corrects Jim's misconception, reveals he overslept significantly, and playfully exaggerates his deep sleep, showing exasperation mixed with amusement.

utterances.text: I must have slept right through it .
utterances.scene: Jim, realizing his mistake, acknowledges that he indeed overslept, expressing mild surprise or resignation.

utterances.text: Rise and shine ! Sleepyhead !
utterances.scene: Speaker A uses a cheerful and playful phrase to further encourage Jim to wake up, adding a lighthearted teasing tone.

utterances.text: Just let me sleep five more minutes .
utterances.scene: Jim makes a plea for a few more minutes of sleep, expressing a lingering desire for rest and reluctance to fully wake up.

utterances.text: The early bird gets the worm .
utterances.scene: Speaker A uses a common idiom to motivate Jim, implying that prompt action leads to rewards, maintaining an encouraging but firm stance.

utterances.text: I know , I know . But I don't want any worms .
utterances.scene: Jim acknowledges the idiom but playfully rejects its literal implication, continuing his humorous resistance to waking up.

utterances.text: Ha ! Ha ! If you don't make an effort now , later on it'll be a lot tougher for you .
utterances.scene: Speaker A laughs at Jim's joke but then delivers a serious, motivational warning about the long-term consequences of procrastination, shifting to a more serious tone.

utterances.text: What shall we do tonight ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A initiates a casual conversation about evening plans, seeking suggestions and collaborative decision-making.

utterances.text: How about the cinema ?
utterances.scene: Speaker B offers a specific suggestion for an evening activity, proposing going to the cinema.

utterances.text: That's a good idea . We haven't seen a film for ages . What would you like to see ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A expresses approval for the suggestion, notes how long it's been since they last went, and then asks Speaker B for their movie preference, showing enthusiasm and willingness to collaborate.

utterances.text: Oh I don't know . Titanic ?
utterances.scene: Speaker B hesitates momentarily before suggesting a well-known film, possibly as a placeholder or a casual idea.

utterances.text: Titanic ? That old film ? but I've seen it before !
utterances.scene: Speaker A expresses surprise and mild disbelief at the suggestion, immediately dismissing it due to its age and having already seen it, indicating a desire for something new.

utterances.text: I ’ Ve been told you might have a vacant room .
utterances.scene: Speaker A initiates an inquiry about accommodation, stating the reason for their visit and expressing a hopeful expectation of availability.

utterances.text: Yes . I have a spare room .
utterances.scene: Speaker B confirms the availability of a room, providing a direct and affirmative answer.

utterances.text: How much are you asking ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A immediately proceeds to inquire about the price, indicating their interest in the financial aspect of the room.

utterances.text: 10.00 dollars a night .
utterances.scene: Speaker B provides the specific price for the room, giving a clear and concise answer to the inquiry.

utterances.text: Could I see the room , please ?
utterances.scene: Speaker A, having received the price, politely requests to view the room, indicating a desire to inspect it before making a decision.

utterances.text: Sure.Come on in .
utterances.scene: Speaker B readily agrees to the request and invites Speaker A to enter, demonstrating hospitality and willingness to show the room.

utterances.text: Sit down , please . What's wrong with you ?
utterances.scene: The doctor politely instructs the patient to sit and then professionally asks about their symptoms, initiating the medical consultation.

utterances.text: I feel cold , and I'm shivering . I have a terrible headache and a sore throat .
utterances.scene: The patient describes a range of uncomfortable symptoms, conveying their physical discomfort and concern.

utterances.text: How long have you been like that ?
utterances.scene: The doctor asks a clarifying question about the duration of the symptoms, gathering more information for a proper diagnosis.

utterances.text: About a day .
utterances.scene: The patient provides a concise answer regarding the onset of their symptoms.

utterances.text: Let me have a look at your throat first . Please open your mouth and say " ah " .
utterances.scene: The doctor gives clear instructions for a physical examination, focusing on the throat as a primary area based on the patient's symptoms.

utterances.text: Ah ...
utterances.scene: The patient complies with the doctor's instruction, indicating cooperation during the examination.

utterances.text: And show me your tongue ... Thank you . That'll do . You have slight tonsillitis , and your throat is inflamed . How is your appetite ?
utterances.scene: The doctor continues the examination, makes an initial diagnosis of tonsillitis and an inflamed throat, and then asks about another symptom, appetite, indicating a thorough approach.

utterances.text: Not so good .
utterances.scene: The patient responds negatively about their appetite, further confirming their general malaise.

utterances.text: Now , let me take your temperature . Please put this thermometer under your armpit and let me feel your pulse ?
utterances.scene: The doctor proceeds with further diagnostic checks, instructing the patient on how to take their temperature and simultaneously checking their pulse, demonstrating a systematic examination.

utterances.text: Your pulse is weak .
utterances.scene: The doctor observes and states a finding from the physical examination, indicating a weak pulse.

utterances.text: Do I have a temperature , doctor ?
utterances.scene: The patient, concerned about their condition, directly asks the doctor about having a fever.

utterances.text: Yes , you have a high fever . I'd like to give you a blood test .
utterances.scene: The doctor confirms the patient has a high fever and proposes a further diagnostic procedure (blood test) to gain more insight into their condition, maintaining a professional and thorough approach.

utterances.text: Yikes ! What was that noise ?
utterances.scene: Speaker expresses surprise and a slight alarm at a sudden, very loud noise, questioning its origin.

utterances.text: I had to blow my nose .
utterances.scene: Speaker casually explains the source of the loud noise, indicating a common bodily function.

utterances.text: Did you have to blow right next to the phone ?
utterances.scene: Speaker expresses annoyance or incredulity, implying the noise was excessively loud or poorly timed given their proximity to the phone.

utterances.text: Did you hear that ?
utterances.scene: Speaker, with a hint of sarcasm and amusement, rhetorically questions if the first speaker heard the noise they themselves made.

utterances.text: Of course I heard that . I thought a plane had crashed into your house .
utterances.scene: Speaker reiterates the extreme loudness with humor and exaggeration, emphasizing their shock and the perceived intensity of the sound.

utterances.text: It wasn't that loud .
utterances.scene: Speaker downplays the severity of the noise, perhaps feeling a bit defensive or embarrassed by the reaction.

utterances.text: I will blow my nose sometime for you , and you'll see .
utterances.scene: Speaker playfully challenges the other person, promising to demonstrate the true loudness of their nose-blowing in the future.

utterances.text: Okay . I'll take your word for it .
utterances.scene: Speaker accepts the playful challenge with amusement, indicating a willingness to trust the other's word for now.

utterances.text: I thought you had an elephant in your house .
utterances.scene: Speaker continues the humorous exaggeration, linking the noise to something absurdly large and out of place.

utterances.text: You're funny .
utterances.scene: Speaker acknowledges and appreciates the other person's humor and lightheartedness.

utterances.text: What did you say ? I think I've gone deaf .
utterances.scene: Speaker extends the joke, humorously pretending to have hearing loss due to the loud noise, continuing the playful interaction.

utterances.text: I'm going into the bathroom to blow my nose . I'll be right back .
utterances.scene: Speaker announces a practical action, likely still with a hint of the previous playful tone, indicating they will move to avoid causing another loud disturbance.

utterances.text: Can I have the check please ?
utterances.scene: A customer politely requests the bill after a meal or service, indicating the conclusion of their visit.

utterances.text: Right away , sir .
utterances.scene: A server responds promptly and courteously to the customer's request, demonstrating professional service.

utterances.text: Is this amount correct ?
utterances.scene: The customer reviews the bill and asks for confirmation of the total amount, expressing a cautious desire for accuracy.

utterances.text: Yes , sir , it is .
utterances.scene: The server confirms the correctness of the bill amount, offering reassurance and maintaining professionalism.

utterances.text: Thank you , the service was good
utterances.scene: The customer expresses gratitude and satisfaction with the service received, providing positive feedback.

utterances.text: Please come again .
utterances.scene: The server expresses a polite wish for the customer to return, concluding the interaction on a welcoming and appreciative note.

utterances.text: Nowadays fewer and fewer people go to the movie theaters to see films . So I am afraid that the film studios are really getting hard time to survive .
utterances.scene: Speaker expresses concern about the declining attendance at movie theaters and its potential negative impact on film studios, adopting a worried and analytical tone.

utterances.text: What you said is true . But the film producers there are more flexible ways to get more audience . For example , to make more movie Ccds , so people will spend money buying them .
utterances.scene: Speaker acknowledges the previous point but offers a counter-argument, suggesting alternative, flexible strategies for film producers to reach audiences.

utterances.text: But it is true that cinemas are losing the attraction they used to have in the past .
utterances.scene: Speaker reiterates the core issue, emphasizing the diminishing appeal of traditional cinemas, perhaps with a hint of nostalgia or regret.

utterances.text: Yes . Take myself for example . I seldom go to cinemas , but it doesn't mean I no longer see films ; instead , I see films at home-watching Ccds .
utterances.scene: Speaker agrees and provides a personal example to support the argument about changing viewing habits, affirming that film consumption has shifted rather than ceased.

utterances.text: Okay , well I ’ m sure you have a number of questions to ask me regarding the position .
utterances.scene: An interviewer sets a welcoming and professional tone, inviting the candidate to ask questions about the job position.

utterances.text: Yes , well Miss Childs did give mean overview of the position over the phone , but there were some details I ’ d like to clarify .
utterances.scene: The candidate politely confirms their interest and need for further information, indicating preparedness and a desire for specific details.

utterances.text: Well feel free to ask me anything , and I ’ ll try to fill in the details .
utterances.scene: The interviewer encourages the candidate to ask freely, offering to provide comprehensive answers and fill in any missing details.

utterances.text: Could I first ask about the remuneration package ?
utterances.scene: The candidate, perhaps a bit cautiously, initiates a discussion about salary and benefits, identifying it as an important priority.

utterances.text: Yes , of course . That ’ s quite an important point , isn ’ t it ? As a junior sub editor we offer a starting salary of 150,000 HK dollars per annum . This doesn ’ t include a generous housing allowance also .
utterances.scene: The interviewer acknowledges the importance of the question and provides specific details about the starting salary and an additional benefit.

utterances.text: I understand . And are there other bonuses included ?
utterances.scene: The candidate processes the information and follows up with a logical question about additional incentives or bonuses.

utterances.text: Well , apart from full health insurance we do offer a company staff bonus scheme linked to readership numbers . But we could go through all the details of that at a later date .
utterances.scene: The interviewer provides more details about benefits, including a performance-linked bonus, while suggesting a deeper dive into specifics for a later stage.

utterances.text: Well , Mr . Parsons , I am flexible when it comes to salary . The opportunity to work in Hong Kong for you is the most important thing for me .
utterances.scene: The candidate expresses flexibility regarding salary, emphasizing their strong interest in the job opportunity and location, demonstrating enthusiasm and strategic thinking.

utterances.text: Excellent . Well , what other questions do you have Rebecca ?
utterances.scene: The interviewer expresses satisfaction with the candidate's response and invites further questions, continuing the open and positive discussion.

utterances.text: We need to take the accounts system offline to carry out the upgrade . But don't worry , it won't cause too much inconvenience . We're going to do it over the weekend .
utterances.scene: Speaker informs about a necessary system upgrade, proactively reassuring the listener that inconvenience will be minimized by scheduling it during non-working hours.

utterances.text: How long will the system be down for ?
utterances.scene: Listener asks a practical question to understand the duration of the system downtime, indicating a need for planning.

utterances.text: We'll be taking everything offline in about two hours ' time . It'll be down for a minimum of twelve hours . If everything goes according to plan , it should be up again by 6 pm on Saturday .
utterances.scene: Speaker provides detailed information about the timing and expected duration of the system downtime, including a best-case scenario.

utterances.text: That's fine . We've allowed forty-eight hours to be on the safe side .
utterances.scene: Listener expresses acceptance and indicates that their own planning has accounted for potential delays, showing foresight and a relaxed attitude.

utterances.text: Welcome to IBA . Can I help you ?
utterances.scene: A service representative greets a visitor professionally and offers assistance, setting a welcoming tone.

utterances.text: Yes , please . I'm here for an International Settlement . Our company has to effect payment , and it needs to be done today . Here's the advice slip for the payment .
utterances.scene: A customer states their urgent business purpose, providing necessary documentation for an international payment that needs to be processed today.

utterances.text: Thanks . I'm sorry to say that you need to get this stamped . There is no stamp on this slip and it is essential before I can process it for you .
utterances.scene: The representative reviews the document and regretfully informs the customer of a missing, crucial requirement (a stamp) before processing can occur.

utterances.text: I see . So , I need to stamp it . And sign it too ?
utterances.scene: The customer clarifies the requirement and asks a follow-up question, seeking complete understanding of what needs to be done.

utterances.text: Yes , that's right . Down here , at the bottom right hand corner to show that you agree to pay the printed amount .
utterances.scene: The representative confirms and provides precise instructions for fulfilling the requirement, including the exact location for the signature.

utterances.text: I'll go back to the office and get it sorted and pop back later . Thanks , bye for now .
utterances.scene: The customer accepts the need to return to their office to complete the task and politely concludes the interaction, planning to return later.

utterances.text: That's the warehouse where the large items of office equipment are stored .
utterances.scene: Speaker points out a specific location and explains its function, providing information during a tour or explanation.

utterances.text: If I ordered a desk today , how would it be before I got delivery in Scotland ?
utterances.scene: Listener asks a practical question about delivery times for a specific item to a particular location, showing interest in a potential purchase.

utterances.text: Well , I think perhaps you'd better speak to our Production Manager , Mr . Yao . You'll meet him when we go over to the factory .
utterances.scene: Speaker refers the listener to another person who has more specialized knowledge, suggesting a future meeting to get accurate information.

utterances.text: Excuse me . I have just missed the connection plane due to the heavy fog in London . Can I change my ticket now ?
utterances.scene: A passenger, feeling distressed due to a missed flight caused by external factors, urgently requests to change their ticket.

utterances.text: Please Show your ticket and passport .
utterances.scene: An airline or airport staff member makes a standard, professional request for identification and travel documents to proceed with assistance.

utterances.text: Here you are .
utterances.scene: The passenger hands over the requested documents, showing compliance and cooperation.

utterances.text: Which flight do you want to change ?
utterances.scene: The staff member asks for specific information to facilitate the ticket change, aiming to provide the best solution.

utterances.text: The next one to my destination . I have to be there as soon as possible .
utterances.scene: The passenger expresses their urgent need to reach their destination, emphasizing the desire for the earliest possible flight.

utterances.text: Hi , can I speak with the apartment manager , please ?
utterances.scene: A caller politely requests to speak with the apartment manager, indicating an inquiry about a property.

utterances.text: Hello , this is the apartment manager speaking .
utterances.scene: The apartment manager identifies themselves, confirming their identity and readiness to assist professionally.

utterances.text: I'm calling about the apartment for rent on Main Street .
utterances.scene: The caller states the specific reason for their call, referring to a particular apartment for rent.

utterances.text: Would you be interested in seeing the apartment ?
utterances.scene: The apartment manager, showing initiative, offers a viewing of the property to the interested caller.

utterances.text: I would love to see it .
utterances.scene: The caller expresses enthusiastic interest in viewing the apartment, indicating eagerness and a positive attitude.

utterances.text: Are you free today at around 6 p . m . ?
utterances.scene: The apartment manager proposes a specific time for the viewing, seeking the caller's availability for scheduling.

utterances.text: Yes , I will be able to make it then .
utterances.scene: The caller confirms their availability for the proposed time, showing cooperation and commitment.

utterances.text: Well , I'll see you at 6 p . m . Do you know how to get there ?
utterances.scene: The apartment manager confirms the appointment and proactively checks if the caller needs directions, showing thoughtfulness.

utterances.text: I used to live in that area .
utterances.scene: The caller reassures the manager that directions are not needed, indicating familiarity with the location.

utterances.text: I'll give you an application form when I see you .
utterances.scene: The apartment manager informs the caller about the next step in the rental process, preparing them for the viewing.

utterances.text: That sounds good . Do I need to bring anything ?
utterances.scene: The caller acknowledges the information and asks if any specific items are required for the viewing, showing preparedness.

utterances.text: No . Just bring yourself .
utterances.scene: The apartment manager provides a simple, reassuring answer, indicating no special preparations are needed from the caller.

utterances.text: Good afternoon . Welcome to China . May I see your passport , customs and health declaration form ?
utterances.scene: A customs or immigration officer greets a traveler, welcomes them to the country, and makes a standard, formal request for essential travel documents.

utterances.text: Yes , here you are .
utterances.scene: The traveler responds politely and hands over the requested documents, showing compliance and cooperation.

utterances.text: Thank you . W hat's your occupation , Mr . Smith ?
utterances.scene: The officer thanks the traveler and proceeds with a standard line of questioning for immigration purposes, inquiring about their occupation.

utterances.text: I'm the general manager of the Far-East Industry Corporation .
utterances.scene: The traveler states their professional occupation clearly and formally, providing relevant identity information.

utterances.text: You are here on business , aren't you ?
utterances.scene: The officer deduces the purpose of the visit based on the occupation and seeks confirmation, as part of the standard immigration check.

utterances.text: Yes , I have been invited by the East Import
utterances.scene: The traveler confirms the business purpose and provides additional context, mentioning the inviting entity, to clarify their visit.

utterances.text: I see . Do you have anything to declare ?
utterances.scene: The officer acknowledges the information and moves to the next standard customs question regarding declarable items, maintaining a procedural tone.

utterances.text: Yes , I have some foreign currency to declare .
utterances.scene: The traveler honestly states that they have something to declare, specifically foreign currency, showing compliance with regulations.

utterances.text: Would you please fill out this currency declaration form ? It's a record of the foreign currency you have brought in .
utterances.scene: The officer provides a specific form for the declaration and explains its purpose, instructing the traveler on the next step.

utterances.text: All right .
utterances.scene: The traveler acknowledges the instruction and agrees to comply, indicating cooperation with the customs process.

utterances.text: How much does it cost for a bus pass ?
utterances.scene: A customer is inquiring about the price of a bus pass, expressing a practical, inquisitive tone.

utterances.text: It'll be $ 65 for a monthly pass .
utterances.scene: A service agent provides a direct, factual answer to the customer's price inquiry.

utterances.text: Is there anything cheaper than that ?
utterances.scene: The customer, likely feeling the price is high, expresses a desire for a more affordable option, showing a budget-conscious attitude.

utterances.text: If you're in school , you can get a student pass .
utterances.scene: The service agent offers a potential cost-saving alternative based on eligibility, maintaining a helpful and informative tone.

utterances.text: Well , I am how much will that cost ?
utterances.scene: The customer expresses relief and interest, confirming their eligibility and eagerly inquiring about the new, potentially cheaper price.

utterances.text: The pass is free .
utterances.scene: The service agent delivers surprising and very positive news, likely making the customer feel delighted.

utterances.text: I don't have to pay for anything ?
utterances.scene: The customer expresses disbelief and pleasant surprise, seeking clarification on the incredibly good news.

utterances.text: You'll only have to pay for the monthly sticker .
utterances.scene: The service agent clarifies the details, explaining there's a small, recurring charge, managing expectations while still delivering good news.

utterances.text: How much is the monthly sticker ?
utterances.scene: The customer, now understanding there's a minor cost, calmly inquires about this specific charge.

utterances.text: It's $ 24 for each month .
utterances.scene: The service agent provides the final, specific cost for the sticker, maintaining a factual and helpful demeanor.

utterances.text: I'll take the student bus pass .
utterances.scene: The customer makes a clear decision, expressing satisfaction with the student pass option, feeling content with the value.

utterances.text: Okay , I'll get you one .
utterances.scene: The service agent confirms the transaction, moving to process the request with a helpful and efficient tone.

utterances.text: I see there are some workmen on the site . When is the building work due to start ?
utterances.scene: An individual observes activity on a construction site and expresses curiosity about the official start date, seeking clarification.

utterances.text: Well , it'll take three weeks to demolish the old building and clear away the debris . We should be ready to start the construction work in week 23 .
utterances.scene: A project manager or contractor provides a detailed timeline, outlining initial phases and a projected start date for construction, conveying a professional and informative tone.

utterances.text: How long will the sub contractors be on site ?
utterances.scene: The individual follows up with a specific question about the duration of a phase, indicating an interest in detailed project scheduling.

utterances.text: About ten weeks in total if everything goes according to plan .
utterances.scene: The project manager provides an estimated duration for the subcontractors' work, adding a cautious qualifier about potential delays, maintaining a realistic tone.

utterances.text: I'm sure it will . So , we should be able to start moving the machinery in during week 34 . I'll confirm that date with our suppliers .
utterances.scene: The individual expresses confidence in the plan, then proposes a subsequent action based on the provided timeline, indicating coordination with other parties and a proactive approach.

utterances.text: Andrew's Hair Salon , this is Andrew .
utterances.scene: Andrew answers the phone, identifying himself and the business in a professional and welcoming manner.

utterances.text: Andrew , this is Linda Chen .
utterances.scene: Linda identifies herself, establishing a connection with Andrew in a polite and direct way.

utterances.text: Hi Linda , what can I do for you ?
utterances.scene: Andrew acknowledges Linda and offers assistance, maintaining a friendly and helpful customer service tone.

utterances.text: I need to set up an appointment to get my hair fixed .
utterances.scene: Linda states her purpose for calling, clearly expressing her need for a hair service appointment.

utterances.text: For what day ?
utterances.scene: Andrew asks for a specific detail required to schedule the appointment, demonstrating efficiency in his service.

utterances.text: Tuesday morning .
utterances.scene: Linda provides the requested detail, expressing her availability and preference for the appointment time.

utterances.text: Have you bought a bus pass yet ?
utterances.scene: One person asks another about their bus pass status, perhaps out of concern or curiosity regarding their friend's commuting.

utterances.text: I'm not getting one .
utterances.scene: The second person states their decision not to get a bus pass, conveying a firm stance.

utterances.text: Why is that ?
utterances.scene: The first person expresses curiosity and mild surprise, prompting an explanation for the decision.

utterances.text: It's cheaper if I don't buy one .
utterances.scene: The second person explains their reasoning, indicating a belief that not having a pass is more cost-effective.

utterances.text: Buying a bus pass will save you money .
utterances.scene: The first person challenges the previous statement, offering a counter-argument and expressing a helpful, persuasive intent.

utterances.text: How do you figure that ?
utterances.scene: The second person expresses skepticism and asks for clarification on the logic behind the counter-argument, showing a need for proof.

utterances.text: There's no limit to how often you can use your bus pass .
utterances.scene: The first person provides a key benefit of the bus pass, explaining how it offers unlimited usage, aiming to persuade.

utterances.text: Really ?
utterances.scene: The second person expresses surprise and growing interest, indicating that this information is new and compelling.

utterances.text: Plus , you don't have to use change for the bus anymore .
utterances.scene: The first person adds another practical benefit, emphasizing convenience to further convince the second person.

utterances.text: I like that .
utterances.scene: The second person expresses approval and positive reception to the added benefit, showing a shift in their opinion.

utterances.text: You want to buy one now ?
utterances.scene: The first person, sensing a change of heart, directly asks about the second person's readiness to purchase, with a hopeful tone.

utterances.text: I'm going to .
utterances.scene: The second person confirms their decision to buy a bus pass, indicating they have been successfully persuaded and are now convinced of its value.

utterances.text: Are you ready to order , sir ?
utterances.scene: A waiter politely asks a customer if they are ready to place their food order, initiating the ordering process.

utterances.text: Yes , I would like a roast duck and my friend wants steaks .
utterances.scene: The customer confirms readiness and places an order for himself and his companion, clearly stating their meal choices.

utterances.text: How do you like your steaks ?
utterances.scene: The waiter asks for a specific preparation detail for the steak, ensuring the order is precise and customized.

utterances.text: I'd like it medium-well .
utterances.scene: The customer provides the specific cooking preference for the steak, answering the waiter's question directly.

utterances.text: OK , sir , wait a minute .
utterances.scene: The waiter acknowledges the order and indicates a brief pause before proceeding, maintaining a polite and efficient service.

utterances.text: Hello , I want to know how much it costs to have a manicure and pedicure .
utterances.scene: A customer calls a salon to inquire about the price of specific beauty services, expressing a clear purpose.

utterances.text: Usually it's 60 dollars for a manicure , and 80 dollars for a pedicure . But with this special discount , the total for both is only one hundred and 20 dollars , and you can get them painted .
utterances.scene: A salon employee provides the standard pricing and then highlights a special discount, aiming to entice the customer with a good deal and additional benefits.

utterances.text: That's nice . I'd like to give it a try . I think I like passion red . please .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses satisfaction with the price and decides to proceed, also indicating a color preference, showing enthusiasm and excitement.

utterances.text: Alright.Do you want your cuticles cut , too ?
utterances.scene: The employee acknowledges the customer's choice and asks a specific procedural question, ensuring all service details are covered.

utterances.text: No .
utterances.scene: The customer provides a direct negative answer to the specific service detail, clearly stating her preference.

utterances.text: Would you like the shapes square or round ?
utterances.scene: The employee asks another specific aesthetic preference question, ensuring the customer's nails are shaped as desired.

utterances.text: Square . But with round at the edges , please .
utterances.scene: The customer gives a detailed and nuanced preference for the nail shape, ensuring precision in the service.

utterances.text: All right , it's done . Please follow me to the drying section .
utterances.scene: The employee announces the completion of the main service and directs the customer to the next step, maintaining a professional and guiding tone.

utterances.text: How long will it take to get them dry ?
utterances.scene: The customer inquires about the waiting time for the nails to dry, showing practical concern about the duration.

utterances.text: Ten or about five minutes . You'll be all set .
utterances.scene: The employee provides an estimated drying time and reassures the customer that the process will be quick, maintaining a helpful tone.

utterances.text: I see , thank you .
utterances.scene: The customer acknowledges the information and expresses gratitude, showing understanding and politeness.

utterances.text: Hello , this is Lucy . May I speak to Mr . Smith ?
utterances.scene: Lucy makes a professional phone call, identifying herself and politely requesting to speak with Mr. Smith.

utterances.text: Oh , hello , Lucy . What's up ?
utterances.scene: Mr. Smith recognizes Lucy and greets her informally, showing a friendly and familiar tone.

utterances.text: I'm afraid I can't come to work today , Mr . Smith .
utterances.scene: Lucy expresses regret and informs Mr. Smith of her inability to come to work, conveying an apologetic and direct tone.

utterances.text: Oh , what's wrong with you ?
utterances.scene: Mr. Smith expresses concern and asks about the reason for Lucy's absence, showing empathy.

utterances.text: I've got a fever and a very sore throat .
utterances.scene: Lucy describes her symptoms, providing a clear and direct explanation for her illness.

utterances.text: Well , you sound ill over the phone .
utterances.scene: Mr. Smith acknowledges Lucy's condition, confirming her illness based on her voice, expressing understanding.

utterances.text: Yes . I have to stay in bed today , but I'll be able to come tomorrow .
utterances.scene: Lucy confirms her need for rest and reassures Mr. Smith of her expected return to work the next day, showing responsibility.

utterances.text: That's all right . Have a good rest until you feel well enough .
utterances.scene: Mr. Smith accepts Lucy's absence, expresses understanding, and encourages her to rest, showing compassion and supportive management.

utterances.text: Thank you , Mr . Smith . Goodbye .
utterances.scene: Lucy expresses gratitude for Mr. Smith's understanding and politely ends the call.

utterances.text: Goodbye , Lucy .
utterances.scene: Mr. Smith responds with a polite farewell, concluding the conversation.

utterances.text: Waiter , we have been waiting for 20 minutes . Would you mind hurrying ?
utterances.scene: A customer expresses impatience and frustration after a long wait, politely but firmly requesting faster service.

utterances.text: I am sorry , sir , the fish you ordered will take a longer time because we make it with fresh fish .
utterances.scene: The waiter apologizes for the delay and provides a polite explanation, attempting to pacify the customer by highlighting the quality of the food.

utterances.text: That's fine . Would you please bring me some wine ?
utterances.scene: The customer accepts the explanation, showing understanding, and then makes a new request for a drink while waiting, shifting to a more relaxed tone.

utterances.text: Sure , is dry white wine OK ?
utterances.scene: The waiter confirms the drink request and asks for a specific preference, ensuring customer satisfaction.

utterances.text: Yes . Thank you .
utterances.scene: The customer confirms their preference and expresses gratitude, concluding the interaction with politeness.

utterances.text: Hi Bob , I won't be in work tomorrow .
utterances.scene: A colleague informs Bob directly and informally about their upcoming absence from work.

utterances.text: Why , what's the problem ?
utterances.scene: Bob expresses curiosity and concern, asking for the reason behind the absence in a friendly tone.

utterances.text: I have a dentist appointment .
utterances.scene: The colleague provides a brief and direct explanation for their absence, stating the specific reason.

utterances.text: Okay .
utterances.scene: Bob acknowledges the information, expressing understanding and acceptance of the reason for absence.

utterances.text: I've come about your wools . According to our market survey , wools are likely to find a ready market in our country .
utterances.scene: A buyer initiates a business discussion, expressing interest in purchasing wools and providing market research to support the potential for a deal, setting a professional and optimistic tone.

utterances.text: Wonderful ! We can meet your requirements and the offer is ready for you . Here it is . The unit price is USD 15.00 per kilogram .
utterances.scene: The seller expresses enthusiasm and confidence in meeting the buyer's needs, immediately presenting a ready offer with specific pricing, showing eagerness to close a deal.

utterances.text: Do you quote CIF or FOB ?
utterances.scene: The buyer asks a specific technical question regarding the shipping terms of the quoted price, indicating a focus on logistics and cost breakdown.

utterances.text: It's FOB Shanghai .
utterances.scene: The seller provides a direct and factual answer to the inquiry about shipping terms, clarifying the current offer.

utterances.text: Could you quote the price of CIF Hamburg ?
utterances.scene: The buyer requests a recalculation of the price based on different shipping terms and destination, indicating a specific need for comparison or final costing.

utterances.text: Certainly , that's easy . We will work out our CIF offer this evening . Could you come again tomorrow , say , at 10 AM ?
utterances.scene: The seller confidently agrees to the request, promises a quick turnaround for the new quote, and proposes a follow-up meeting, showing flexibility and continued eagerness.

utterances.text: Okay , see you tomorrow !
utterances.scene: The buyer confirms the arrangement, expressing agreement and a polite farewell, looking forward to the next meeting.

utterances.text: Hi ! Do you want a fill-up ?
utterances.scene: A gas station attendant greets a customer, offering a service in a polite and standard manner. The tone is routine and helpful.

utterances.text: Yes , please .
utterances.scene: The customer accepts the offered service politely, indicating agreement. The tone is agreeable and concise.

utterances.text: Which type of gas do you want ? Regular , Super , or Premium Unleaded ?
utterances.scene: The attendant continues the service, asking for a specific preference to fulfill the request. The tone is informational and helpful.

utterances.text: What's the price difference ?
utterances.scene: The customer seeks more information to make an informed decision, showing a practical and cost-conscious attitude. The tone is inquisitive.

utterances.text: Regular is $ 1.15 , Super is $ 1.25 and Premium is $ 1.39 .
utterances.scene: The attendant provides the requested price information clearly and factually. The tone is informative and straightforward.

utterances.text: Just fill it up with Regular , Unleaded , please .
utterances.scene: The customer makes a final decision based on the provided information, opting for the most economical choice. The tone is decisive and polite.

utterances.text: Do you want me to check the tires and the fluids ?
utterances.scene: The attendant offers additional services, showing thoroughness and a desire to be helpful. The tone is proactive and attentive.

utterances.text: Yes , I would . Thanks a lot .
utterances.scene: The customer gladly accepts the additional service, expressing gratitude for the helpfulness. The tone is appreciative and cooperative.

utterances.text: Is your father in the habit of having naps ?
utterances.scene: One person asks another about their father's napping habits, possibly out of curiosity or to initiate a casual conversation. The tone is inquisitive.

utterances.text: Yes , all of us have naps .
utterances.scene: The second person confirms the habit, indicating that napping is common within their family, sharing personal information. The tone is factual and open.

utterances.text: Don't you feel dizzy when you have to get up ?
utterances.scene: The first person expresses a common concern or personal experience related to napping, showing curiosity about the other's experience. The tone is inquisitive and empathetic.

utterances.text: No , not at all .
utterances.scene: The second person dismisses the concern, stating that they do not experience dizziness after naps. The tone is reassuring and factual.

utterances.text: Excuse me . I need some storybooks in easy English . Do you have anything likethat ?
utterances.scene: A customer politely approaches a staff member, stating a specific need for easy English storybooks. The tone is polite and seeking assistance.

utterances.text: Well , there are a lot of storybooks upstairs in our children's section . Some are written for young children , others for teens . Maybe some of them will suit your needs .
utterances.scene: The staff member provides helpful information, directing the customer to a specific section and suggesting potential options. The tone is informative and helpful.

utterances.text: I'll go take a look . Thanks for your help .
utterances.scene: The customer accepts the advice and expresses gratitude for the assistance received. The tone is appreciative and decisive.

utterances.text: You're welcome .
utterances.scene: The staff member responds politely, acknowledging the customer's thanks. The tone is courteous.

utterances.text: Good morning . I need to speak with the property manager , please .
utterances.scene: A tenant politely initiates a call, requesting to speak with the property manager, likely to address an issue. The tone is formal and urgent.

utterances.text: Good morning . You are speaking to the property manager .
utterances.scene: The person on the other end identifies themselves as the property manager, confirming their role and readiness to assist. The tone is professional and direct.

utterances.text: While it was raining last night , water started leaking in from the ceiling .
utterances.scene: The tenant explains the problem directly, describing a water leak from the ceiling, indicating concern and a need for repair. The tone is factual and concerned.

utterances.text: Was it leaking in the bedroom ?
utterances.scene: The property manager asks for a specific detail to assess the severity and location of the leak, showing a problem-solving approach. The tone is inquisitive and practical.

utterances.text: It was in the living room .
utterances.scene: The tenant provides the requested specific location of the leak. The tone is factual and cooperative.

utterances.text: Can you tell me which floor you are on ?
utterances.scene: The property manager asks another detail to understand the building context of the leak, continuing the problem assessment. The tone is inquisitive and practical.

utterances.text: We are on the bottom floor .
utterances.scene: The tenant provides the requested floor information. The tone is factual and cooperative.

utterances.text: I would like to look at the leak . Will you be home this morning ?
utterances.scene: The property manager proposes a visit to inspect the leak and inquires about the tenant's availability, showing a proactive approach to resolving the issue. The tone is decisive and considerate.

utterances.text: Yes , someone will be here to let you in .
utterances.scene: The tenant confirms availability, assuring access for the property manager. The tone is cooperative and helpful.

utterances.text: Just in case you have to leave , we will just use the master key .
utterances.scene: The property manager provides an alternative access plan, preparing for contingencies and ensuring the issue can be addressed even if the tenant is absent. The tone is practical and reassuring.

utterances.text: How much is your last salary ?
utterances.scene: An interviewer asks a candidate about their previous salary, a standard question in a job interview to gauge expectations. The tone is formal and direct.

utterances.text: I have earned 10,000 a year including bonuses .
utterances.scene: The candidate provides their previous salary information, including bonuses, being factual and transparent. The tone is factual and professional.

utterances.text: How much do you want us to pay you ?
utterances.scene: The interviewer asks about the candidate's salary expectations for the new role, moving towards negotiation. The tone is direct and probing.

utterances.text: I like to be paid more than that . Hopefully , 150,000 a year . To be honest , I left the company to get more income .
utterances.scene: The candidate expresses a clear desire for a significant salary increase, stating their ambition and motivation for leaving their previous job. The tone is assertive, ambitious, and honest.

utterances.text: I hope you can help . I've got a bit of a problem with your ATM .
utterances.scene: A customer approaches a bank employee, expressing a problem with an ATM and hoping for assistance. The tone shows concern and a plea for help.

utterances.text: Of course , that's my job . Oh , dear . What's happened ?
utterances.scene: The bank employee reassures the customer, confirming their role in helping and expressing immediate concern about the problem. The tone is reassuring and empathetic.

utterances.text: Well , it's eaten my card ! It won't give it back !
utterances.scene: The customer explains the problem with distress, feeling frustrated and helpless that the ATM retained their card. The tone is distressed, frustrated, and urgent.

utterances.text: I see ... calm down , don't worry . May I ask what were you doing when it took your card ?
utterances.scene: The employee calms the distressed customer, reassuring them, and then asks for details to diagnose the issue. The tone is calming, reassuring, and investigative.

utterances.text: Yes . I was only entering my PIN . I'm terrible at remembering it , I'm so forgetful , you see .
utterances.scene: The customer explains their actions, admitting to a personal fault (forgetfulness) which might be related to the problem. The tone is slightly embarrassed and confessional.

utterances.text: Mmmm ... and exactly how many times did you enter it , please ?
utterances.scene: The employee asks a crucial follow-up question, suspecting a common cause for card retention based on the customer's admission. The tone is probing and analytical.

utterances.text: Maybe three times . As I said , I always forget it .
utterances.scene: The customer confirms the number of attempts, reiterating their forgetfulness and reinforcing the potential cause. The tone is slightly apologetic and self-deprecating.

utterances.text: Ah ! Don't worry ; it's just a security measure . If someone uses a card and cannot get the right PIN after three attempts , the bank keeps the card in case it's stolen . Just contact the bank and we'll get it back to you .
utterances.scene: The employee explains the situation, reassuring the customer that it's a standard security procedure and outlining the solution. The tone is highly reassuring, informative, and helpful.

utterances.text: Oh , I see . So if I call my branch they can sort everything out for me ?
utterances.scene: The customer expresses understanding and seeks confirmation of the solution, feeling relieved. The tone is relieved and seeking clarification.

utterances.text: Yes , they'll be happy to help . Believe me , it happens to many people .
utterances.scene: The employee confirms the solution and further reassures the customer by normalizing the experience. The tone is reassuring and empathetic.

utterances.text: I'd better try harder to memorise my PIN in future . Thanks .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses a resolve to prevent future incidents, showing personal accountability, and expresses gratitude. The tone is reflective, resolute, and thankful.

utterances.text: Is this the counter to pick up parcels ?
utterances.scene: A customer approaches a counter, politely inquiring if it's the correct place for parcel pickup. The tone is polite and inquisitive.

utterances.text: Yes , it is .
utterances.scene: The staff member confirms that the customer is at the correct counter. The tone is factual and helpful.

utterances.text: I want to pick up my parcels .
utterances.scene: The customer states their intention directly, ready to proceed with the service. The tone is direct and purposeful.

utterances.text: Please show me your parcel order .
utterances.scene: The staff member requests identification or proof of order to process the pickup. The tone is procedural and polite.

utterances.text: OK . Here you are .
utterances.scene: The customer complies with the request, presenting the necessary document. The tone is cooperative and obliging.

utterances.text: Let me check your parcel number . Song Ping's parcel number should be CP 06230221 5 CN . Here is your parcel .
utterances.scene: The staff member verifies the information, confirms the parcel number, and then hands over the parcel. The tone is procedural, factual, and efficient.

utterances.text: Thank you .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses gratitude for the completed service. The tone is appreciative.

utterances.text: Not at all .
utterances.scene: The staff member responds politely, indicating that it was no trouble. The tone is courteous.

utterances.text: Hi Brittany . What are you doing with all of your clothes on your bed ?
utterances.scene: A person (likely a sibling or close friend) casually greets Brittany and asks about the messy pile of clothes, showing curiosity. The tone is casual and inquisitive.

utterances.text: I'm trying to decide what to wear to school the first day .
utterances.scene: Brittany explains her current task, revealing a common teenage concern about appearance for a significant event. The tone is focused and slightly overwhelmed.

utterances.text: Oh , A . Mom didn't tell you ?
utterances.scene: The other person reacts with surprise and hints at important information Brittany doesn't know, creating suspense. The tone is teasing and knowing.

utterances.text: Didn't tell me what ? What ?
utterances.scene: Brittany reacts with confusion and growing impatience, demanding to know the secret. The tone is confused, impatient, and eager.

utterances.text: This Bs ' school you're going to is going to make your life easy .
utterances.scene: The other person continues to tease, giving a vague but positive hint about the secret, building anticipation. The tone is playful and knowing.

utterances.text: What are you talking about brother ? Spill it .
utterances.scene: Brittany, now more frustrated, demands her brother reveal the information directly. The tone is exasperated and demanding.

utterances.text: Uniforms , sis , no more worrying about appearances !
utterances.scene: The brother finally reveals the secret, explaining the benefit of school uniforms, possibly with a hint of triumph or relief. The tone is revealing and somewhat triumphant.

utterances.text: You mean I have to wear the same thing every day ? MOM !
utterances.scene: Brittany reacts with shock and dismay to the news of uniforms, feeling her freedom of choice is gone, and calls out to her mother in protest. The tone is shocked, dismayed, and protesting.

utterances.text: What would you like for your main dish ?
utterances.scene: A server asks a customer for their main course order in a restaurant setting. The tone is polite and professional.

utterances.text: Steak , please .
utterances.scene: The customer places their order for the main dish. The tone is direct and polite.

utterances.text: How would you like it ?
utterances.scene: The server asks a follow-up question regarding the preparation preference for the steak. The tone is professional and clarifying.

utterances.text: Medium rare , please .
utterances.scene: The customer specifies their preference for the steak's cooking. The tone is direct and polite.

utterances.text: Anything else , sir ?
utterances.scene: The server asks if the customer would like to order anything additional, offering further service. The tone is polite and attentive.

utterances.text: May I have a glass of red wine , please ?
utterances.scene: The customer requests a drink. The tone is polite and formal.

utterances.text: Of course .
utterances.scene: The server confirms the drink order will be fulfilled. The tone is agreeable and helpful.

utterances.text: Mr . Smith , do you like the hotel we booked ?
utterances.scene: A host or travel agent politely asks Mr. Smith for feedback on the hotel they arranged, showing concern for his satisfaction. The tone is polite and solicitous.

utterances.text: Yes , we do . We like it very much .
utterances.scene: Mr. Smith provides positive feedback, expressing strong satisfaction with the hotel. The tone is enthusiastic and appreciative.

utterances.text: I've come to make sure that your stay in Beijing is a pleasant one .
utterances.scene: The host explains their purpose for checking in, emphasizing their dedication to ensuring a good experience for Mr. Smith. The tone is caring and professional.

utterances.text: Thank you so much .
utterances.scene: Mr. Smith expresses strong gratitude for the host's thoughtfulness and care. The tone is deeply appreciative.

utterances.text: David , we have been doing business for three years , haven't we ?
utterances.scene: A business professional initiates a conversation with a long-standing partner, establishing rapport and recalling their successful history.

utterances.text: Yes , I'm glad we've had very pleasant cooperation in the previous years . And your achievement for promoting our clothes was great in the three years .
utterances.scene: The second speaker affirms the positive relationship and acknowledges the partner's past achievements with a satisfied and appreciative tone.

utterances.text: So , I wish to apply for the sole agency of your product in our local market . If you give us the agency , that will be more substantial for our cooperation .
utterances.scene: The first speaker, encouraged by the positive history, confidently proposes an expansion of their business, seeking a sole agency for a product.

utterances.text: To be frank , you are not the only one who applies for an agent for us in your country . I'd like to know some ideas of terms on which you would be willing to operate as our agent .
utterances.scene: The second speaker, while acknowledging the proposal, reveals competitive interest and requests specific terms for the potential agency, maintaining a professional and cautious stance.

utterances.text: As we are a well-established company , we are very familiar with the customers ' needs . Besides , we can make full use of our good connections with the wholesalers and retailers here and develop a good market for your products if appointed as your agent .
utterances.scene: The first speaker confidently presents their company's strengths and market advantages to support their application, highlighting their expertise and connections.

utterances.text: Sounds reasonable . I will tell my boss about you agent application . Another question , what do you think is the minimum annual sales you can guarantee ?
utterances.scene: The second speaker finds the arguments compelling, promising to relay the information, but then shifts to a key financial inquiry regarding sales guarantees, maintaining a business-focused approach.

utterances.text: To be on the safe side , and for garment of all materials , sizes , and styles , I think the amount will be 50,000 pieces a year .
utterances.scene: The first speaker provides a conservative and realistic annual sales estimate, emphasizing prudence and safety in their commitment.

utterances.text: Well . As our sole agency , you will neither handle the same or similar products of other origins nor re-export our goods to any other area outside your own .
utterances.scene: The second speaker outlines crucial exclusivity conditions for the sole agency, setting clear boundaries for the proposed partnership.

utterances.text: No , certainly not .
utterances.scene: The first speaker promptly and firmly agrees to the stated conditions, indicating full acceptance and commitment to the terms.

utterances.text: Excuse me .
utterances.scene: A customer politely initiates a conversation, seeking assistance or expressing an issue.

utterances.text: Yes ?
utterances.scene: A staff member or recipient acknowledges the interruption and invites the speaker to state their purpose, showing readiness to help.

utterances.text: I bought this circulator here yesterday but it doesn't work .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses frustration and disappointment as they report a product purchased recently is not functioning.

utterances.text: Oh , let's see what's wrong .
utterances.scene: The staff member expresses concern and immediately offers to investigate the problem, showing helpfulness and a problem-solving attitude.

utterances.text: Where can I find the produce ?
utterances.scene: A customer is in a store and asks for directions to a specific section.

utterances.text: Aisle A is where you'll find all the produce .
utterances.scene: A store employee or helpful individual provides clear directions to the requested section.

utterances.text: What sales do they have today ?
utterances.scene: The customer then inquires about any current promotional offers or sales.

utterances.text: I'm sure something is on sale . Please check with the produce person .
utterances.scene: The employee, unsure of specific sales, suggests consulting another staff member for precise information, indicating helpfulness but also limited direct knowledge.

utterances.text: Hello , this is Steven from Blue Sky Co . May I speak to Mr . James ?
utterances.scene: A sales representative introduces himself and asks to speak with a specific client over the phone.

utterances.text: Speaking .
utterances.scene: The requested individual confirms their identity, indicating they are ready to proceed with the conversation.

utterances.text: Excuse my troubling you . You purchased our products last year and now I am following up to find out about their workings . Are they still in good condition now ?
utterances.scene: The sales representative apologizes for the interruption and proceeds to follow up on a past purchase, inquiring about the product's current condition.

utterances.text: Yeah , exactly ! I bought them last year . En ... at present , they are still in good state .
utterances.scene: The client confirms the purchase and expresses satisfaction with the product's current good condition, sounding pleased.

utterances.text: That's it ! All of them have first-class quality and performance . Besides , we adopt advanced technology . Now we have developed new products . They are much better than what you have bought .
utterances.scene: The sales representative reinforces the product's quality and then transitions into a subtle sales pitch, introducing newer, improved products.

utterances.text: Your company is developing so fast . Maybe later on I will plan to buy more .
utterances.scene: The client expresses admiration for the company's progress and indicates potential future interest in purchasing more products, showing a positive impression.

utterances.text: That's great ! Thanks for your support . If any , please remember to call us . I am afraid I have to say goodbye now ! Bye , Mr . James !
utterances.scene: The sales representative expresses gratitude for the client's support, encourages future contact, and politely concludes the call.

utterances.text: Bye !
utterances.scene: The client politely returns the farewell, ending the conversation.

utterances.text: Ms.Dawson , I need you to take a dictation for me .
utterances.scene: A superior gives a direct instruction to an assistant, signaling the start of a new task.

utterances.text: Yes , sir ...
utterances.scene: The assistant respectfully acknowledges the instruction, indicating readiness to comply.

utterances.text: This should go out as an intra-office memorandum to all employees by this afternoon.Are you ready ?
