utterances.scene: An excited and grateful reaction to the unexpected and appealing offer, immediately leading to a decision to pursue the opportunity. The speaker feels amazed and motivated.

utterances.text: Ahem ... uh , sir , I beg your pardon ... Uh , mister , are you waiting to buy a ticket for the movie ?
utterances.scene: A hesitant and polite attempt to address someone, indicating a potential concern or question, but delivered with a cautious and deferential tone.

utterances.text: What's it look like , lady ? This is the ticket line I'm standing in , isn't it ?
utterances.scene: A rude and dismissive response, showing impatience and annoyance, clearly indicating the speaker's displeasure at being questioned.

utterances.text: Well , yes , it is , but ...
utterances.scene: A flustered and somewhat intimidated acknowledgment, attempting to continue the original point despite the rude interruption, indicating discomfort.

utterances.text: So , what's your beef anyway , lady ?
utterances.scene: An aggressive and confrontational demand for the underlying issue, showing no respect and an escalating tone of hostility.

utterances.text: You just cut into line , in front of me and everyone else , that's what ! Go take your place back at the end of the line , like every - one else !
utterances.scene: An indignant and angry accusation, clearly stating the perceived offense and demanding corrective action, expressing strong disapproval of line-cutting.

utterances.text: Oh sure , lady , and fat chance I'd get a ticket before they're sold out . I'm staying right here , understand ? So be a nice lady and butt out !
utterances.scene: A defiant and selfish refusal to comply, expressing a fear of missing out and aggressively telling the other person to mind their own business. The tone is confrontational and rude.

utterances.text: Just what gives you the right ... ?
utterances.scene: An exasperated and questioning challenge to the other person's entitlement, expressing disbelief and frustration at their behavior.

utterances.text: Because I'm no sucker ; only suckers go to the end of the line . It's as simple as that , lady .
utterances.scene: A self-righteous and arrogant justification for line-cutting, framing it as a smart move and dismissing those who follow rules as 'suckers.' The tone is contemptuous.

utterances.text: Well , you're no gentleman , either .
utterances.scene: A retort expressing disgust and disapproval of the man's behavior, attacking his character in response to his rudeness and selfishness.

utterances.text: Okay , lady , just to show what a gentleman I really am , I'll let you go in front of me . Now , just buy your ticket and shut your trap , will you , lady ?
utterances.scene: A sarcastic and condescending offer, masquerading as politeness but delivered with underlying hostility and a demand for silence. The man is being manipulative.

utterances.text: Whew ! I got the last one . This must be my lucky day !
utterances.scene: A relieved and triumphant exclamation, celebrating a stroke of luck in securing the last ticket, unaware of the immediate consequence for the other person.

utterances.text: What was that you just said ? Last one ... ? Hey , they've closed the ticket window !
utterances.scene: A sudden realization and panicked outburst, expressing shock and disbelief upon hearing about the last ticket and seeing the window close, indicating growing distress.

utterances.text: Yes , I'm afraid I bought the last ticket , and to think , if you hadn't been such a gentleman . . .
utterances.scene: A smug and mocking confirmation, rubbing in the man's misfortune and highlighting the irony of his earlier 'gentlemanly' act, expressing satisfaction.

utterances.text: Lady ! This is unfair ! I've been cheated ! I was in line before you.That should have been my ticket ! Come on , hand it over , lady !
utterances.scene: An outraged and furious demand, expressing a strong sense of injustice and entitlement, believing he was cheated and demanding the ticket back. The tone is aggressive and desperate.

utterances.text: Gentleman ! Hah ! Fat chance ! Hah ! Eat your heart out , sucker ! Hah !
utterances.scene: A triumphant and mocking taunt, reveling in the man's defeat and insultingly dismissing him, showing complete satisfaction and a sense of victory.

utterances.text: May I help you ?
utterances.scene: A polite and standard offer of assistance, likely from a service provider to a customer at a gas station.

utterances.text: Yes . Fill it up , please .
utterances.scene: A direct and common request from a customer at a gas station, indicating the desired service.

utterances.text: Premium or regular ?
utterances.scene: A clarifying question from the service provider, asking about the customer's preference for gasoline type.

utterances.text: Regular , please .
utterances.scene: A clear and polite response from the customer, specifying their choice of gasoline.

utterances.text: Anything else , sir ? Should I check the water and the oil ?
utterances.scene: An additional offer of service from the attendant, showing attentiveness and offering maintenance checks beyond just fueling.

utterances.text: Yes , please .
utterances.scene: A simple and polite acceptance of the additional service offer, indicating the customer's agreement.

utterances.text: Darling , the airplane is going to take off . I have to go .
utterances.scene: A tender and slightly regretful farewell, as one partner informs the other that departure is imminent, expressing the necessity of leaving.

utterances.text: Take care ! I will miss you so much .
utterances.scene: A loving and emotional farewell from the partner being left behind, expressing deep affection and sadness at the impending separation.

utterances.text: Is there anything I can do for you ?
utterances.scene: A polite and standard offer of assistance, likely from a service provider to a customer, indicating readiness to help.

utterances.text: I haver run out of gas .
utterances.scene: A direct and concise statement of a problem, indicating the immediate need for assistance, likely at a gas station or roadside service.

utterances.text: What kind of oil do you want ?
utterances.scene: A clarifying question from the service provider, asking about the customer's preference for gasoline type, understanding 'gas' as 'fuel'.

utterances.text: Premium , please . By the way , please don't fill it up . Two gallons will be fine .
utterances.scene: A specific and polite request from the customer, detailing the type and quantity of fuel desired, indicating a partial fill-up.

utterances.text: No problem .
utterances.scene: A confident and reassuring response from the service provider, indicating readiness and ability to fulfill the request.

utterances.text: I'm starving . Let's get something to eat .
utterances.scene: An expression of immediate hunger and a suggestion to find food, indicating a desire to eat soon.

utterances.text: Can we go somewhere nearby ? I don't feel like walking too far .
utterances.scene: A request for convenience, expressing a preference for a close location due to a lack of desire to walk much, indicating fatigue or laziness.

utterances.text: Sure . What kind of food do you like ?
utterances.scene: An accommodating response, agreeing to the proximity request and then inquiring about food preferences to narrow down options.

utterances.text: I mean the food for something spicy .
utterances.scene: A specific expression of craving for a particular taste, indicating a desire for spicy food.

utterances.text: How about some Korean food ? There's a place right there on the corner .
utterances.scene: A specific suggestion for a restaurant type that fits the criteria (spicy, nearby), offering a concrete option.

utterances.text: That sounds great . I love Korean food .
utterances.scene: An enthusiastic and positive acceptance of the suggestion, expressing strong approval and personal liking for the proposed cuisine.

utterances.text: May I help you , madam ?
utterances.scene: A polite and standard offer of assistance from a sales associate to a customer in a retail setting, likely a jewelry store.

utterances.text: Yes . I ’ m trying to find a pair of earrings to match my necklace . Can you recommend some to me ?
utterances.scene: A specific request from a customer, seeking assistance in finding matching jewelry and asking for recommendations.

utterances.text: Yes . Your gold necklace has a diamond pendant , and your eardrops should be
utterances.scene: A helpful and knowledgeable response from the sales associate, demonstrating expertise and beginning to offer a tailored recommendation based on the customer's existing jewelry.

utterances.text: These look wonderful . Do these come with a guarantee of quality ?
utterances.scene: An appreciative comment on the suggested items, followed by a practical question about product assurance and quality, indicating a positive impression but also caution.

utterances.text: Of course . If there is anything wrong with them , you can come back and show me the guarantee of quality , and then you will surely get free service .
utterances.scene: A confident and reassuring affirmation of product quality and after-sales service, aiming to build trust and encourage the purchase.

utterances.text: I ’ ll take them .
utterances.scene: A straightforward decision to purchase the items, indicating satisfaction with the product and the assurance provided.

utterances.text: I ’ Ve lost my purse .
utterances.scene: A distressed and worried statement, expressing the unfortunate event of losing a personal item, indicating concern.

utterances.text: Oh , dear . What was in it ?
utterances.scene: A sympathetic and concerned response, inquiring about the contents of the lost item to assess the severity of the loss.

utterances.text: All my money .
utterances.scene: A brief and somber revelation, highlighting the significant financial impact of the loss, expressing further distress.

utterances.text: Well . Go to the police station and see if it ’ s there .
utterances.scene: A practical and helpful suggestion, offering a course of action to potentially recover the lost item, providing guidance.

utterances.text: Royal Hotel , can I help you ?
utterances.scene: A professional and standard greeting from a hotel receptionist, offering assistance to a caller.

utterances.text: Yes . I urgently need a room for tomorrow night , and do you have any vacancies ?
utterances.scene: An urgent and direct inquiry from a caller, expressing an immediate need for accommodation and checking availability.

utterances.text: Yes , we have . What kind of room would you like ?
utterances.scene: A positive and accommodating response from the hotel, confirming availability and then inquiring about the caller's specific preferences.

utterances.text: I'd like a suite with an ocean view , please .
utterances.scene: A specific and polite request from the caller, detailing their desired room type and amenities, indicating a preference for luxury.

utterances.text: No problem , sir .
utterances.scene: A confident and reassuring response from the hotel, confirming that the request can be fulfilled easily, indicating good service.

utterances.text: Come in , please .
utterances.scene: A polite invitation to enter, setting a welcoming tone for the start of an important meeting, likely a job interview.

utterances.text: Good morning ! I am Anna Lu . I've come for an interview which was arranged .
utterances.scene: A formal and polite self-introduction, stating the purpose of the visit, indicating readiness for a job interview.

utterances.text: Oh , I see . I am Jack White , Personnel Manager . Take a seat , please .
utterances.scene: A professional acknowledgment and self-introduction from the interviewer, followed by an invitation to sit, setting a formal yet hospitable tone.

utterances.text: Glad to meet you , Mr . White .
utterances.scene: A polite and formal expression of pleasure at meeting the interviewer, maintaining a professional and respectful demeanor.

utterances.text: Miss Lu , have you got any experience in restaurant service ?
utterances.scene: The interviewer initiating the core of the job interview by asking about relevant work experience, focusing on specific skills.

utterances.text: Yes . Since I entered college , I have been working at a fast food restaurant as a part-time waitress .
utterances.scene: A confident and detailed response from the interviewee, confirming experience and providing specific context about their part-time work.

utterances.text: For how long ?
utterances.scene: A follow-up question from the interviewer, seeking more specific details about the duration of the interviewee's experience.

utterances.text: 3 years .
utterances.scene: A concise and direct answer from the interviewee, providing the requested information clearly.

utterances.text: Our restaurant receives a lot of foreign customers . Can you serve them in English ?
utterances.scene: The interviewer probing further into specific skills, particularly language proficiency relevant to the restaurant's clientele.

utterances.text: That's why I applied for this job . Now I am studying Hotel English in my college , and I am quite familiar with the western courtesy and restaurant etiquette . I am sure my public relation skills will leave a strong impression on your customers .
utterances.scene: An enthusiastic and confident response from the interviewee, highlighting their relevant education, cultural knowledge, and strong public relations skills, directly addressing the interviewer's concern and showcasing suitability.

utterances.text: You must know our working hours are very long and overtime work is frequent .
utterances.scene: The interviewer presenting a potential challenge or drawback of the job, ensuring the interviewee is aware of the demanding working conditions.

utterances.text: I don't mind that .
utterances.scene: A resolute and accepting response from the interviewee, indicating willingness to handle the demanding work schedule, showing commitment.

utterances.text: I think I will give you a 3 months ’ trial . The salary for this period is 800 yuan a month with no bonus . After that period if we both feel satisfied , a formal contract would be signed .
utterances.scene: The interviewer making a job offer with specific terms and conditions, including a trial period and potential for a formal contract, concluding the negotiation.

utterances.text: When am I supposed to start working ?
utterances.scene: A practical and eager question from the interviewee, indicating acceptance of the offer and readiness to begin employment.

utterances.text: Next monday . Bring your resume and diploma with you .
utterances.scene: The interviewer providing specific instructions for the start date and required documents, finalizing the onboarding process.

utterances.text: Yes , I will . Thank you , Mr . White . Goodbye !
utterances.scene: A polite and grateful acceptance of the instructions and the job offer, expressing appreciation and formally concluding the interview.

utterances.text: Goodbye !
utterances.scene: A polite and formal farewell from the interviewer, concluding the interaction.

utterances.text: Don't tell me you're pregnant again .
utterances.scene: A speaker expresses a strong, potentially exasperated or surprised, reaction to a potential pregnancy announcement, suggesting a previous or repeated occurrence. The tone is likely one of disbelief or concern.

utterances.text: I'm afraid so .
utterances.scene: The second speaker confirms the pregnancy, using a phrase that indicates a reluctant or apologetic emotional state, possibly due to the first speaker's reaction or the circumstances of the pregnancy.

utterances.text: What do you think of this dress ? Do you think it suits me ?
utterances.scene: A shopper is asking for an opinion on a dress, seeking validation and advice from a companion, showing a desire to look good.

utterances.text: Sure . Why don ’ t you try it on ? The fitting room is over there .
utterances.scene: The companion offers practical advice and encouragement, suggesting the next step in the shopping process, with a helpful and supportive tone.

utterances.text: It ’ s just the right size-a perfect fit ! Have you seen anything you like ?
utterances.scene: The shopper expresses satisfaction and excitement about the dress fitting well, then shifts to inquire about the companion's shopping progress, showing shared interest.

utterances.text: I ’ m thinking about buying this sweater . I know it ’ s June now , but it will be perfect for autumn and winter .
utterances.scene: The companion shares their own shopping consideration, demonstrating foresight and practical planning despite the current season.

utterances.text: It looks too big for you , but I like the color and the material is good quality . Is it on sale ?
utterances.scene: The shopper offers an honest but mixed opinion on the companion's choice, noting a potential fit issue but appreciating other qualities, and then asks about the price, indicating practical consideration.

utterances.text: Yes , it ’ s half price . It ’ s supposed to be too large--that ’ s the fashion .
utterances.scene: The companion confirms the sale price, expressing satisfaction with the discount, and explains the oversized fit as a fashion trend, showing confidence in their choice.

utterances.text: I might get one too , but in a different color . I prefer light blue to white 。
utterances.scene: The shopper, influenced by the companion's choice and the sale, considers purchasing a similar item, expressing a personal preference for color.

utterances.text: There.It looks great , don ’ t you think ? I ’ m going to get these jeans as well . I need a new pair . I ‘ m also going to buy this scarf ready for winter .
utterances.scene: The shopper expresses strong satisfaction with their own choices, seeking validation, and enthusiastically announces multiple purchases, anticipating future needs.

utterances.text: I ’ m getting this beret ? Doesn ’ t it look cool ? I ’ d like to get some jeans too , but I don ’ t have enough cash on me .
utterances.scene: The companion expresses excitement about a beret, seeking affirmation, but then reveals a financial constraint for another desired item, showing a mix of joy and disappointment.

utterances.text: Don ’ t worry . I ’ Ve got my credit card . You can pay me back later .
utterances.scene: The shopper offers a generous and reassuring solution to the companion's financial problem, demonstrating kindness and support.

utterances.text: Thanks ! Now I don ’ t need to come back to the shop a second time .
utterances.scene: The companion expresses heartfelt gratitude and relief, appreciating the convenience and avoiding a return trip.

utterances.text: Good morning . Wilson Association .
utterances.scene: A professional greeting from an organization, indicating the start of a formal business call.

utterances.text: This is Mr Brown speaking . I'd like to speak to Mr . Thomas , please .
utterances.scene: Mr. Brown identifies himself and states his purpose, requesting to speak with a specific person in a polite, formal manner.

utterances.text: I'm sorry , but Mr.Thomas left the office a few minutes ago .
utterances.scene: The receptionist apologetically informs Mr. Brown that the person he wishes to speak to is unavailable, conveying regret.

utterances.text: That's bad ! I've been trying to call him for the last ten minutes , but your line has been busy . Will he be back soon ?
utterances.scene: Mr. Brown expresses frustration and disappointment, explaining his previous attempts and inquiring about Mr. Thomas's return, indicating urgency.

utterances.text: I'm afraid not . He's gone for the rest of the day .
utterances.scene: The receptionist delivers further bad news, confirming Mr. Thomas's extended absence, with an apologetic tone.

utterances.text: Is there anywhere I can reach him ?
utterances.scene: Mr. Brown, still urgent, tries to find an alternative way to contact Mr. Thomas, showing persistence.

utterances.text: I don't believe so . He's going out of town on business . May I take a message ?
utterances.scene: The receptionist confirms Mr. Thomas's complete unavailability due to travel, then offers to take a message, providing a helpful alternative.

utterances.text: I have a business appointment with him for tomorrow morning at ten o'clock , but I'm afraid I can't make it .
utterances.scene: Mr. Brown explains the reason for his urgency, revealing he needs to cancel an upcoming appointment, expressing regret.

utterances.text: Would you care to make another appointment ?
utterances.scene: The receptionist offers to reschedule, demonstrating a helpful and proactive approach to assist Mr. Brown.

utterances.text: Unfortunately , I'm leaving town rather unexpectedly , and I may be gone for several days .
utterances.scene: Mr. Brown explains why rescheduling immediately is difficult, citing unexpected travel, conveying further regret and inconvenience.

utterances.text: I see . I can tell Mr.Thomas that you phoned .
utterances.scene: The receptionist acknowledges the situation and offers to pass on the message, confirming a basic helpful action.

utterances.text: Thank you .
utterances.scene: Mr. Brown expresses gratitude for the receptionist's assistance, despite not fully resolving his issue.

utterances.text: Bye-bye .
utterances.scene: A polite and professional closing to the phone call.

utterances.text: I see you have bought the latest copy of “ beauty and fashion ” . Are there any interesting articles in it ?
utterances.scene: One person notices a magazine and expresses curiosity, initiating a conversation about its content, showing interest in shared hobbies.

utterances.text: There ’ s an interesting interview with a top fashion designer about the latest fashions . I enjoyed reading her thought . The “ which ? ” section is very interesting this month . They tested facial cleaners . The article recommends “ all clear ” for effectiveness and price .
utterances.scene: The magazine owner enthusiastically shares details about interesting articles, expressing enjoyment and providing specific recommendations, indicating satisfaction with the content.

utterances.text: I like to take the tests that they print in this magazine .
utterances.scene: The first speaker shifts the conversation to a specific enjoyable feature of the magazine, indicating a personal preference and a lighthearted interest.

utterances.text: Which tests do you mean ?
utterances.scene: The magazine owner seeks clarification on the type of tests, showing curiosity and engagement in the conversation.

utterances.text: You know . Tests like ” how jealous are you ? ” and “ are you a fashion victim ? ”
utterances.scene: The first speaker provides examples of the tests, highlighting their introspective or self-assessment nature in a casual tone.

utterances.text: Oh , I see . I like to do those tests , too , but I don ’ t take them seriously .
utterances.scene: The magazine owner acknowledges understanding, agrees to enjoying the tests, but clarifies a lighthearted approach, indicating a balanced perspective.

utterances.text: Of course not , but sometimes the results make you think about yourself and what you do . According to the jealousy test , I ’ m quite a jealous type of person . Perhaps I need to control my jealousy .
utterances.scene: The first speaker agrees about the lightheartedness but then reveals a personal insight gained from a test, expressing self-reflection and a desire for self-improvement, showing a thoughtful and vulnerable side.

utterances.text: Marry Wang's Office , this is Marry .
utterances.scene: Marry answers the phone professionally, identifying herself and her office, setting a formal tone for a business call.

utterances.text: Hi Marry , this is Tom .
utterances.scene: Tom identifies himself, greeting Marry in a slightly more informal but still professional manner, suggesting familiarity.

utterances.text: How can I help you ?
utterances.scene: Marry offers assistance, maintaining a professional and helpful demeanor, inviting Tom to state his purpose.

utterances.text: I need to see if we can get together today .
utterances.scene: Tom states his immediate need to meet, indicating a sense of urgency for a discussion or collaboration.

utterances.text: Put on the helmet , please .
utterances.scene: A guide or supervisor gives a direct instruction, emphasizing safety in an industrial or hazardous environment.

utterances.text: Do we need to put on the jackets too ?
utterances.scene: A visitor asks for clarification on safety procedures, showing attentiveness and concern for protection.

utterances.text: You ’ d better , to protect your clothes . Now please watch your step .
utterances.scene: The guide confirms the necessity of jackets for clothing protection and adds another safety warning, maintaining a cautious and instructive tone.

utterances.text: Thank you . Is the production line fully automated ?
utterances.scene: The visitor expresses gratitude for the safety advice and then shifts to a technical question about the facility, showing curiosity and interest.

utterances.text: Well , not fully automated .
utterances.scene: The guide provides a direct but qualified answer to the technical question, giving accurate information.

utterances.text: I see . How do you control the quality ?
utterances.scene: The visitor acknowledges the information and follows up with another question, demonstrating continued interest in the operational details and quality assurance.

utterances.text: All products have to go through five checks in the whole manufacturing process .
utterances.scene: The guide explains the rigorous quality control process, providing specific details to reassure the visitor.

utterances.text: What ’ s the monthly output ?
utterances.scene: The visitor asks about the production volume, showing interest in the scale and efficiency of the operation.

utterances.text: One thousand units per month now . But we ’ ll be making 1,200 units beginning with October .
utterances.scene: The guide provides current and future production figures, indicating growth and planning, showing transparency.

utterances.text: What ’ s your usual percentage of rejects ?
utterances.scene: The visitor inquires about the defect rate, showing a keen interest in quality and efficiency metrics.

utterances.text: About 2 % in normal operations .
utterances.scene: The guide provides a specific, low percentage for rejects, indicating high quality and efficient operations with a confident tone.

utterances.text: That ’ s wonderful . Is that where the finished products come off ?
utterances.scene: The visitor expresses admiration for the low reject rate and then asks about the final stage of production, showing continued engagement and interest.

utterances.text: Yes . Shall we take a break now ?
utterances.scene: The guide confirms the location and then suggests a break, indicating the tour might be nearing a point of pause or completion.

utterances.text: Excuse me . May I take you a picture ?
utterances.scene: A person politely asks for permission to take a photograph of another person, showing respect and a friendly approach.

utterances.text: With pleasure .
utterances.scene: The other person graciously grants permission, expressing willingness and cooperation.

utterances.text: Thanks you . Shall we stand a bit further ? I would like to take the tower in .
utterances.scene: The photographer expresses gratitude and then makes a polite suggestion to adjust positioning, explaining the compositional reason, showing a thoughtful approach.

utterances.text: No problem .
utterances.scene: The person being photographed readily agrees to the suggestion, showing continued cooperation.

utterances.text: That's OK . If you want the photo I will mail it to you .
utterances.scene: The photographer indicates the photo has been taken successfully and offers to share it, demonstrating kindness and generosity.

utterances.text: No need , sir .
utterances.scene: The person politely declines the offer to receive the photo, perhaps out of modesty or convenience, maintaining politeness.

utterances.text: Hello . This is the Directory Assistance . Can I help you ?
utterances.scene: A professional greeting from a directory assistance service, offering help in a formal context.

utterances.text: Can you give me the number for Jessica Hanson on locks Ave ?
utterances.scene: A caller makes a direct request for a phone number, providing specific details.

utterances.text: I ’ m sorry . There is no listing under that name . Are you sure of the name ?
utterances.scene: The directory assistance operator apologetically states that the name is not listed and asks for verification, showing helpfulness despite the initial setback.

utterances.text: Yes , I ’ m pretty sure .
utterances.scene: The caller confidently reaffirms the name, indicating certainty despite the system's finding.

utterances.text: Do you have her address ?
utterances.scene: The operator asks for more information to aid the search, demonstrating persistence in trying to help.

utterances.text: Yes , I do . It ’ s 109 Locks Ave , L8V 4N9 .
utterances.scene: The caller provides the full address, hoping it will lead to the desired information.

utterances.text: That ’ s an unlisted number . I ’ m sorry , but I can ’ t give it to you .
utterances.scene: The operator delivers the final disappointing news, explaining the reason for inability to provide the number, maintaining an apologetic and professional tone.

utterances.text: I see . Thanks anyway .
utterances.scene: The caller expresses understanding and gratitude despite the unsuccessful outcome, showing politeness.

utterances.text: No problem .
utterances.scene: The operator responds politely, acknowledging the caller's gratitude and maintaining a helpful demeanor.

utterances.text: I ’ d like to open a savings account . Can you tell me how to do it ?
utterances.scene: A customer expresses a clear intention to open a savings account and requests instructions, showing a desire to understand the process.

utterances.text: Ok , you have to fill out the form . And I let me see three identification cards or documents .
utterances.scene: The bank employee provides the initial steps, specifying required actions and documents, in a clear and instructional tone.

utterances.text: I have the driver ’ s license , a membership card and my passport . Would we do ?
utterances.scene: The customer lists available identification documents and asks for confirmation if they are sufficient, showing preparedness and seeking validation.

utterances.text: Let me see them . Yes . There ’ re ok .
utterances.scene: The bank employee requests to inspect the documents and then confirms their acceptability, providing reassurance.

utterances.text: What ‘ s the minimum amount I can deposit in an account ?
utterances.scene: The customer asks about a specific financial detail, showing a practical concern about the account's requirements.

utterances.text: You can deposit and ensure amount of ten dollars .
utterances.scene: The bank employee provides the specific minimum deposit amount, giving clear financial information.

utterances.text: Thank you .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses gratitude for the information and assistance, showing politeness.

utterances.text: We are willing to participate in the bid which you advertised in China Daily . Would you please tell me the detail of the tender conditions ?
utterances.scene: A representative expresses their company's willingness to participate in a bid and politely requests detailed tender conditions, showing keen interest.

utterances.text: You will receive the tender notice next month and you'll find the information .
utterances.scene: The other party informs them about the upcoming tender notice and where to find the details, providing a clear timeline.

utterances.text: OK ! Our company is very interested in the tender . I am sure that we will do our best to win the bidding in building the factory .
utterances.scene: The representative expresses strong enthusiasm and commitment to winning the bid, conveying confidence and determination.

utterances.text: I believe your corporation will try your best and I understand fully your feeling , if your tender conditions proved be suitable for our general conditions of tender , we will accept your submission of tender .
utterances.scene: The other party acknowledges the representative's enthusiasm and explains the criteria for acceptance, maintaining a professional yet empathetic tone.

utterances.text: Maybe I have asking too many questions today .
utterances.scene: The representative expresses a slight concern about asking too many questions, showing politeness and consideration.

utterances.text: That's all right . You can contact me later if you have other questions after you read the tender notice .
utterances.scene: The other party reassures the representative, encouraging future contact and maintaining an open, helpful stance.

utterances.text: Fine , thanks a lot . Bye !
utterances.scene: The representative expresses gratitude and politely ends the conversation, satisfied with the interaction.

utterances.text: Bye !
utterances.scene: The other party reciprocates the polite closing, ending the call professionally.

utterances.text: Good morning , Mr Zhang , I wonder whether you have got an answer from your superior .
utterances.scene: A formal business meeting or call is starting, with one party politely inquiring about a pending decision from the other's superior, indicating an expectant and professional tone.

utterances.text: Yes , we had a meting about it yesterday afternoon .
utterances.scene: The second party confirms that a meeting took place, providing a factual update in a straightforward manner.

utterances.text: What's the answer ?
utterances.scene: The first party, eager to know the outcome, directly asks for the decision, maintaining a professional yet expectant tone.

utterances.text: We decided that we could agree to your price , but we are a bit worried about the slow delivery .
utterances.scene: The second party delivers the good news about the price agreement but immediately introduces a concern about delivery speed, expressing a balanced mix of agreement and worry.

utterances.text: Let me see . I quoted your delivery in three months , didn't I ?
utterances.scene: The first party reflects on their original quote, showing a slightly surprised or reflective tone as they recall the previously stated delivery terms.

utterances.text: Yes , but we hope that the wool could reach us as soon as possible .
utterances.scene: The second party reiterates their desire for faster delivery, emphasizing their hope and the urgency of the situation.

utterances.text: I thought you would be worried about it . So I rang Auckland last night . As you are our biggest customer , they agreed to ship the order on the first vessel available that will leave Auckland next month .
utterances.scene: The first party reveals they anticipated this concern and proactively arranged a solution, conveying a sense of preparedness and customer service, aiming to reassure the client.

utterances.text: Good , if you agree we'll draft the agreement right away and sign it then .
utterances.scene: The second party expresses satisfaction with the solution and proposes to finalize the agreement immediately, indicating relief and readiness to proceed.

utterances.text: By all means .
utterances.scene: The first party wholeheartedly agrees to finalize the deal, showing complete assent and a positive conclusion to the negotiation.

utterances.text: Be careful . The floor is wet .
utterances.scene: One person issues a direct warning to another, expressing concern for their safety due to a visible hazard.

utterances.text: What happened ?
utterances.scene: The second person, upon hearing the warning, expresses curiosity about the cause of the hazard.

utterances.text: I spilled my drink .
utterances.scene: The first person provides a simple, direct explanation for the wet floor, admitting to an accidental spill.

utterances.text: Hello , this is Lucie Jing calling from Lincoln Bank . May I speak to Mr Was , please ?
utterances.scene: A bank representative makes a formal and polite cold call, introducing herself and requesting to speak to a specific client.

utterances.text: Speaking .
utterances.scene: The intended recipient answers directly, indicating he is the person being sought, in a concise and neutral tone.

utterances.text: Ah , hello , Mr Was . I'm just calling about your new credit card . It has arrived with us , so you can either come to collect it , or we can send it on to you .
utterances.scene: The bank representative, after confirming the identity, explains the purpose of her call regarding a new credit card, offering collection or delivery options in a helpful and informative manner.

utterances.text: Sending it won't be necessary . I'm actually coming in for a meeting with my Personal Banker this afternoon .
utterances.scene: The client politely declines the delivery option, revealing a fortunate coincidence regarding a pre-scheduled meeting, showing efficiency and planning.

utterances.text: What perfect timing !
utterances.scene: The bank representative expresses delight at the convenient timing, conveying a positive and appreciative tone.

utterances.text: Indeed . Is there anything I need to do before I collect it ?
utterances.scene: The client acknowledges the good timing and then proactively asks about any necessary preparations before collecting the card, showing diligence.

utterances.text: Not really . But we do recommend you to read through our terms and conditions again before you sign the card , just in case there is something you aren't happy with .
utterances.scene: The representative provides practical advice, recommending a review of terms and conditions, showing due diligence and customer care.

utterances.text: I'm sure it'll be fine . How about my PIN number ?
utterances.scene: The client expresses confidence in the terms and then inquires about the PIN number, showing a practical concern for immediate usability.

utterances.text: That will be sent on to you within 2 working days . Then , you can start using your new card .
utterances.scene: The representative explains the separate delivery process for the PIN, providing clear instructions for card activation and use.

utterances.text: Great . I'll be in later today . Thanks for calling . Bye .
utterances.scene: The client expresses satisfaction and confirms their plan to visit the bank, concluding the call with thanks and a polite farewell.

utterances.text: What are we eating for lunch ?
utterances.scene: One person expresses hunger and curiosity about the upcoming lunch meal in a casual, expectant tone.

utterances.text: I have no idea . What about you ?
utterances.scene: The second person admits to having no idea, then turns the question back, indicating a shared indecision.

utterances.text: I kind of want pizza .
utterances.scene: The first person expresses a specific craving for pizza, starting to narrow down options.

utterances.text: I ate pizza the other day .
utterances.scene: The second person dismisses the pizza suggestion, stating they recently ate it, indicating a desire for variety.

utterances.text: So , what do you feel like eating then ?
utterances.scene: The first person, slightly frustrated by the lack of progress, prompts the second person to offer their own preference.

utterances.text: How about some burgers ?
utterances.scene: The second person offers a new suggestion, 'burgers,' attempting to find a mutually agreeable option.

utterances.text: I already had a burger yesterday .
utterances.scene: The first person rejects the burger idea, citing recent consumption, mirroring the previous rejection and deepening the indecision.

utterances.text: What are we going to do ?
utterances.scene: Both parties express a feeling of mild exasperation or helplessness as they struggle to find a shared lunch option.

utterances.text: We can just each get what we want to get .
utterances.scene: One person proposes a practical solution: for each to get what they want individually, suggesting an end to the shared decision-making struggle.

utterances.text: That sounds like a plan .
utterances.scene: The other person agrees with relief and approval, finding the proposed solution acceptable and practical.

utterances.text: Do you know a place that sells pizza and burgers ?
utterances.scene: The first person, now with a plan, asks for information about a suitable venue that offers both options, moving towards execution.

utterances.text: I think they sell both at the cafeteria .
utterances.scene: The second person provides a helpful suggestion for a venue that meets the criteria, facilitating the next step of the plan.

utterances.text: Did you bring your certificate for nursing ?
utterances.scene: An interviewer politely asks for a specific professional document from a job candidate, maintaining a formal and professional tone.

utterances.text: Yes , here is my Certificate of Nurse .
utterances.scene: The candidate confidently presents the requested document, confirming its availability in a direct and professional manner.

utterances.text: How about your nursing education ?
utterances.scene: The interviewer follows up by inquiring about the candidate's educational background in nursing, seeking more detailed information.

utterances.text: I learnt nursing through theory and practice for 3 years at Hunan Nursing School .
utterances.scene: The candidate provides a concise summary of their nursing education, highlighting both theoretical and practical training duration and institution.

utterances.text: Can you manage English conversation ?
utterances.scene: The interviewer shifts to assess the candidate's language proficiency, specifically English conversation skills, which is often crucial in professional roles.

utterances.text: Yes , pretty well . I have started learning English since primary school .
utterances.scene: The candidate confidently affirms their English proficiency and provides a brief history of their language learning, aiming to reassure the interviewer.

utterances.text: Have you ever thought about having children , Kaitlyn ?
utterances.scene: One friend casually initiates a personal discussion about having children, opening a topic that can be quite intimate and reflective.

utterances.text: My husband and I have thought about it , but we've decided not to have any . They're just too expensive . Besides , with all the news about global warming on the news lately , who knows what kind of Worl
utterances.scene: Kaitlyn shares her and her husband's decision not to have children, expressing financial concerns and anxiety about the future due to global warming, revealing a thoughtful and somewhat pessimistic perspective.

utterances.text: Well , I've always wanted to have lots of children . Growing up with only one brother , I always felt a bit lonely . What do you think about families with only one child ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker contrasts her own desire for a large family with Kaitlyn's view, expressing a feeling of loneliness from her upbringing and posing a question about only-child families.

utterances.text: For me , growing up in a big family always made me yearn for attention . I always wanted to be an only child so that I could always do what I wanted and so that I wouldn't ever have to share .
utterances.scene: Kaitlyn reveals her longing for attention due to a large family upbringing and expresses a desire to have been an only child, indicating a feeling of being overlooked and a wish for more personal freedom.

utterances.text: Don't you think you would miss having other people around ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker questions Kaitlyn's desire to be an only child, showing curiosity and perhaps a slight disbelief about not wanting company.

utterances.text: No way ! I spent 20 years of my life with relatives around me 24-7 . You know , I don't think I've ever actually spent any time by myself in my parents ' home . What do you think fo the one-child policy
utterances.scene: Kaitlyn emphatically rejects the idea of missing company, recounting her experience of constant family presence and then shifts the topic to the one-child policy, indicating a strong desire for solitude and a broader societal interest.

utterances.text: If China didn't have such a policy , can you imagine how many people there would be in China now ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker acknowledges the practical implications of China's one-child policy, expressing a pragmatic view on population control.

utterances.text: That's true . But as a woman , I'm glad that even though I don't want any children , I at least have a choice in how many children I have . On the other hand , I can't imagine what China would be like
utterances.scene: Kaitlyn agrees with the policy's necessity but expresses gratitude for her personal reproductive choice, highlighting the contrast between individual freedom and state control, showing a mix of understanding and personal value.

utterances.text: Do you think most families with many children envy or feel sorry for other families with only one child ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker probes further into the social perceptions of family size, asking if large families envy or pity only-child families, indicating curiosity about social dynamics and feelings.

utterances.text: I don't know what other people think , but I , for one , envy only children !
utterances.scene: Kaitlyn admits she doesn't know others' opinions but personally expresses envy towards only children, reinforcing her earlier desire for personal space and attention.

utterances.text: Ok , let ’ s go through this one more time . I don ’ t want anymore ruined or dyed blouses !
utterances.scene: One person, likely a parent or housemate, expresses frustration and a firm demand for correct laundry procedures, indicating past negative experiences.

utterances.text: I know , I know . OK , so I have to separate the colors from the whites and put them in this strange looking contraption so called washing machine .
utterances.scene: The other person acknowledges the instruction with a slightly resigned but compliant tone, repeating key steps to confirm understanding.

utterances.text: Right . You have to turn it on and program it depending on what type of clothes you are washing . For example for delicates , you should set a shorter washing cycle . Also , be sure to use fabric softener and this detergent when washing .
utterances.scene: The first person provides detailed instructions for operating the washing machine, emphasizing specific settings and additives, showing a meticulous and instructional tone.

utterances.text: So complicated ! Ok , what about this red wine stain ? How do I get it out ?
utterances.scene: The second person expresses feeling overwhelmed by the complexity and then asks for specific advice on stain removal, indicating a need for practical help.

utterances.text: Since this is a white t-shirt , you can just pour a little bit of bleach on it and it will do the trick .
utterances.scene: The first person provides a simple and effective solution for the stain, demonstrating expertise and a helpful attitude.

utterances.text: Cool . Then I can just throw everything in the dryer for an hour and it ’ s all set right ?
utterances.scene: The second person, mistakenly assuming a simple drying process, asks for confirmation in a hopeful but potentially naive tone.

utterances.text: No ! Since you are washing delicates and cotton , you should set the dryer to medium heat and for twenty minutes .
utterances.scene: The first person immediately corrects the assumption, providing precise instructions for dryer settings based on fabric types, reiterating the importance of proper care.

utterances.text: You know what ? I ’ ll just have everything dry cleaned .
utterances.scene: The second person, clearly exasperated by the detailed and complex instructions, decides to opt for professional dry cleaning, showing a feeling of surrender and frustration.

utterances.text: Is Tom in ?
utterances.scene: A person makes a direct inquiry about someone's presence, indicating a desire to speak with them.

utterances.text: No , he is at work now .
utterances.scene: The other person provides a direct and factual answer about the person's current location, indicating absence.

utterances.text: May I have his office phone number please ?
utterances.scene: The first person, unable to speak directly, requests an alternative contact method, maintaining a polite and persistent tone.
The other person readily provides the requested phone number, showing helpfulness and cooperation.

utterances.text: What about driving to Shanghai ?
utterances.scene: One person proposes a travel idea, suggesting driving to a destination, indicating a hopeful or adventurous tone.

utterances.text: Driving ? No way , it's too far .
utterances.scene: The other person immediately rejects the idea, expressing strong disagreement and deeming the distance too great, indicating practicality and aversion.

utterances.text: I just thought it would be an interesting way to see lots of places . How long will it take ?
utterances.scene: The first person defends their idea, highlighting the potential for sightseeing and then asks for a time estimate, showing a persistent and curious attitude.

utterances.text: Too long , and you do not have much time .
utterances.scene: The second person reiterates the impracticality, focusing on the excessive time commitment and the lack of available time, maintaining a firm and realistic stance.

utterances.text: What a pity .
utterances.scene: The first person expresses disappointment at the rejection of their idea, showing a feeling of regret or sadness.

utterances.text: Good afternoon . I'll show you to your room .
utterances.scene: A hotel staff member greets a guest politely and offers to show them to their room, indicating standard hospitable service.

utterances.text: Thank you .
utterances.scene: The guest responds with a simple thank you, showing polite acknowledgment of the service.

utterances.text: Could you tell me which bags are yours ?
utterances.scene: The staff member asks for clarification about the guest's luggage, preparing for assistance with bags.

utterances.text: They're over there next to the door . Those three with green tags on them .
utterances.scene: The guest clearly identifies their bags by location and specific markers, providing helpful details.

utterances.text: Could you wait a moment ? I have to get a trolley . May I see your room key , please ?
utterances.scene: The staff member requests a brief wait to retrieve a trolley and asks for the room key for verification, showing efficiency and adherence to procedure.

utterances.text: Sure , here it is .
utterances.scene: The guest promptly provides the room key, showing cooperation and trust.

utterances.text: Thank you . Room 402 . You're on the 4th floor . This way , please .
utterances.scene: The staff member confirms the room number and floor, then directs the guest, maintaining a polite and guiding tone.

utterances.text: Excuse me , sir . Is there anything I can do for you ?
utterances.scene: A polite store employee approaches a customer, offering assistance with a helpful and welcoming tone.

utterances.text: Yes . I bought the can two days ago , but today I found that is beyond the guarantee period .
utterances.scene: The customer calmly explains their problem with a purchased item, expressing a slight concern about the expired guarantee.

utterances.text: Let me see . I am sorry , sir . We will change another one for you . Please wait a moment .
utterances.scene: The employee quickly assesses the situation, expresses an apologetic and understanding tone, and offers a resolution, demonstrating good customer service.

utterances.text: Excuse me , but could you tell me the way to the railway station ?
utterances.scene: A polite person asks a stranger for directions, indicating they are lost or unfamiliar with the area.

utterances.text: The railway station ? Just go down this street and turn left at the second corner . The station is at the end of that street .
utterances.scene: The person being asked provides clear and concise directions, offering helpful assistance.

utterances.text: How long will it take me to get there ?
utterances.scene: The person asking for directions follows up with a practical question about travel time, seeking further clarification.

utterances.text: It's about a ten-minute walk .
utterances.scene: The helpful person provides an estimate of the travel time, maintaining a cooperative tone.

utterances.text: That's very clear . I think I can find my way now . Thank you .
utterances.scene: The person expresses gratitude and confidence, feeling relieved and satisfied with the clear directions received.

utterances.text: Not at all .
utterances.scene: The helpful person responds courteously, dismissing the thanks with a polite and friendly gesture.

utterances.text: Excuse me ! Does this bus go to the railway station ?
utterances.scene: A passenger, likely feeling a bit uncertain, politely asks a bus driver or another passenger for specific route information.

utterances.text: No , You're got on the wrong bus . You can take a No . 22 bus at the University station and then transfer to a No . 83 bus at the railway station .
utterances.scene: The person provides direct and helpful information, correcting the passenger's mistake and offering a clear alternative route.

utterances.text: OK ! Thank you very much !
utterances.scene: The passenger expresses immediate understanding and sincere gratitude for the helpful and clear instructions.

utterances.text: I have here our price sheet on a F . O . B . basis . The prices are given without engagement .
utterances.scene: A salesperson presents a price sheet, setting the initial terms for a business discussion with a formal and informative tone.

utterances.text: Good , if you ’ ll excuse me , I ’ ll go over the sheet right now .
utterances.scene: The buyer expresses readiness to review the provided information, indicating a focused and business-like approach.

utterances.text: Take your time .
utterances.scene: The salesperson grants permission to review, showing a relaxed and accommodating attitude.

utterances.text: I can tell you at a glance that your prices are much too high .
utterances.scene: The buyer, having quickly reviewed the prices, makes an assertive and critical statement, expressing dissatisfaction with the initial offer.

utterances.text: I ’ m surprised to hear you say so . You know that the cost of pro - duction has been skyrocketing in recent years .
utterances.scene: The salesperson expresses surprise and defends the prices by citing rising production costs, adopting a defensive yet informative tone.

utterances.text: We only ask that your prices be comparable to others . That ’ s reasonable , isn ’ t it ?
utterances.scene: The buyer counters with a reasonable demand for competitive pricing, trying to establish common ground and fairness.

utterances.text: Well , to get the business done , we can consider making some concessions in our price . But first , you ’ ll have to give me an idea of the quantity you wish to order from us , so that we may adjust our prices accordingly .
utterances.scene: The salesperson shows willingness to negotiate and make concessions, but introduces a condition related to order quantity, shifting the focus to volume.

utterances.text: The size of our order depends greatly on the prices . Let ’ s settle that matter first .
utterances.scene: The buyer asserts that pricing is the primary factor, reiterating their stance and prioritizing price negotiation before discussing quantity.

utterances.text: Well , as I ’ Ve said , if your order is large enough , we ’ re ready to reduce our prices by 2 percent .
utterances.scene: The salesperson reiterates a limited concession based on order size, attempting to close the negotiation with a specific offer.

utterances.text: When I say your prices are much too high , I don ’ t mean they are higher merely by 2 or 3 percent .
utterances.scene: The buyer firmly rejects the small concession, clarifying the significant gap between their expectation and the offered reduction, indicating strong dissatisfaction.

utterances.text: How much do you mean then ? Can you give me a rough idea ?
utterances.scene: The salesperson, seeking to understand the buyer's true expectation, asks for a specific counter-proposal, showing willingness to continue the negotiation.

utterances.text: To have this business concluded , I should say a reduction of least 10 percent would help .
utterances.scene: The buyer presents a clear and substantial demand for a price reduction, indicating what it would take to finalize the deal.

utterances.text: Impossible . How can you expect us to make a reduction to that extent ?
utterances.scene: The salesperson expresses strong disbelief and resistance to the buyer's demand, viewing it as unrealistic and challenging.

utterances.text: I think you are as well - informed as I am about the market for chemical fertilizers . It ’ s unnecessary for me to point out that sup - ply exceeds demand at present and that this situation is apt to continue for a long time yet . May I suggest that you call your home office and see what they have to say ?
utterances.scene: The buyer uses market knowledge as leverage, calmly and assertively explaining the current economic reality to justify their demand, then suggests escalating the decision to a higher authority.

utterances.text: Very well , I will .
utterances.scene: The salesperson reluctantly agrees to consult their home office, acknowledging the buyer's strong argument and ending the current phase of the negotiation.

utterances.text: Excuse me , you look lost.Can I help you ?
utterances.scene: A helpful person approaches a stranger, noticing their potential distress and offering assistance with a kind and concerned tone.

utterances.text: Oh , Thank you . I'm looking for the train station .
utterances.scene: The lost person expresses gratitude and immediately states their destination, accepting the help with relief.

utterances.text: Right . Let me see . You go straight down here and turn right .
utterances.scene: The helpful person begins to provide directions, thinking through the route and offering the first steps clearly.

utterances.text: Right ? OK , got it .
utterances.scene: The lost person confirms understanding of the initial directions, showing attentiveness and comprehension.

utterances.text: Then take the next left then the next right . Are you with me ?
utterances.scene: The helpful person continues with more detailed directions, pausing to check if the lost person is still following and understanding.

utterances.text: Next left then right ? OK .
utterances.scene: The lost person repeats and confirms the next steps, demonstrating continued comprehension and readiness for more information.

utterances.text: I'm sorry , but I didn't catch what you said .
utterances.scene: A person politely apologizes for not hearing or understanding something, asking for repetition with a slightly embarrassed but clear tone.

utterances.text: I said , ' Do you want me to help you ? '
utterances.scene: The speaker patiently repeats their previous offer of help, clarifying the exact phrasing with a helpful and understanding tone.

utterances.text: I'm trying to find a post office .
utterances.scene: The person, having received clarification, states their objective directly, accepting the offer of help.

utterances.text: Go three blocks and turn right . It's right there .
utterances.scene: The helpful person provides clear and concise directions to the destination, sounding confident and direct.

utterances.text: Should I take the bus ?
utterances.scene: The person asks for advice on the best mode of transportation, seeking practical guidance.

utterances.text: No . It'll only take about five minutes to walk .
utterances.scene: The helpful person advises against taking the bus, suggesting walking as a faster and more efficient option.

utterances.text: Thank you very much .
utterances.scene: The person expresses sincere gratitude for the helpful and practical advice received.

utterances.text: Anytime .
utterances.scene: The helpful person responds courteously, indicating willingness to assist again in the future with a friendly tone.

utterances.text: It says here that you graduated from Beijing Normal University with a major in English Language and Literature .
utterances.scene: The interviewer states a fact from the applicant's resume, setting the stage for a question or a point of discussion, with a neutral and professional tone.

utterances.text: Right . Then you may think that I am not fit for this job according to my educational background .
utterances.scene: The applicant confirms the information and proactively addresses a potential concern, showing self-awareness and a slightly defensive but prepared tone.

utterances.text: Yes .
utterances.scene: The interviewer confirms the applicant's assumption directly, maintaining a neutral and evaluative tone.

utterances.text: But I want to be a tour guide very much because I like traveling and meeting various kinds of people . So I took an evening course at the Tourism School of Beijing after graduation and I have gotten a qualification certificate .
utterances.scene: The applicant passionately explains their motivation and highlights relevant extra qualifications, attempting to overcome the interviewer's initial concern with enthusiasm and evidence.

utterances.text: So you must be an extravert ?
utterances.scene: The interviewer makes an inference about the applicant's personality based on their expressed interests, probing further into their suitability for the role.

utterances.text: Yes , I always enjoy being with a group of people and chatting with them .
utterances.scene: The applicant enthusiastically confirms their extroverted nature, emphasizing their enjoyment of social interaction, which is crucial for the job.

utterances.text: What do you think are the responsibilities of a tourist guide ?
utterances.scene: The interviewer asks a direct question to assess the applicant's understanding of the job role and its duties, maintaining a professional and evaluative tone.

utterances.text: A tourist guide must be responsible for arranging and coordinating tour activities , and offering service of transportation , accommodation , sightseeing , shopping and entertainment .
utterances.scene: The applicant provides a comprehensive and knowledgeable answer, demonstrating a good grasp of the multifaceted responsibilities of a tour guide.

utterances.text: Don't you consider it a hard work ?
utterances.scene: The interviewer probes about the challenges of the job, perhaps testing the applicant's realism and resilience, with a slightly challenging tone.

utterances.text: Hard but interesting , I think .
utterances.scene: The applicant acknowledges the difficulty but quickly frames it positively, emphasizing their interest and passion for the work, showcasing a resilient attitude.

utterances.text: Have you any experience as a tourist guide ?
utterances.scene: The interviewer asks about practical experience, moving from theoretical knowledge to real-world application, with a practical and direct tone.

utterances.text: Yes , I usually guided foreign tourists around Beijing when I was in University .
utterances.scene: The applicant confidently states their relevant past experience, providing a specific example of their tour guiding activities.

utterances.text: Have you ever learned any other foreign languages other than English ?
utterances.scene: The interviewer asks about additional language skills, assessing potential added value for international tourism, with a curious and exploratory tone.

utterances.text: Yes , I have learned a little French and Japanese as well .
utterances.scene: The applicant confirms additional language skills, highlighting their versatility and further enhancing their qualifications for the role.

utterances.text: Didn ’ t you punch in this morning , Monica ?
utterances.scene: A colleague or supervisor gently reminds Monica about a company rule regarding punching in, with a slightly questioning but not accusatory tone.

utterances.text: Sorry , I don ’ t know the rule about punching .
utterances.scene: Monica apologizes for her oversight and admits her lack of knowledge about the company's timekeeping policy, expressing a slightly embarrassed but honest tone.

utterances.text: That ’ s ok . I should have told you earlier . This is a company rule .
utterances.scene: The colleague/supervisor reassures Monica, taking some responsibility for not informing her earlier, and clearly states the nature of the rule, maintaining a helpful and understanding tone.

utterances.text: Do we also need to punch out after work ?
utterances.scene: Monica, seeking to understand the full scope of the policy, asks a clarifying question about punching out, demonstrating a desire to comply.

utterances.text: According to the company rule , we should punch in before 8 o ’ clock and punch out after 5 o ’ clock every work day .
utterances.scene: The colleague/supervisor provides a clear and detailed explanation of the company's timekeeping schedule, ensuring Monica understands the expectations.

utterances.text: How about the lunch break , Lucy ?
utterances.scene: Monica asks a specific question about the lunch break, seeking further details about the work day structure.

utterances.text: From 11 thirty to 1 o ’ clock .
utterances.scene: The colleague/supervisor provides the specific timing for the lunch break, offering complete information.

utterances.text: May I ask whether we need to work overtime ?
utterances.scene: Monica politely inquires about the possibility of overtime work, showing an interest in the company's work-life balance expectations.

utterances.text: Sometimes , but not quite often .
utterances.scene: The colleague/supervisor provides a nuanced answer about overtime, indicating it happens but isn't a regular occurrence, offering a realistic expectation.

utterances.text: This needs dry-cleaning.Can you remove this stain without harming the fabric ?
utterances.scene: A customer presents an item for dry-cleaning, expressing a specific concern about stain removal and potential fabric damage, with a cautious tone.

utterances.text: Let me see . We ’ ll try , but I ’ m not sure that we can remove it .
utterances.scene: The dry cleaner inspects the item and gives a cautious, honest assessment, managing the customer's expectations about the stain removal.

utterances.text: Ok , then . We ’ ll I ’ d also like to have this pressed .
utterances.scene: The customer accepts the dry cleaner's assessment and then adds another service request, maintaining a practical and decisive tone.

utterances.text: Any starch ?
utterances.scene: The dry cleaner asks a specific question about a common preference for pressing, seeking clarification for the service.

utterances.text: No starch .
utterances.scene: The customer provides a clear and direct answer to the dry cleaner's question, specifying their preference.

utterances.text: What's the problem ?
utterances.scene: A doctor or medical professional asks the patient directly about their reason for seeking medical attention, with a professional and inquiring tone.

utterances.text: I have a laceration on my left forearm .
utterances.scene: The patient clearly and succinctly describes their injury to the medical professional.

utterances.text: Let me have a look . How did this happen ?
utterances.scene: The doctor asks to examine the injury and then inquires about the cause, gathering more information for diagnosis, with a professional and calm tone.

utterances.text: I got hit by a car in an accident .
utterances.scene: The patient explains the traumatic cause of their injury, providing essential context for the medical assessment.

utterances.text: Was there much bleeding afterward ?
utterances.scene: The doctor asks a specific question about the severity of the injury, focusing on a key symptom for assessment.

utterances.text: No , not much .
utterances.scene: The patient provides a concise answer, reassuring the doctor that the bleeding was not extensive.

utterances.text: Well , this doesn't look too serious . Nurse , could you please get me a suture set ?
utterances.scene: The doctor makes an initial assessment that the injury is not severe, then calmly instructs a nurse to prepare for stitches, indicating a plan of action.

utterances.text: Will I need stitches ?
utterances.scene: The patient, likely feeling a bit anxious, asks for confirmation about the treatment, seeking clarity and understanding.

utterances.text: Yes . Three , I think . It wont ' be too painful . Alright , we're done . That wasn't so bad , was it ?
utterances.scene: The doctor confirms the need for stitches, provides an estimate, reassures the patient about pain, and then checks in after the procedure, maintaining a comforting and professional demeanor.

utterances.text: No , not really .
utterances.scene: The patient confirms that the procedure was not as painful as perhaps anticipated, expressing a sense of relief.

utterances.text: You're lucky there was no lasting damage . I'll set up an appointment for you to come back in five days . We'll take those stitches out then . So long .
utterances.scene: The doctor expresses relief about the lack of permanent damage, provides clear aftercare instructions, and schedules a follow-up appointment, maintaining a professional and caring tone.

utterances.text: Thank you , doctor . Bye .
utterances.scene: The patient expresses sincere gratitude to the doctor for the treatment and care received, concluding the consultation politely.

utterances.text: What time is it ?
utterances.scene: A neutral, practical question is asked about the current time, likely in a shared living space.

utterances.text: Ten to nine .
utterances.scene: A direct and factual answer is given regarding the time, maintaining a neutral tone.

utterances.text: Your watch is ten minutes slow . So it's should be nine sharp . I'm gonna be late again . What will be my excuse this time ? It should be set the alarm for seven thirty .
utterances.scene: Fred realizes he's late for work, expressing strong frustration, regret, and anxiety about his situation and potential consequences.

utterances.text: Don't cry over spilled milk , Fred ? Could you stay with me a few minutes ?
utterances.scene: Dina tries to console Fred, dismissing his worry, and then expresses a sudden, vulnerable need for his company, hinting at her own loneliness.

utterances.text: What ? Why ? What's wrong with you ?
utterances.scene: Fred reacts with surprise and concern to Dina's request, shifting his focus from his own problems to hers.

utterances.text: I just hate being alone at home with nothing to do about listen to the clock ticking.It ' s so lonely and boring . My sickness makes it worse . When will I recover ?
utterances.scene: Dina reveals deep feelings of loneliness, boredom, and anxiety due to her sickness, expressing a yearning for companionship and recovery.

utterances.text: You will be fine in the couple of month , just be patient . I've got to woke now , I'll be late .
utterances.scene: Fred offers reassurance about Dina's health but quickly pivots back to his urgent need to leave for work, highlighting a conflict between care and responsibility.

utterances.text: You only care about your work .
utterances.scene: Dina expresses hurt and resentment, feeling neglected and unprioritized by Fred, accusing him of caring only for his work.

utterances.text: Sorry , baby , you are everything to me . all I do just for our family .
utterances.scene: Fred expresses regret and deep affection, reassuring Dina of his love and dedication to their family, attempting to alleviate her pain.

utterances.text: Stay just a few minutes longer , OK ?
utterances.scene: Dina makes a soft plea, still seeking his presence and emotional comfort, trying to extend their time together.

utterances.text: OK , I'll leave at 9:15 , Is that all right ?
utterances.scene: Fred compromises, agreeing to stay a little longer, showing his willingness to prioritize Dina's emotional needs while managing his work commitment.

utterances.text: Yes .
utterances.scene: Dina accepts the compromise, feeling a degree of satisfaction and relief that her request was honored.

utterances.text: I'll spent more time with you in the future , Dina .
utterances.scene: Fred makes a heartfelt promise for future commitment, further reassuring Dina and expressing his long-term care for her.

utterances.text: Thank you .
utterances.scene: Dina expresses gratitude, indicating she feels heard, appreciated, and loved, ending the emotional exchange on a positive note.

utterances.text: Canton Hotel .
utterances.scene: A formal, professional greeting is given by a hotel staff member, indicating the start of a business call.

utterances.text: I'd like to reserve a double room . I will be arriving next Monday , the 12th . My name is Wilson .
utterances.scene: The caller politely and clearly states their intention to reserve a double room, providing essential booking details.

utterances.text: A double room for the 12th ? The name is Wilson ?
utterances.scene: The hotel staff member confirms the received details to ensure accuracy and understanding, maintaining a professional tone.

utterances.text: Yes , that's right .
utterances.scene: The caller affirms the confirmed details, indicating that the information is correct.

utterances.text: How long will you be staying ?
utterances.scene: The hotel staff member asks for additional necessary information to complete the reservation process.

utterances.text: Three or four days , perhaps longer .
utterances.scene: The caller provides an estimated duration for their stay, indicating some flexibility in their travel plans.

utterances.text: Very good , sir . We will be expecting you next Monday , the 12th .
utterances.scene: The hotel staff member concludes the reservation by confirming the booking and expressing anticipation for the guest's arrival, maintaining politeness.

utterances.text: How is the result of your lab test ?
utterances.scene: An individual asks about the results of a lab test, showing concern and curiosity about the other person's health.

utterances.text: When it comes to that , I have a lot to say .
utterances.scene: The person responds with a hint of dramatic anticipation, suggesting a significant story or experience related to the test results.

utterances.text: Then say it .
utterances.scene: The inquirer, intrigued by the hint of a story, eagerly urges the person to share the details.

utterances.text: When I went back to my doctor to hear the results of my lab tests , I tried to keep a poker face even though I was scared to death . Then you guess what he said .
utterances.scene: The person vividly describes their immense fear and anxiety while waiting for the doctor's news, building suspense for the listener.

utterances.text: That ’ s just what I want to know .
utterances.scene: The inquirer expresses heightened curiosity and impatience, signaling a strong desire to hear the crucial outcome of the story.

utterances.text: He told me the tests were negative and there was nothing wrong with me .
utterances.scene: The person reveals the positive outcome of the tests, expressing immense relief and happiness after their initial fear.

utterances.text: Could you tell me something about your family ?
utterances.scene: An interviewer or acquaintance politely asks for personal information about the speaker's family, in a formal or semi-formal context.

utterances.text: OK . There are five people in my family , Father , mother , elder brother , younger sister and I .
utterances.scene: The speaker agrees and provides a straightforward, factual enumeration of their immediate family members.

utterances.text: Are your brother and sister still in school ?
utterances.scene: The inquirer follows up with a specific question about the siblings' current activities, showing interest in their life stages.

utterances.text: My brother has found his job and my sister is still in college .
utterances.scene: The speaker provides factual updates on their siblings' current status, differentiating their employment and educational paths.

utterances.text: What does your father do ?
utterances.scene: The inquirer shifts focus to the father's profession, continuing to gather information about the family roles.

utterances.text: My father is a middle school teacher .
utterances.scene: The speaker states their father's occupation directly and factually.

utterances.text: What about your mother ?
utterances.scene: The inquirer asks about the mother's role, maintaining a systematic approach to understanding the family.

utterances.text: My mother is a housewife .
utterances.scene: The speaker states their mother's role directly and factually.

utterances.text: Are you married ?
utterances.scene: The inquirer asks a direct personal question about the speaker's marital status.

utterances.text: I am not married yet and I live alone now .
utterances.scene: The speaker answers factually about their single status and adds a detail about their current living situation.

utterances.text: Do you need to support your family ?
utterances.scene: The inquirer asks about financial responsibilities, possibly probing into the speaker's independence or obligations.

utterances.text: No , my father and brother are doing that .
utterances.scene: The speaker clarifies that they do not have primary financial responsibility for the family, indicating others are providing support.

utterances.text: Have you finished school ?
utterances.scene: The inquirer asks about the speaker's educational background, completing the picture of their life history.

utterances.text: Yes , I have already graduated .
utterances.scene: The speaker confirms their completed education directly.

utterances.text: I'm in heaven ! A Whirlpool dryer !
utterances.scene: The speaker expresses extreme joy and excitement upon seeing a new, highly desired appliance, indicating great satisfaction.

utterances.text: I love them , too . Let's move into the kitchen . Wait until you see the refrigerator .
utterances.scene: The other speaker shares the enthusiasm and builds anticipation for more impressive features in another part of the home.

utterances.text: This is too good to be true .
utterances.scene: The first speaker expresses disbelief and overwhelming positive surprise, feeling that the situation is almost unreal in its goodness.

utterances.text: And the stove is brand new . You know how to use a gas stove , right ?
utterances.scene: The second speaker continues to highlight new features, adding a practical question to ensure comfort and familiarity with an appliance.

utterances.text: Yes . We've lived in Taiwan for a while . I had a gas stove in the States , too .
