utterances.text: Hello , again . Did you discuss everything with your colleagues ?
utterances.scene: A professional greets a returning client, acknowledging a previous meeting, and immediately inquires about the outcome of their internal discussions.

utterances.text: Yes , yes . It seems that everything is settled .
utterances.scene: The client affirms that discussions are complete and successful, expressing a positive and settled feeling about the outcomes.

utterances.text: Have you decided how you would like the salaries paid ?
utterances.scene: The professional asks about a specific detail of the agreement, inquiring about the preferred method for salary payments, moving to practical implementation.

utterances.text: We have discussed it and decided that at the moment we would like the salaries to be paid into the employees's accounts , whether they are currently with this bank or not .
utterances.scene: The client clearly states their decision regarding salary payments, outlining a flexible approach that accommodates all employees regardless of their current bank.

utterances.text: That's not a problem .
utterances.scene: The professional reassures the client that their request is easily accommodated, confirming the bank's capability to handle it.

utterances.text: Of course , if we are happy with the service after the initial period we will recommend all employees either transfer their accounts to this bank , or open new accounts with you .
utterances.scene: The client expresses a conditional future intention to recommend the bank to all employees, linking this recommendation to their satisfaction with the initial service.

utterances.text: Thank you very much . We always welcome new customers .
utterances.scene: The professional expresses sincere gratitude for the potential future business and warmly welcomes new customers, reinforcing a positive relationship.

utterances.text: I think this spring is a good time for us to start looking .
utterances.scene: One partner initiates a conversation about house hunting, suggesting an optimal time to begin the process, indicating a readiness for a significant life change.

utterances.text: We should plan to move out of here before July . I'm tired of living in apartments .
utterances.scene: The other partner expresses a sense of urgency and strong dissatisfaction with their current living situation (apartments), reinforcing the desire for a house.

utterances.text: I know , dear . I am too . But we've just been too busy to look for a house .
utterances.scene: The first partner acknowledges and shares the sentiment, but explains the practical reason for the delay in starting the house hunt, showing understanding.

utterances.text: We need to find a good realtor .
utterances.scene: The second partner suggests the necessity of finding a professional real estate agent, indicating a belief that expert help is required.

utterances.text: Not necessarily . If we use a realtor to find a house , it will be more expensive .
utterances.scene: The first partner disagrees with the necessity of a realtor, expressing a financial concern that using one would increase costs.

utterances.text: What do you mean ?
utterances.scene: The second partner seeks clarification, indicating confusion or a lack of understanding regarding the financial implications mentioned.

utterances.text: Realtors always get a commission.If the realtor helps us find something , we have to pay him .
utterances.scene: The first partner explains the concept of realtor commissions, clarifying how using a realtor adds to the cost.

utterances.text: But doesn't a realtor help with the contract ? I thought they take care of all the legal troubles .
utterances.scene: The second partner questions the first's premise by highlighting a perceived benefit of realtors (handling legal aspects), expressing confusion about the trade-offs.

utterances.text: Yes , that's often true . But you have to pay them .
utterances.scene: The first partner acknowledges the benefit but immediately reiterates the cost implication, emphasizing that convenience comes at a price.

utterances.text: I still think we should have a realtor.We ' re new in this country . We don't know all the laws of buying a house.And also , the realtor will inspect the house.He can tell us if the house has
utterances.scene: The second partner strongly reasserts the need for a realtor, listing several benefits and expressing a feeling of vulnerability due to being new to the country and unfamiliar with local laws and inspection needs.

utterances.text: Of course we need a home inspector.But we can hire an inspector on our own.And as for the legal problems , I have friends . They can help us .
utterances.scene: The first partner concedes the need for a home inspector but quickly offers alternatives for both inspection and legal help, maintaining the stance against a realtor.

utterances.text: So how can we find a house if we don't have a realtor ?
utterances.scene: The second partner, still unconvinced, asks for practical steps on how to find a house without a realtor, seeking concrete solutions.

utterances.text: It takes a little more time . We have to check the ads in the paper.Probably also there are special real estate magazines with ads.Then we have to drive to the homes and look at them .
utterances.scene: The first partner explains the do-it-yourself house hunting process, emphasizing that it requires more time and effort, outlining the necessary steps.

utterances.text: And doesn't the person selling the house have a realtor ?
utterances.scene: The second partner raises another practical question, inquiring whether the seller typically has a realtor, exploring the dynamics of the transaction.

utterances.text: Sometimes they do , sometimes they don't . It's best to find someone who is selling by themselves .
utterances.scene: The first partner explains that sellers may or may not use a realtor and advises seeking out direct sales, hinting at a strategic advantage.

utterances.text: Why ?
utterances.scene: The second partner asks for the reasoning behind the advice, seeking to understand the strategic advantage of finding a direct seller.

utterances.text: Because if the seller has a realtor , their price will be higher.He will have to pay a commission to the realtor .
utterances.scene: The first partner explains that a seller with a realtor will likely have a higher asking price due to the commission, clarifying the financial benefit of a direct sale.

utterances.text: Hmm . It all sounds very complicated .
utterances.scene: The second partner expresses a feeling of being overwhelmed by the complexity of the house buying process, indicating lingering apprehension.

utterances.text: It is . But buying a house is very important . So it takes time.That ' s why we haven't done it yet . It's very troublesome .
utterances.scene: The first partner acknowledges the complexity, but emphasizes the importance of buying a house and the significant time and effort it entails, explaining past delays.

utterances.text: I want to look in the papers today . Maybe we can see something we like .
utterances.scene: The second partner expresses a renewed willingness to take action and start the search immediately, showing a shift from apprehension to proactive engagement and hope.

utterances.text: Alright . I'll buy a newspaper when I go to the drug store .
utterances.scene: The first partner agrees to the plan and offers to facilitate the first step, showing cooperation and support for the renewed effort.

utterances.text: I'm calling about our appointment . I can't call on you this evening.My wife is terribly ill .
utterances.scene: A person calls to cancel an appointment, expressing distress and regret due to their wife's severe illness, prioritizing family emergency.

utterances.text: Sorry to hear that .
utterances.scene: The recipient of the call expresses sincere sympathy for the difficult news, showing empathy and understanding.

utterances.text: How about next week ?
utterances.scene: The caller, having conveyed the reason for cancellation, immediately proposes a new time for the appointment, seeking to reschedule.

utterances.text: Fine , we'll be expecting you then .
utterances.scene: The recipient accepts the proposed new appointment time, confirming the reschedule and indicating readiness for the future meeting.

utterances.text: Which restaurant do you prefer ?
utterances.scene: A neutral question initiating a discussion about dining preferences. The speaker is seeking input from the listener.

utterances.text: I'd like to taste Mexican food .
utterances.scene: The listener expresses a specific culinary desire, indicating a preference for a particular type of cuisine.

utterances.text: How about the one on Baker Street ?
utterances.scene: The speaker suggests a specific restaurant location, building on the listener's expressed preference. The tone is helpful and suggestive.

utterances.text: Oh , I've never seen a better Mexican restaurant .
utterances.scene: The listener expresses strong positive approval and enthusiasm for the suggested restaurant, implying prior knowledge and satisfaction.

utterances.text: The numbers in this table don't seem to be in accord with reality .
utterances.scene: The speaker expresses concern and skepticism about the accuracy of data presented in a table, implying a discrepancy or problem.

utterances.text: I know , but these are the figures that we came up with .
utterances.scene: The listener acknowledges the speaker's concern about the data's accuracy but presents the figures as the confirmed result of their work, possibly with a hint of resignation or defensiveness.

utterances.text: Oh , so the zoo is over there . Thank you so much for your help .
utterances.scene: A grateful tourist thanks a local for directions, showing appreciation and relief at having found their way.

utterances.text: You ’ re welcome . Can I ask you what brings you to China ?
utterances.scene: The local responds politely and then expresses friendly curiosity about the tourist's reason for visiting the country.

utterances.text: I ’ m actually travelling around Asia .
utterances.scene: The tourist provides a brief and informative answer to the local's question, sharing their travel plans.

utterances.text: Oh , very nice . How long will you be in Beijing ?
utterances.scene: The local expresses positive interest in the tourist's travel plans and asks for more specific details about their stay in the current city.

utterances.text: Probably another week .
utterances.scene: The tourist provides a concise estimate of their remaining time in Beijing.

utterances.text: Oh , I see . Well , I ’ ll give you my phone number and if you need a guide , please call me .
utterances.scene: The local expresses understanding and then offers a kind and helpful gesture, providing their contact information as a potential guide, showing generosity and hospitality.

utterances.text: Thank you very much . That ’ s very kind .
utterances.scene: The tourist expresses sincere gratitude and appreciation for the local's generous offer.

utterances.text: Could you type up this document for me , Sandra ?
utterances.scene: A speaker makes a polite request to a colleague, Sandra, asking for assistance with a task.

utterances.text: Sure , but I have to finish this report first .
utterances.scene: Sandra agrees to the request but states a prior commitment, indicating a delay or prioritization of tasks. The tone is cooperative but conditional.

utterances.text: Never mind . I'll do it .
utterances.scene: The initial speaker, perhaps feeling the urgency or not wanting to wait, rescinds the request and decides to do the task themselves, possibly with a hint of impatience or resignation.

utterances.text: Are you interested in mountaineering ?
utterances.scene: One person initiates a conversation by asking about the other's interest in a specific outdoor activity.

utterances.text: Yes , in some sense . I should say I like mountain climbing , you know , because I'm not so professional . How about you
utterances.scene: The listener expresses a qualified interest in the activity, clarifying their level of expertise, and then reciprocates the question, showing engagement.

utterances.text: I'm the same with you , an amateur mountain climber . I went climbing in the Rocky Mountains with my friends last summer vacation . We spent two days in the mountains .
utterances.scene: The speaker confirms a shared interest and level of experience, then enthusiastically recounts a past mountaineering trip, sharing details of their adventure.

utterances.text: How did you spend the night there ?
utterances.scene: The listener shows keen interest in the details of the recounted trip, asking a specific question about the overnight arrangements.

utterances.text: We pitched a tent in the night , waiting for the sunrise . Wow ! It was too beautiful .
utterances.scene: The speaker vividly describes their overnight experience, emphasizing the beauty of the sunrise with enthusiasm and awe.

utterances.text: I had a similar experience , but that was on the top of Tasha Mountain in my country .
utterances.scene: The listener shares a similar personal experience, relating it to the speaker's story and introducing a new location.

utterances.text: Tasha Mountain ? It's very famous in China , isn't ?
utterances.scene: The speaker recognizes the name of the mountain and asks for confirmation, showing curiosity and general knowledge.

utterances.text: Yes . It is one of the Five Mountains .
utterances.scene: The listener confirms the mountain's fame and provides additional cultural context.

utterances.text: I want to climb Tasha Mountain this summer vacation . Would you be my guide ?
utterances.scene: The speaker expresses a strong desire to visit the mountain and makes a direct, enthusiastic request for the listener to be their guide, indicating trust and admiration for their experience.

utterances.text: I'd love to .
utterances.scene: The listener enthusiastically accepts the request, expressing willingness and pleasure at the prospect.

utterances.text: Sir , what's wrong with you ?
utterances.scene: A flight attendant (implied) addresses a passenger with concern, noticing signs of distress.

utterances.text: I have a spasm of nausea and dizziness .
utterances.scene: The passenger describes their symptoms, indicating discomfort and illness.

utterances.text: Have you ever suffered from airsickness before ? You're probably airsick .
utterances.scene: The flight attendant diagnoses the probable cause of the passenger's symptoms and asks a clarifying question, showing professional assessment.

utterances.text: No , this is the first time on a plane . Maybe you are right .. Please get me some pills .
utterances.scene: The passenger confirms it's a new experience, accepts the likely diagnosis, and makes an urgent request for medication, expressing discomfort and hope for relief.

utterances.text: OK . I will get some for you . There's an airsickness bag behind the seat in front of you.Please wait me for a moment . ( Go away for a few minutes , and now she comes back . ) Here are two pills . And the water is in the glass too.Please take the pills with water .
utterances.scene: The flight attendant assures the passenger of help, provides immediate practical advice (airsickness bag), and then returns with the requested medication and instructions, showing efficiency and care.

utterances.text: Thank you very much . ( Take the pills . )
utterances.scene: The passenger expresses gratitude for the help received and proceeds to take the medication as instructed.

utterances.text: Are you feeling better now ?
utterances.scene: The flight attendant checks on the passenger's condition, showing continued concern and follow-up.

utterances.text: Much better now . Thanks again .
utterances.scene: The passenger reports significant improvement and reiterates their gratitude, expressing relief.

utterances.text: My pleasure .
utterances.scene: The flight attendant responds politely, indicating that helping the passenger was a natural part of their duty and a pleasure.

utterances.text: Hi Bill , it ’ s Jane .
utterances.scene: Jane initiates a phone call, identifying herself to Bill.

utterances.text: Jane , I ’ m on the other line , can you hang on for a second ?
utterances.scene: Bill, busy with another call, politely asks Jane to wait, indicating his current unavailability.

utterances.text: Sure .
utterances.scene: Jane agrees to wait patiently, showing understanding and cooperation.

utterances.text: OK , I ’ ll be right back .
utterances.scene: Bill acknowledges Jane's agreement and reassures her that he will return to their conversation shortly.

utterances.text: Have you decided what you'd like ?
utterances.scene: A server or host asks a diner if they are ready to order, in a restaurant setting.

utterances.text: Yes . First I'll have tomato juice .
utterances.scene: The diner confirms their readiness to order and specifies their first item, likely an appetizer or drink.

utterances.text: And then ?
utterances.scene: The server prompts the diner for the next part of their order, likely the main course.

utterances.text: I'll have the lamb chops , well-done , please .
utterances.scene: The diner clearly states their main course choice and a specific preparation preference, showing decisiveness.

utterances.text: Good morning , Madam . What can I do for you ?
utterances.scene: A shop assistant greets a customer politely and offers assistance, in a retail setting.

utterances.text: Can you show me some traditional Chinese arts and crafts ?
utterances.scene: The customer expresses a specific interest in a category of items, initiating their shopping request.

utterances.text: Maybe sandalwood fan is good .
utterances.scene: The shop assistant suggests a specific item that fits the customer's request, demonstrating product knowledge.

utterances.text: Would you show me some ?
utterances.scene: The customer expresses interest in the suggestion and requests to see the items.

utterances.text: Of course .
utterances.scene: The shop assistant agrees politely to show the items.

utterances.text: They really smell fragrant . How much is a real sandalwood fan ?
utterances.scene: The customer comments positively on the item's quality (fragrance) and then inquires about the price, showing serious purchasing intent.

utterances.text: The small ones are one hundred yuan for each . And the big ones are two hundred and thirty yuan .
utterances.scene: The shop assistant provides clear pricing information for different sizes of the item.

utterances.text: I'll take two small ones and a big one .
utterances.scene: The customer makes a firm purchasing decision, specifying quantities and sizes.

utterances.text: What else are you interested in ?
utterances.scene: The shop assistant attempts to upsell or inquire about further needs, maintaining good customer service.

utterances.text: I'm afraid not .
utterances.scene: The customer politely declines any further purchases, indicating they are done shopping.

utterances.text: OK . Here you are .
utterances.scene: The shop assistant acknowledges the customer's decision and presents the purchased items, concluding the transaction.

utterances.text: Good morning.Mrs.Smith .
utterances.scene: A bookseller or librarian greets a customer, Mrs. Smith, politely.

utterances.text: Good morning ! Can you help me , please ? I'm looking for some books for my mother .
utterances.scene: Mrs. Smith returns the greeting and immediately requests assistance, explaining she is looking for books for her mother.

utterances.text: Well , what kind of books does she like ?
utterances.scene: The bookseller/librarian asks a clarifying question to narrow down the search, showing helpfulness.

utterances.text: She's very fond of detective stories ?
utterances.scene: Mrs. Smith provides the specific genre her mother enjoys, giving useful information.

utterances.text: I see.Has she read any detective stories ?
utterances.scene: The bookseller/librarian acknowledges the information and asks another clarifying question to avoid recommending a book the mother has already read.

utterances.text: Oh , yes !
utterances.scene: Mrs. Smith confirms that her mother has indeed read many detective stories, emphasizing it.

utterances.text: Do you know if she's read this one ?
utterances.scene: The bookseller/librarian presents a specific book and asks if the mother has read it, trying to find a suitable new read.

utterances.text: I'm not sure , but she probably won't remember if she has ! She's very forgetful !
utterances.scene: Mrs. Smith expresses uncertainty and then humorously explains her mother's forgetfulness, indicating a challenge in selecting books.

utterances.text: Ah ! She has a bad memory.How old is she ?
utterances.scene: The bookseller/librarian acknowledges the memory issue and asks about the mother's age, possibly to gauge appropriate recommendations or understand the forgetfulness.

utterances.text: She's eighty-seven .
utterances.scene: Mrs. Smith provides her mother's age.

utterances.text: I suggest you take this book.It ' s very exciting .
utterances.scene: The bookseller/librarian makes a confident recommendation, highlighting an appealing quality of the book.

utterances.text: Thank you.That ' s a good idea.she likes exciting books.Can you suggest another one ?
utterances.scene: Mrs. Smith expresses gratitude and positive reception of the suggestion, confirms her mother's preference, and then requests another recommendation, showing continued trust and interest.

utterances.text: Hey , Jimmy , you've been sitting in front of the TV all day . Anything interesting on TV ?
utterances.scene: A casual, slightly concerned inquiry from one person to another who has been sedentary all day, suggesting a hint of disapproval or boredom.

utterances.text: Not really . Quite boring right now , actually . Mostly infomercials and public service announcements .
utterances.scene: A relaxed, slightly apathetic response, confirming the lack of engaging content on TV and explaining the boredom.

utterances.text: Why don't you turn off the TV and get outside ? You need to get some fresh air .
utterances.scene: A friendly suggestion or gentle nudge, expressing concern for the other person's well-being and encouraging outdoor activity.

utterances.text: I know , I know.But my favorite show is on in a couple of minutes . It's the series finals , and I wouldn't miss it for the world !
utterances.scene: A slightly defensive but enthusiastic response, revealing a strong attachment to a specific TV show and a sense of anticipation for its finale.

utterances.text: Really ? What's the series about ?
utterances.scene: An intrigued and curious question, showing the speaker's interest has been piqued by the other's enthusiasm for the TV series.

utterances.text: Well , it's about how an immigrant girl achieve her dream in America . It's a sitcom but really quite smart and really funny . I think you'd like it .
utterances.scene: An enthusiastic and descriptive explanation, trying to convince the other person of the show's merits and broad appeal.

utterances.text: It sounds interesting , but I am not a big fan of TV shows . They're time consuming and don't have much depth .
utterances.scene: A polite but skeptical response, expressing general disinterest in TV shows despite acknowledging the specific show's potential appeal, highlighting a preference for more substantive activities.

utterances.text: I believe some shows are quite informative and interesting . Take this show for example , it examines American xenophobia and how it might conflict with the American dream , with hilarious results .
utterances.scene: A passionate and persuasive counter-argument, defending the value of certain TV shows and providing specific, intellectual reasons why the current show is worthwhile.

utterances.text: Really ? that's interesting !
utterances.scene: A surprised and genuinely intrigued reaction, indicating a shift in perspective and growing interest in the described TV show.

utterances.text: Yeah.Oh , here it comes ! why don't we watch it together ? they are going to have a court debate in this episode . It should be good .
utterances.scene: An excited invitation, fueled by the imminent start of the show and the prospect of shared viewing, highlighting an anticipated dramatic element.

utterances.text: OK , I'll give it a go .
utterances.scene: An agreeable and open-minded acceptance, indicating a willingness to try something new, influenced by the other person's enthusiasm.

utterances.text: Hello , hot water overflowed from the bathtub . Would you help me ?
utterances.scene: An urgent and slightly distressed call for help, indicating a household emergency and a need for immediate assistance.

utterances.text: Would you turn off the tap ?
utterances.scene: A calm, directive question, prioritizing the immediate action needed to stop the source of the problem.

utterances.text: I did it .
utterances.scene: A brief, affirmative response, confirming compliance with the instruction and a sense of relief that the immediate problem is contained.

utterances.text: Then will you put all the towels under the bathroom door .
utterances.scene: A follow-up instruction, continuing to address the water damage and containing its spread.

utterances.text: Ok , I will .
utterances.scene: An agreeable and compliant response, indicating readiness to follow further instructions.

utterances.text: I will have our housekeeper come right away .
utterances.scene: A reassuring and helpful statement, offering professional assistance to resolve the situation.

utterances.text: I am sorry , I was too tired to fall asleep .
utterances.scene: A regretful and apologetic explanation, revealing the cause of the oversight, tinged with embarrassment or self-blame.

utterances.text: When you woke up , the water was coming out the tub ?
utterances.scene: A clarifying and empathetic question, seeking to understand the timeline of events without blame.

utterances.text: Right . Can I compensate for the damage with the travel accident insurance ?
utterances.scene: An affirmative response followed by a practical and concerned question about financial compensation for the damage, showing responsibility and seeking solutions.

utterances.text: Hi . I'm looking for a gift for my niece .
utterances.scene: A casual and polite opening, expressing a specific shopping need and a desire for assistance.

utterances.text: Well , little girls seem to love Barbie dolls .
utterances.scene: A helpful and knowledgeable suggestion, drawing on common knowledge about popular gifts for children.

utterances.text: That's perfect . I want to see one .
utterances.scene: An enthusiastic and decisive response, indicating satisfaction with the suggestion and a desire to proceed with viewing the item.

utterances.text: Here you are — she's called Digital Barbie .
utterances.scene: A helpful and informative presentation, offering the requested item and its specific name.

utterances.text: Oh , I like Digital Barbie ! How much does she cost ?
utterances.scene: An appreciative and curious question, expressing immediate fondness for the product and inquiring about its price.

utterances.text: This Barbie is only $ 29.95 .
utterances.scene: A direct and informative response, stating the price of the item clearly.

utterances.text: That's perfect . Let me have her .
utterances.scene: A satisfied and decisive statement, indicating readiness to purchase the item.

utterances.text: Very good . Is there anything else you would like ?
utterances.scene: A polite and helpful inquiry, offering further assistance or additional purchases to the customer.

utterances.text: No , that'll do it for now .
utterances.scene: A polite refusal, confirming the completion of the current shopping needs.

utterances.text: Including tax , your total will be $ 32.42 . Cash or charge ?
utterances.scene: A transactional statement, providing the final cost including tax and inquiring about the preferred payment method.

utterances.text: Let me give you cash , please .
utterances.scene: A clear and polite instruction, specifying the chosen payment method.

utterances.text: Here's your change and receipt . Thank you .
utterances.scene: A polite closing, completing the transaction and expressing gratitude to the customer.

utterances.text: Please put your baggage on the counter and open it , let me have a look .
utterances.scene: A formal and authoritative instruction, indicating a customs inspection and a need for compliance from the traveler.

utterances.text: Yes , sir . Please examine it .
utterances.scene: A polite and compliant response, indicating willingness to cooperate with the inspection.

utterances.text: Anything subject to duty in your suitcase ?
utterances.scene: A direct and probing question, inquiring about any items subject to duty in the traveler's luggage.

utterances.text: No , sir . Nothing except my personal belongings , such as clothes , notebooks and some gifts .
utterances.scene: A calm and assertive declaration, stating that only personal items and a few gifts are present, implying nothing dutiable.

utterances.text: Any cigarettes or liquor ?
utterances.scene: A specific and targeted question, focusing on common dutiable items like tobacco and alcohol.

utterances.text: I have cigarettes for my own use .
utterances.scene: A direct and honest admission, clarifying the presence of cigarettes and their intended personal use.

utterances.text: I think you'll have to pay some duty on these cigarettes because they exceed the quota . And this article is liable for duty .
utterances.scene: An informative and firm statement, explaining the reason for the duty charge due to exceeding the quota and identifying an additional dutiable article.

utterances.text: How much duty should I pay ?
utterances.scene: A practical and resigned question, accepting the situation and seeking clarification on the exact amount owed.

utterances.text: One hundred dollars .
utterances.scene: A direct and clear statement, providing the exact amount of duty owed.

utterances.text: Here is the money .
utterances.scene: An instructional and procedural statement, detailing the next steps in the payment process and providing necessary documentation.

utterances.text: Just a moment . I'll make out your duty memo . ( Writing and giving the memo to Mr . Green ) Take it and pay the girl over there .
utterances.scene: A polite and appreciative closing, acknowledging the assistance received during the customs process.

utterances.text: Thank you .
utterances.scene: Unable to determine scene

utterances.text: So that concludes the introduction . Now let's move to the first part of my talk , which is about 2006 fiscal year marketing plan . So first , right off the bat , When looking at the marketing plan , tell me some of the goals that we had set this year to begin with ...
utterances.scene: A formal and structured transition in a business meeting or presentation, guiding the discussion to the core topic of the marketing plan and prompting participation.

utterances.text: We wanted to appeal to a younger set of consumers and also , in line with that goal , redo our image ...
utterances.scene: A clear and concise response, outlining specific marketing objectives with a professional and focused tone.

utterances.text: That's correct . If you remember , we also set a goal to double distribution in overseas markets . Now , when looking at the data to evaluate whether or not we made our goals , there are three things to consider . First , the original condition of the market , second , our marketing numbers from the previous year , and third , our final sales figures for this year . Now I want to describe for you the second and third parts . If you look at the overhead , you'll see a graph ... The blue line represents our sales from the year 2005 , the red line is the sales in 2006 ... As you can see , our sales in 2005 were quite slow to start off with , but managed to make decent performance in the last part of the year . On the other hand , you can see this year's sales took off like a rocket .
utterances.scene: An affirmative and highly detailed presentation, confirming previous points, adding further objectives, and then moving into an analytical review of performance using visual aids, concluding with an enthusiastic description of strong sales growth.

utterances.text: Excuse me , sir , may I talk to you ?
utterances.scene: A polite and somewhat deferential request, indicating a desire for a private conversation, possibly with a superior.

utterances.text: Bill ! Sure , come on in . What can I do for you ?
utterances.scene: A friendly and welcoming response from a superior, indicating openness to the conversation and a readiness to help.

utterances.text: Well sir , as you know , I have been an employee of this prestigious firm for over ten years .
utterances.scene: A formal and strategic opening, establishing loyalty and experience as a prelude to a significant request, with a respectful tone.

utterances.text: Yes .
utterances.scene: A brief, acknowledging response, confirming the statement and indicating readiness to hear more.

utterances.text: I won ’ t beat around the bush . Sir , I would like a raise . I currently have three companies after me and so I decided to talk to you first .
utterances.scene: A direct and assertive request for a raise, strategically leveraging external job offers to emphasize value and urgency, while maintaining a respectful yet firm tone.

utterances.text: A raise ? Son , I would love to give you a raise , but this is just not the right time .
utterances.scene: A surprised and somewhat paternalistic response, expressing a desire to grant the request but citing external economic constraints, conveying regret.

utterances.text: I understand your position , and I know that the current economic downturn has had a negative impact on sales , but you must also take into consideration my hard work , pro-activeness and loyalty to this company for over a decade .
utterances.scene: A respectful but persistent counter-argument, acknowledging the manager's point but re-emphasizing personal contributions and long-term commitment, appealing to fairness.

utterances.text: Taking into account these factors , and considering I don ’ t want to start a brain drain , I ’ m willing to offer you a ten percent raise and an extra five days of vacation time . How does that sound ?
utterances.scene: A thoughtful and strategic concession, acknowledging the employee's value and offering a compromise to retain talent, indicating a desire to avoid losing a valuable asset. The tone is reasonable and solution-oriented.

utterances.text: Great ! It ’ s a deal ! Thank you , sir !
utterances.scene: An enthusiastic and relieved acceptance, indicating satisfaction with the outcome and gratitude for the successful negotiation.

utterances.text: Before you go , just out of curiosity , what companies were after you ?
utterances.scene: A casual and curious question, asked with a hint of amusement or disbelief, after the main negotiation is complete.

utterances.text: Oh , the electric company , gas company and water company !
utterances.scene: A humorous and playful reveal, exposing the employee's clever bluff and ending the interaction on a lighthearted note.

utterances.text: Are you going to vote on Tuesday ?
utterances.scene: A casual and civic-minded question, inquiring about the other person's intention to participate in an election.

utterances.text: Of course . How about you ?
utterances.scene: An affirmative and confident response, followed by a reciprocal question, indicating a strong commitment to voting.

utterances.text: I ’ Ve already voted .
utterances.scene: A matter-of-fact statement, revealing that the speaker has already fulfilled their civic duty.

utterances.text: How ’ s that ?
utterances.scene: A curious and slightly surprised question, seeking clarification on how the voting was already done.

utterances.text: I sent in an absentee ballot .
utterances.scene: A direct and informative explanation, clarifying the method of voting used.

utterances.text: Why ?
utterances.scene: A simple, inquisitive question, seeking the reason for using an absentee ballot.

utterances.text: I won ’ t be able to vote on Tuesday .
utterances.scene: A direct and explanatory statement, providing the primary reason for the absentee vote.

utterances.text: Why not ?
utterances.scene: A persistent and curious follow-up question, seeking more specific details about the unavailability.

utterances.text: I have to work .
utterances.scene: A concise and practical explanation, stating the unavoidable conflict with work.

utterances.text: Why don ’ t you go to work late ?
utterances.scene: A helpful and problem-solving suggestion, trying to find a workaround for the work conflict.

utterances.text: I have important business to take care of that morning .
utterances.scene: A firm and slightly defensive explanation, indicating an unchangeable commitment for important business.

utterances.text: I see .
utterances.scene: A final, understanding acknowledgment, indicating that the explanation has been accepted and no further questions are needed.

utterances.text: How would you describe your ideal job ?
utterances.scene: A formal interview question, prompting the candidate to articulate their career aspirations and preferences in a professional setting.

utterances.text: I think the job should make use of the professional experience I have obtained , and offer me opportunity for advancement .
utterances.scene: A confident and strategic response, highlighting a desire for skill utilization and career growth, demonstrating ambition.

utterances.text: Why do you think you might like to work for our company ?
utterances.scene: A probing interview question, assessing the candidate's research and genuine interest in the specific company. The tone is evaluative.

utterances.text: I feel my background and experience are a good fit for this position and I am very interested.What ' s more , your company is outstanding in this field .
utterances.scene: An enthusiastic and complimentary response, expressing a strong fit for the role and admiration for the company, demonstrating genuine interest.

utterances.text: What makes you think you would be a success in this position ?
utterances.scene: A challenging interview question, prompting the candidate to articulate their strengths and confidence in their ability to perform successfully.

utterances.text: My graduate school training combined with my experience as an intern should qualify me for this particular job . I am sure I will be successful .
utterances.scene: A confident and assertive response, citing specific qualifications and expressing strong self-belief in their capability to succeed in the role.

utterances.text: How do you know about this company ?
utterances.scene: A question testing the candidate's awareness and knowledge of the company, possibly to gauge their initiative or genuine interest.

utterances.text: Your company is very reputed in this city . I heard much praise to your company .
utterances.scene: A complimentary and appreciative response, demonstrating external knowledge and positive perception of the company's reputation.

utterances.text: Did you see the picture of the guy on the front page of the newspaper this morning ?
utterances.scene: A curious and slightly urgent question, implying something shocking or noteworthy has been seen in the news.

utterances.text: No . I haven't had a chance to read the paper yet .
utterances.scene: A casual and regretful response, indicating a lack of time to catch up on current events.

utterances.text: you've got to see it . It's an unbelievable picture !
utterances.scene: An excited and insistent statement, emphasizing the shocking nature of the picture and urging the other person to look.

utterances.text: What's so interesting about it ?
utterances.scene: A curious and probing question, seeking to understand the specific reason for the excitement and urgency.

utterances.text: Well , this guy fell asleep on the sofa and when he woke up , half his face had been bitten off !
utterances.scene: A dramatic and shocking revelation, detailing a gruesome incident, likely with a tone of horror or disbelief.

utterances.text: What ? How did that happen ?
utterances.scene: A highly shocked and disbelieving reaction, immediately seeking an explanation for the unbelievable event.

utterances.text: They think his dog was trying to wake him up and couldn't , so ended up biting him in his face .
utterances.scene: A speculative and disturbing explanation, detailing the supposed cause of the horrific injury.

utterances.text: Wow . What does his look like now ?
utterances.scene: A stunned and morbidly curious question, seeking details about the current appearance of the injured person.

utterances.text: It looks pretty frightening . He doesn't have any lips , so all you can see are his gums and teeth . Most of his nose and chin are missing too .
utterances.scene: A graphic and descriptive explanation, painting a vivid and unsettling picture of the severe facial disfigurement.

utterances.text: What did he look like before his dog bit his face off ?
utterances.scene: A sympathetic and curious question, seeking to understand the extent of the tragedy by comparing past and present appearance.

utterances.text: He was actually quite handsome . What a shame .
utterances.scene: A regretful and empathetic statement, emphasizing the tragic loss of the man's former handsome appearance.

utterances.text: What's he going to do now ?
utterances.scene: A practical and concerned question, seeking information about the man's future plans or recovery.

utterances.text: It said that he's hoping to get a face transplant , but until then , he's looking forward to Halloween so he isn't the only one wearing a mask .
utterances.scene: A hopeful yet darkly humorous explanation, detailing the man's medical aspirations and his coping mechanism, ending on a surprising, macabre joke.

utterances.text: Excuse me . We're leaving today . I'd like to pay our bills now .
utterances.scene: A polite and clear request, indicating intent to check out from a hotel and settle accounts.

utterances.text: OK . By the way , I'd like to tell you that the check-out time is 12
utterances.scene: An agreeable response followed by an informative reminder, ensuring the guest is aware of hotel policies regarding check-out time.

utterances.text: I see .
utterances.scene: A brief acknowledgment, indicating understanding of the information provided.

utterances.text: Have you used any hotel services this morning or had breakfast at the hotel dining room , Mr . Green ?
utterances.scene: A professional and detailed inquiry, confirming any additional charges before finalizing the bill.

utterances.text: Yes , my friend and I just had breakfast at the dining room , but we didn't use any services .
utterances.scene: A clear and honest response, confirming one specific charge and denying others.

utterances.text: How about the charge for the days you shared the room with your friend ?
utterances.scene: A clarifying question, ensuring all charges, including shared occupancy, are accounted for.

utterances.text: Please add to my account .
utterances.scene: A direct instruction, confirming responsibility for the additional charge.

utterances.text: The total for the eight days is five hundred sixty yuan .
utterances.scene: A clear and concise statement, providing the final amount due in local currency.

utterances.text: OK . Here you are .
utterances.scene: A compliant and direct action, presenting the payment for the bill.

utterances.text: I'm not sure about how to operate the washer and dryer .
utterances.scene: A person expresses confusion and a need for assistance with laundry machines, indicating a practical dilemma. The tone is slightly hesitant or unsure.

utterances.text: What's the problem ?
utterances.scene: The other person, likely a helper or friend, responds with an inquisitive and helpful tone, seeking clarification to provide assistance.

utterances.text: I need help turning them on .
utterances.scene: The first person clarifies their specific difficulty, maintaining a tone of needing practical guidance.

utterances.text: You need change .
utterances.scene: The helper provides a direct and practical piece of information, identifying a common prerequisite for using coin-operated machines. The tone is informative.

utterances.text: The machines take change ?
utterances.scene: The first person expresses surprise or confirmation, indicating a lack of prior knowledge about the payment method.

utterances.text: Yes . It costs fifty cents for the washer and a dollar for the dryer .
utterances.scene: The helper confirms the information and provides specific pricing details, maintaining a helpful and informative tone.

utterances.text: Where do i put the money in ?
utterances.scene: The first person, now understanding the need for payment, seeks instruction on the physical process, showing a continued desire for guidance.

utterances.text: You put the coins into the slot , push it in , and it will turn on .
utterances.scene: The helper provides clear, step-by-step instructions, ensuring the first person can successfully operate the machines. The tone is instructional and patient.

utterances.text: That's it ?
utterances.scene: The first person expresses a slight surprise or relief that the process is straightforward, perhaps having expected something more complex.

utterances.text: There's nothing else to it .
utterances.scene: The helper reassures the first person that the instructions are complete and the process is indeed simple.

utterances.text: Thank you very much .
utterances.scene: The first person expresses sincere gratitude for the received assistance and clear instructions.

utterances.text: You're welcome . Let me know if you need anything else .
utterances.scene: The helper graciously accepts the thanks and offers further assistance, maintaining a friendly and helpful demeanor.

utterances.text: Dad , can you lend me some money ?
utterances.scene: A child asks their father for a loan, likely with a hopeful or slightly deferential tone, implying a common family dynamic.

utterances.text: What for ?
utterances.scene: The father responds with a direct and inquisitive tone, seeking the reason for the money request, typical of a parent's oversight.

utterances.text: I want to get a ticket for a concert tonight .
utterances.scene: The child provides a specific reason for the money, expressing a desire to attend an event. The tone is likely eager.

utterances.text: All right.Here ' s the money . I suppose I'll have to drive you there .
utterances.scene: The father agrees to the request, showing a mix of generosity and a slightly resigned acceptance of additional parental duty. The tone is benevolent but with a hint of responsibility.

utterances.text: How much money do you expect in this position ?
utterances.scene: An interviewer asks a direct question about salary expectations, initiating a negotiation phase in a professional context. The tone is formal and probing.

utterances.text: With my experience , I'd like to start at 3,000 RIB per month .
utterances.scene: The candidate confidently states their salary expectation, justifying it with their experience. The tone is assertive and professional.

utterances.text: Well , it is a little more than we had planned .
utterances.scene: The interviewer expresses a slight reservation or concern, indicating that the stated salary is above their initial budget, subtly opening a negotiation.

utterances.text: I think you will find I am worth it .
utterances.scene: The candidate responds with unwavering confidence, reiterating their value and justifying their salary demand. The tone is firm and persuasive.

utterances.text: Could you help me with these books ?
utterances.scene: A person politely asks for assistance, indicating a need for help with a physical task. The tone is requesting and polite.

utterances.text: My hands are full . Can ’ t you see that ?
utterances.scene: George responds irritably, declining the request by pointing out his current inability to help, and expressing annoyance at the question.

utterances.text: Please , George .
utterances.scene: The first person makes a more earnest and possibly pleading request, appealing to George despite his initial refusal.

utterances.text: All right . Just wait a minute , OK ?
utterances.scene: George, mollified by the plea, reluctantly agrees to help, but asks for a moment, indicating a grudging acceptance.

utterances.text: I firmly believe that if we invested in funds we could earn a lot of money .
utterances.scene: A person expresses strong confidence and optimism about a financial investment strategy, articulating a belief in potential high returns.

utterances.text: All wet.You are such a fool .
utterances.scene: The other person responds with extreme dismissiveness and insult, rejecting the idea entirely and expressing contempt for the speaker's judgment.

utterances.text: Good afternoon , sir . What can I do for you ?
utterances.scene: A pharmacist or shop assistant greets a customer politely and professionally, offering assistance.

utterances.text: I'd like to get this prescription filled .
utterances.scene: The customer states their primary purpose for visiting the pharmacy, presenting a prescription. The tone is straightforward.

utterances.text: No problem . Please wait a minute . ( She goes to the back for a few minutes . ) Here is your medicine , sir . Take two tablets after each meal and once before bed .
utterances.scene: The assistant confirms the request, asks the customer to wait, then returns with the medicine and provides clear dosage instructions, maintaining a helpful and professional demeanor.

utterances.text: Thanks . Do you sell aspirin here ?
utterances.scene: The customer expresses gratitude for the filled prescription and then inquires about an additional over-the-counter item, showing a continued need.

utterances.text: Yes , our over-the-counter medicine is over there on that shelf .
utterances.scene: The assistant confirms the availability of aspirin and directs the customer to its location, maintaining a helpful and informative tone.

utterances.text: Oh , I see it . Do you have multi-vitamins ?
utterances.scene: The customer acknowledges the direction and then asks about yet another item, indicating a comprehensive shopping trip for health products.

utterances.text: Yes , right over here .
utterances.scene: The assistant confirms the availability of multi-vitamins and directs the customer to their location, continuing to be helpful.

utterances.text: ( The customer gets the aspirin and vitamins . ) That'll be $ 16.00 .
utterances.scene: After the customer has gathered their items, the assistant states the total cost, initiating the payment process.

utterances.text: Here's a twenty .
utterances.scene: The customer offers a twenty-dollar bill for payment, indicating readiness to complete the transaction.

utterances.text: Here's your change . Thank you .
utterances.scene: The assistant returns the change and thanks the customer, concluding the transaction politely.

utterances.text: How long do we stop over here ?
utterances.scene: A passenger asks about the duration of a layover, expressing curiosity or a need for information about their travel schedule.

utterances.text: 2 hours .
utterances.scene: A flight attendant or travel personnel provides a direct and concise answer to the inquiry.

utterances.text: What for ?
utterances.scene: The passenger asks for the reason behind the stopover, indicating a desire for more understanding.

utterances.text: The plane must fuel before flying to Paris .
utterances.scene: The personnel explains the necessary reason for the stopover, providing practical information about flight operations.

utterances.text: Can we get off the plane ?
utterances.scene: The passenger, now understanding the stopover, inquires about the possibility of disembarking, perhaps hoping to stretch or explore.

utterances.text: Surely of course .
utterances.scene: The personnel confirms that passengers are allowed to disembark, reassuring them with a polite and affirmative response.

utterances.text: Do you have anything to declare ?
utterances.scene: A customs officer formally asks a traveler about goods to declare, initiating a standard border control procedure. The tone is official and interrogative.

utterances.text: I have a camera and three bottles of whisky .
utterances.scene: The traveler truthfully declares items, specifically mentioning items that might be subject to duty. The tone is compliant.

utterances.text: OK . You'll have to pay duty for the whisky .
utterances.scene: The customs officer acknowledges the declaration and informs the traveler of the requirement to pay duty on the whisky, indicating a specific regulation.

utterances.text: Well , where shall I pay the duty for the whisky ?
utterances.scene: The traveler accepts the requirement and asks for instructions on where to complete the payment, showing readiness to comply.

utterances.text: Please wait a moment . I'll make out the duty memo . Here you are . Take this and pay the people over there .
utterances.scene: The customs officer instructs the traveler to wait, prepares the necessary document, and then directs them to the payment location, maintaining an efficient and official demeanor.

utterances.text: I've paid the duty . Here is the receipt
utterances.scene: The traveler returns, having completed the payment, and presents proof, demonstrating compliance with the instructions.

utterances.text: Very well . I hope you'll enjoy your stay in China .
utterances.scene: The customs officer acknowledges the completed process, expresses satisfaction, and offers a polite farewell, concluding the customs procedure.

utterances.text: Thank you .
utterances.scene: The traveler expresses gratitude for the smooth processing, responding politely to the farewell.

utterances.text: The skirt looks beautiful . Can I try it on ?
utterances.scene: A customer expresses admiration for a skirt and asks for permission to try it on, indicating interest in purchasing. The tone is appreciative and inquisitive.

utterances.text: Of course .
utterances.scene: A shop assistant readily grants permission, maintaining a helpful and accommodating tone.

utterances.text: Well , I think this one is a little too small . Would you please bring me a bigger one ?
utterances.scene: The customer, having tried on the skirt, expresses dissatisfaction with the fit and requests a larger size, indicating a continued interest despite the initial sizing issue. The tone is polite and practical.

utterances.text: I am sorry the larger ones are out of stock now . But you might be lucky at our Branch .
utterances.scene: The shop assistant apologizes for the unavailability of the requested size and offers an alternative solution, expressing regret but trying to be helpful.

utterances.text: I want to reserve rooms for my colleagues .
utterances.scene: A person makes a request to book multiple hotel rooms for their colleagues, indicating a business or group travel arrangement. The tone is professional and direct.

utterances.text: What kind of rooms do you want ?
utterances.scene: A hotel receptionist or staff member asks for specific details about the room types required, initiating the booking process. The tone is professional and inquisitive.

utterances.text: A single room with a bath and one double room facing the lake .
utterances.scene: The person provides precise specifications for the rooms, detailing amenities and views, ensuring their colleagues' preferences are met.

utterances.text: No problem . Your room numbers are 201 and 204 .
utterances.scene: The receptionist confirms the reservation, indicating success and providing the assigned room numbers, concluding the booking process efficiently. The tone is reassuring and efficient.

utterances.text: Thank you .
utterances.scene: The person expresses gratitude for the successful and efficient reservation.

utterances.text: Hi ! Fiona ? I almost didn't recognize you . You are much thinner since I last saw you .
utterances.scene: A casual and friendly reunion, where one person expresses surprise and admiration at Fiona's weight loss, indicating a positive emotional tone.

utterances.text: Yes . I have lost about ten kilos .
utterances.scene: Fiona confirms the observation with a sense of accomplishment and pride, responding to the compliment.

utterances.text: How did you do it ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker expresses curiosity and interest in Fiona's method for losing weight, seeking advice.

utterances.text: I am on a diet . And I do more exercise regularly .
utterances.scene: Fiona explains her successful strategy for weight loss, providing practical information in a helpful tone.

utterances.text: What's the secret then ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker, still curious, probes for deeper insight or a specific trick, implying a belief there's more to it than just diet and exercise.

utterances.text: It lies in perseverance .
utterances.scene: Fiona shares the core principle behind her success, emphasizing the importance of dedication and consistency in a slightly philosophical but encouraging tone.

utterances.text: Well . It's hard for me . I can't keep doing exercise .
utterances.scene: The first speaker expresses a feeling of difficulty and discouragement regarding their own ability to maintain an exercise routine, revealing a personal struggle.

utterances.text: You should have a try .
utterances.scene: Fiona offers gentle encouragement and a positive suggestion, trying to motivate the other person despite their expressed difficulties.

utterances.text: Excuse me . Can I open a postal savings account in your office ?
utterances.scene: A customer politely initiates an inquiry about opening a specific type of bank account, indicating a formal and transactional context.

utterances.text: Of course . What kind of postal savings account do you want to open ?
utterances.scene: The bank employee responds positively and professionally, then asks for more specific information to assist the customer.

utterances.text: Hum .. Can you recommend me one with high interest ?
utterances.scene: The customer expresses a preference for a high-yield account, seeking expert advice on the best option.

utterances.text: OK . We offer a few different kinds of postal saving services . They have different interest rates .
utterances.scene: The employee acknowledges the request and provides general information about the available options, preparing to elaborate.

utterances.text: I want the one with the highest interest rate .
utterances.scene: The customer clarifies their specific desire, making a clear choice based on the highest possible return.

utterances.text: That would be our Savers Plus account . You must pay 10 000 yuan into your deposit account . In this way you can get 5 % dividend at the end of the year .
utterances.scene: The employee identifies the specific account and details its requirements and benefits, providing crucial financial information.

utterances.text: All right . I'II open this one .
utterances.scene: The customer agrees to open the recommended account, expressing satisfaction with the information provided.

utterances.text: Just fill out these forms , and I ’ ll be with you in one second .
utterances.scene: The employee instructs the customer on the next steps for opening the account, indicating a move towards completing the transaction.

utterances.text: Thanks .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses polite gratitude to the employee for their assistance.

utterances.text: What kind of cuisine do you have ?
utterances.scene: A customer politely inquires about the food options available at a restaurant, indicating a desire to order.

utterances.text: We have Sichuan food , Hangzhou food and Beijing Food . Which do you like best ?
utterances.scene: The waiter lists the available cuisines and then prompts the customer to state their preference, offering helpful service.

utterances.text: Hangzhou food .
utterances.scene: The customer states their clear preference for a specific type of cuisine.

utterances.text: OK . How about Dongpo meat ?
utterances.scene: The waiter, having noted the preference, suggests a specific dish from that cuisine, indicating helpfulness.

utterances.text: All right . I'll take it .
utterances.scene: The customer accepts the suggestion, making a decision to order the recommended dish.

utterances.text: Do you like to use chopsticks
utterances.scene: The waiter asks a practical question about the customer's preferred eating utensil, anticipating their needs.

utterances.text: Yes , I like using chopsticks .
utterances.scene: The customer confirms their preference for chopsticks, indicating comfort with the utensil.

utterances.text: Do you like some soup ?
utterances.scene: The waiter offers an additional item, soup, to enhance the customer's meal.

utterances.text: Yes , but I don't know what soup you have .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses interest in soup but needs more information about the available varieties before making a choice.

utterances.text: We have beef soup and tomato soup .
utterances.scene: The waiter provides the specific soup options available, assisting the customer in their decision.

utterances.text: Good . I prefer beef soup .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses satisfaction with the options and makes a clear choice for beef soup.

utterances.text: According to usual practices , we serve dishes first and then soup . If you like we'll bring you some soup first .
utterances.scene: The waiter explains the standard serving order and then offers flexibility to accommodate the customer's preference, showing attentiveness.

utterances.text: Save it until you've served dishes .
utterances.scene: The customer decides to stick with the traditional serving order, indicating no special preference for early soup.

utterances.text: All right . I'll be back right away .
utterances.scene: The waiter confirms the order and assures the customer of prompt service, concluding the ordering process.

utterances.text: Excuse me , is there a department store near here ?
utterances.scene: A person politely asks for directions to a department store, indicating a need for shopping.

utterances.text: Yes , there ’ s a department store in Wang Fu Jing .
utterances.scene: The other person provides a direct answer, confirming the presence of a department store and its general location.

utterances.text: Where ’ s Wang Fu Jing ?
utterances.scene: The first person, still needing more specific guidance, asks for the location of the mentioned area.

utterances.text: It ’ s to the east of Tiananmen Square .
utterances.scene: The second person provides a more precise geographical reference using a well-known landmark, offering clear directions.

utterances.text: Thank you .
utterances.scene: The first person expresses gratitude for the helpful directions.

utterances.text: You ’ re welcome .
utterances.scene: The second person responds courteously, acknowledging the thanks.

utterances.text: How much is it to rent an economy car ?
utterances.scene: A customer inquires about the cost of renting a specific type of car, initiating a rental transaction.

utterances.text: $ 19 a day or $ 129 a week , unlimited mileage .
utterances.scene: The rental agent provides pricing details and a key benefit (unlimited mileage), offering clear options.

utterances.text: Could I have one for tomorrow morning ?
utterances.scene: The customer expresses their desire to book a car for a specific time, moving forward with the rental process.

utterances.text: Could I see your driver's license ?
utterances.scene: The rental agent requests a mandatory document for car rental, following standard procedure.

utterances.text: Sure here it is .
utterances.scene: The customer readily provides the requested document, complying with the rental procedure.

utterances.text: Good . Now just complete this form .
utterances.scene: The agent approves the driver's license and instructs the customer on the next step to finalize the rental, indicating progress.

utterances.text: Why is there water all over the bathroom floor ?
utterances.scene: One person discovers a mess and asks for an explanation, expressing mild frustration or concern.

utterances.text: I'm sorry - it's my fault . I was filling the bathtub and I left the water running too long , so it overflowed .
utterances.scene: The other person immediately takes responsibility and apologizes, explaining the accidental cause of the overflow, showing regret.

utterances.text: That's OK . As long as you clean it up .
utterances.scene: The first person accepts the apology and sets a condition for forgiveness, indicating a practical and forgiving but firm tone.

utterances.text: Can I help you ?
utterances.scene: A hotel staff member offers assistance to a potential guest, initiating a customer service interaction.

utterances.text: Yes , is there any vacant room for tomorrow ?
utterances.scene: A customer inquires about room availability for a specific date, seeking accommodation.

utterances.text: I am sorry . We are full up for tomorrow .
utterances.scene: The staff member apologizes and informs the customer that there are no rooms available, expressing regret.

utterances.text: Well , is there any other hotel nearby ?
utterances.scene: The customer, still needing accommodation, asks for alternative options, showing a continued need.

utterances.text: Yes , the Sunset Hotel is three blocks away . Maybe you can ask them .
utterances.scene: The staff member provides a helpful suggestion for another hotel nearby, going beyond the direct service to assist the customer.

utterances.text: Thank you .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses gratitude for the helpful suggestion, appreciating the assistance.

utterances.text: What ’ s up ?
utterances.scene: A casual greeting is exchanged, indicating a friendly and informal interaction.

utterances.text: I guess there is some kind of virus seeking into my computer , I can ’ t send out this e-mail . Do you have the number of the text port ?
utterances.scene: One person expresses concern and frustration about a computer problem, believing it's a virus, and seeks technical help.

utterances.text: Do you mind I have a look at your computer ?
utterances.scene: The other person offers direct technical assistance, showing willingness to help and a practical approach.

utterances.text: Of course not , I appreciate that .
utterances.scene: The first person readily accepts the offer of help, expressing gratitude and relief.

utterances.text: Well , it has nothing to do with virus . The problem is your attachment is a bit larger . It has exceeded the e-mail capacity .
utterances.scene: The helper diagnoses the computer problem, correcting the initial assumption and explaining the actual technical issue clearly.

utterances.text: I see . What can I do now ?
utterances.scene: The first person understands the explanation and asks for a solution or next steps, showing a desire to resolve the issue.

utterances.text: You can send a compressed one .
utterances.scene: The helper provides a practical solution to the problem, offering clear technical advice.

utterances.text: Try it on in front of the mirror .
utterances.scene: A salesperson instructs a customer to try on a garment, encouraging them to visualize the fit and appearance.

utterances.text: Well , I think the color is a little too bright .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses a reservation about the garment's color, indicating a personal preference and a need for an alternative.

utterances.text: We have darker ones . Do you like the style ?
utterances.scene: The salesperson offers alternatives based on the customer's feedback and then asks for input on another aspect, the style, to narrow down choices.

utterances.text: Yes . What's this made of and how to wash it ?
utterances.scene: The customer confirms satisfaction with the style but then asks practical questions about the garment's material and care instructions, showing interest in purchase.

utterances.text: lt's made of silk and you had better wash it by hand in cold water .
utterances.scene: The salesperson provides detailed information about the garment's material and specific care instructions, assisting the customer with their purchase decision.

utterances.text: Steven , you are always looking in good shape . How do you keep it ?
utterances.scene: A person compliments Steven on his physical appearance and asks for his secrets, showing admiration and curiosity.

utterances.text: I pay much attention to my daily diet . You know good eating habits help to fortify the body against disease .
utterances.scene: Steven reveals his main strategy for maintaining health, emphasizing diet and explaining its benefits, speaking with conviction.

utterances.text: Yeah , you are right . Tell me your normal diet .
utterances.scene: The first person agrees with Steven's point and eagerly requests more specific details about his daily eating routine, showing strong interest.

utterances.text: I eat more fruits and vegetables and limit amounts of fatty and fried foods .
utterances.scene: Steven details specific dietary choices he makes, providing practical advice on healthy eating habits.

utterances.text: And ?
utterances.scene: The first person prompts Steven for more information, indicating sustained interest and an expectation of further tips.

utterances.text: I drink milk every day . It's really good for building strong bones and teeth . I drink tea quite often , for it's protective against kidney cancer .
utterances.scene: Steven continues to share more specific dietary habits, explaining the health benefits of each, demonstrating his knowledge and commitment.

utterances.text: Oh , no wonder you are healthy .
utterances.scene: The first person expresses understanding and realization, connecting Steven's habits to his good health, showing admiration.

utterances.text: You are what you eat , and a healthy diet creates a body resistant to disease .
utterances.scene: Steven reiterates his philosophy on diet and health, offering a concise summary and reinforcing the importance of good nutrition.

utterances.text: Thanks for sharing your experience with me .
utterances.scene: The first person expresses sincere gratitude for the valuable health advice and shared personal experience.

utterances.text: You're welcome !
utterances.scene: Steven responds politely, acknowledging the thanks and concluding the helpful exchange.

utterances.text: Emergency road service . May I help you ?
utterances.scene: A customer service representative answers a call, initiating a professional and helpful interaction.

utterances.text: I have a flat tyre .
utterances.scene: The caller states their problem directly and calmly, indicating a need for assistance.

utterances.text: All right . What's your membership card , please ?
utterances.scene: The representative calmly acknowledges the issue and begins the process of gathering necessary information for service.
The caller provides the requested membership number, cooperating with the service process.

utterances.text: And your name ?
utterances.scene: The representative continues to gather essential customer details in a routine, professional manner.

utterances.text: Eve .
utterances.scene: The caller provides their name, maintaining cooperation.

utterances.text: What's the expiration date on your card ?
utterances.scene: The representative asks for the card's expiration date, following standard verification procedures.

utterances.text: It's July 16,2009 .
utterances.scene: The caller provides the expiration date, continuing to assist the representative.

utterances.text: Where is your car now ?
utterances.scene: The representative shifts to gathering details about the vehicle's location, crucial for dispatching help.

utterances.text: It's on the west street , near Royal Hotel .
utterances.scene: The caller gives a specific location for their car, providing clear instructions for assistance.

utterances.text: And which direction were you going ?
utterances.scene: The representative asks for the direction of travel, which can sometimes help narrow down the exact location on a long street.

utterances.text: I was going west .
utterances.scene: The caller provides the direction of travel, assisting further with location accuracy.

utterances.text: What is the make and model of your car ?
utterances.scene: The representative requests vehicle specifics, which are important for identifying the car and potentially for the tow truck.

utterances.text: BMW 530 .
utterances.scene: The caller states the make and model of their car, providing necessary vehicle information.

utterances.text: What color is it ?
utterances.scene: The representative asks about the car's color, another key detail for identification.

utterances.text: It's red .
utterances.scene: The caller provides the car's color, completing the vehicle description.

utterances.text: What's your licence plate number ?
utterances.scene: The representative requests the license plate number, a final crucial piece of identification.

utterances.text: SAY 201 .
utterances.scene: The caller states their license plate number, providing all requested identification.

utterances.text: All right , Madam . I'll have a tow truck there within 30 minutes .
utterances.scene: The representative confirms the details and reassures the caller that help is on the way, concluding the interaction on a helpful and efficient note.

utterances.text: How do you do , Mr . Johnson ? I'm Thomas .
utterances.scene: The applicant formally greets the interviewer, introducing themselves with a polite and eager tone.

utterances.text: How do you do ?

utterances.text: I'm coming for the job you've advertised in yesterday's newspaper .
utterances.scene: The applicant clearly states the purpose of their visit, sounding confident and prepared for the interview.

utterances.text: OK . What's your working experience ?

utterances.text: Are you aware of the aspects of this position and do you feel you are qualified ?

utterances.text: Yes , I understand my qualification and your needs by researching your company .
utterances.scene: The applicant confirms their understanding and preparation, showing thoroughness and confidence.

utterances.text: If you enter this company , what section would you like to work in ?

utterances.text: Then , what starting salary do you expect ?

utterances.text: I'd like to start at RIB 4,000 a month .
utterances.scene: The applicant states their expected starting salary, demonstrating confidence and a clear understanding of their worth.

utterances.text: We are interested in some precision machine tools . We have some inquires on hand .

utterances.text: Why , of course . Here are some that will show you our latest development . You may select which ever you need .

utterances.text: I think our users have the impression that your prices are always much too high , compared with those of other supplies .

utterances.text: Excuse me . It's true that our products do cost slightly more than the other makers , but It's only due to our technological superiority .

utterances.text: Your products may have certain advantages , but your prices are too stiff .

utterances.text: If you give us your inquiry , I shall go very carefully into the price and try my best to put you on the best of the terms .

utterances.text: OK , I'll come back to discuss it to some details after our users have studied your catalogues and price list .
utterances.scene: The buyer agrees to further discussion after internal review, indicating a cautious but continued interest.

utterances.text: Yes , surely . We hope to do some substantial business with you .
utterances.scene: The seller expresses hope for a substantial business deal, ending the interaction on an optimistic and forward-looking note.

utterances.text: Look , here is a very special business card from an illustrator . Every time I go through my book of business cards , I will notice it . It is an eye-catching one .

utterances.text: Wow , fantastic . I like the font and color for his name . It is creative yet personal .

utterances.text: Yes , it is a bold design . People will believe he can make an illustration as an impressive as a business card . It just stands out from those plain and standard ones used by government people or other big private and public organizations .

utterances.text: I agree . Business cards are great tools for promoting personal business . It won ’ t take much time to design an amazing card , but it can make a big difference among the crowd . And you ’ ll always notice it from your collection . For they have outspoken colors , own design and the sizes are not always according the mainstream business card . I wish to have one like this . But for sure our company has its own corporate design which all employees have to follow .
utterances.scene: The listener agrees wholeheartedly, reflecting on the power of business cards for promotion and expressing a desire for a similar card, while acknowledging corporate design constraints.

utterances.text: Are you crazy ? You have no idea what you are talking about ! Just for my eyes I have to get eye-liner , an eyelash curler , eye shadow , an eyebrow pencil and mascara . Then I need to get foundation , liq

utterances.text: These goods can be broken very easily , so we would be thankful if you would be sure to use durable packing materials .
