utterances.scene: The second speaker confirms that this is standard practice but offers to personally ensure it's done, showing attentiveness and a desire to reassure the client.

utterances.text: Do you always put a quality mark on each container ? For this shipment it is crucial to us that you do .
utterances.scene: The first speaker makes a third crucial request about a quality mark, stressing its absolute importance for this particular shipment.

utterances.text: We don't usually do that unless we are asked to . I'lI tell my staff to take care of this for you .
utterances.scene: The second speaker admits this is not standard but readily agrees to implement it for this shipment, showing flexibility and commitment to client needs.

utterances.text: Thanks . This shipment is so important to us there cannot be any foul-ups .
utterances.scene: The first speaker expresses gratitude and reiterates the critical importance of the shipment, emphasizing the need to avoid any errors, conveying a sense of high stakes.

utterances.text: Our Afghan customers wanna buy China's tea . I am thinking of placing an order with you .
utterances.scene: The speaker informs the other party about a potential large order from Afghan customers for Chinese tea, expressing an intention to place an order.

utterances.text: Which tea do you prefer , black or jasmine tea ?
utterances.scene: The second speaker immediately seeks clarification on the specific type of tea preferred, demonstrating readiness to cater to the client's needs.

utterances.text: I like both . Could you show me some samples ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker expresses interest in both types and requests samples, indicating a need for visual and tangible assessment before making a decision.

utterances.text: Of course , here you are . These are Black tea from Anti , Oolong tea from Guangdong , Oolong tea from Fujisan and Longing tea from Xinu . The new products are Curls Black tea , Crushed Black tea and so on . They are the best sellers in many countries .
utterances.scene: The second speaker presents a wide variety of tea samples, highlighting their origin and popularity, aiming to impress and showcase their extensive product range.

utterances.text: Oh , such a variety . All of them are excellent both in color and flavour . No wonder our people like China ’ s tea better than any other kind . Could you give me some idea of the prices ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker expresses admiration for the variety and quality of the teas, acknowledging their appeal to their customers, and then requests pricing information.

utterances.text: Here is our price list . All the prices on the list are subject to our final confirmation . You can see the prices are reasonable .
utterances.scene: The second speaker presents a price list, noting that prices are subject to confirmation and emphasizing their reasonableness, aiming for transparency and fair value.

utterances.text: I'd like you to quote me CIF Karachi .
utterances.scene: The first speaker specifies the desired shipping terms (CIF Karachi), indicating a clear understanding of international trade procedures.

utterances.text: Right . Could you tell us the quantity you require so that we can work out the offer ?
utterances.scene: The second speaker requests the quantity required to formulate an offer, indicating a readiness to proceed with the quotation process.

utterances.text: Yes . I want 500 kilograms of Black tea from Anti , 200 kilograms of Jasmine tea from Hangzhou and 100 kilograms of Crushed Black tea , first grade .
utterances.scene: The first speaker provides specific quantities and grades for different types of tea, detailing their order requirements.

utterances.text: Good . We will make the offer tomorrow afternoon . Is that all right ?
utterances.scene: The second speaker confirms receipt of the order details and sets a timeline for the offer, seeking agreement on the schedule.

utterances.text: Yes . See you tomorrow afternoon .
utterances.scene: The first speaker agrees to the proposed meeting time, concluding the initial business discussion with a clear plan for the next step.

utterances.text: Hello , how are you doing today ?
utterances.scene: A medical professional initiates a conversation with a patient, starting with a polite and routine greeting. The tone is professional and welcoming.

utterances.text: I ’ Ve been having trouble breathing lately .
utterances.scene: The patient expresses a serious concern about their health, indicating discomfort and potential distress related to a physical symptom. The tone is worried.

utterances.text: Have you had any type of cold lately ?
utterances.scene: The medical professional begins to probe for common causes of respiratory issues, showing a systematic approach to diagnosis. The tone is investigative and calm.

utterances.text: No , I haven ’ t had a cold . I just have a heavy feeling in my chest when I try to breathe .
utterances.scene: The patient clarifies their symptoms, ruling out a common cold and providing more specific details about their chest discomfort. The tone is descriptive and concerned.

utterances.text: Do you have any allergies that you know of ?
utterances.scene: The medical professional continues to ask about potential causes, shifting to another common factor for breathing problems. The tone is systematic.

utterances.text: No , I don ’ t have any allergies that I know of .
utterances.scene: The patient denies having known allergies, further narrowing down the potential causes for their symptoms. The tone is factual.

utterances.text: Does this happen all the time or mostly when you are active ?
utterances.scene: The medical professional asks about the timing and triggers of the symptoms, trying to understand the pattern of the discomfort. The tone is analytical.

utterances.text: It happens a lot when I work out .
utterances.scene: The patient provides a crucial piece of information about when their breathing trouble is most pronounced, linking it to physical exertion. The tone is informative.

utterances.text: I am going to send you to a pulmonary specialist who can run tests on you for asthma .
utterances.scene: The medical professional decides on the next step in the diagnostic process, referring the patient to a specialist for further evaluation, suggesting a possible diagnosis of asthma. The tone is professional and reassuring.

utterances.text: Thank you for your help , doctor .
utterances.scene: The patient expresses gratitude for the doctor's assistance and the proposed plan of action. The tone is relieved and appreciative.

utterances.text: I have a reservation for a single with bath .
utterances.scene: A guest arrives at a hotel to check in, stating their specific reservation details. The tone is straightforward and expectant.

utterances.text: We are sorry , but single rooms have been occupied .
utterances.scene: The hotel staff apologizes, informing the guest that their reserved room type is unavailable, indicating a problem with the reservation. The tone is apologetic and slightly regretful.

utterances.text: What's the room rate ? It is a little expensive for me , do you have any other rooms ?
utterances.scene: The guest, likely feeling frustrated or inconvenienced, questions the price of an alternative room and asks for cheaper options. The tone is concerned about cost and seeking alternatives.

utterances.text: Then how about this room , with just shower ?
utterances.scene: The hotel staff suggests a different room type, possibly a slightly less expensive or available option, to accommodate the guest. The tone is helpful and problem-solving.

utterances.text: May I see the room ? I ’ ll take this room . Is the rate for the room only ?
utterances.scene: The guest requests to see the proposed room before accepting it, then agrees, but immediately follows up with a question about the total cost. The tone is decisive but still cautious about price.

utterances.text: No , sir . The tax is included .
utterances.scene: The hotel staff clarifies the pricing, confirming that the stated rate is inclusive of tax. The tone is informative and reassuring.

utterances.text: How many candidates do you choose for the first round ?
utterances.scene: One colleague or team member asks another about the number of candidates selected for the initial stage of a hiring process. The tone is inquisitive and business-oriented.

utterances.text: I have chosen 15 candidates . The first round interview is tomorrow .
utterances.scene: The person responsible for selection provides the number of chosen candidates and the schedule for the first round of interviews. The tone is informative and organized.

utterances.text: The first round ?
utterances.scene: The first speaker expresses surprise or seeks clarification, possibly implying they expected a different number or process. The tone is questioning or slightly surprised.

utterances.text: Right . We'll choose the 4 best candidates and have them come back for a second interview . The top one of them will be the one we will hire .
utterances.scene: The second speaker confirms the process and details the subsequent stages of the hiring, outlining the selection criteria and final decision. The tone is explanatory and definitive.

utterances.text: What is the annual salary for this job ?
utterances.scene: An individual, likely a job applicant or new employee, begins to inquire about the financial compensation for a position. The tone is direct and focused on salary.

utterances.text: The annual salary is sixty-five thousand dollars per year .
utterances.scene: The employer or HR representative provides the specific annual salary for the job. The tone is informative and factual.

utterances.text: What does the benefits package include ?
utterances.scene: The individual shifts their inquiry to the non-salary compensation, asking about the benefits offered with the job. The tone is inquisitive and comprehensive.

utterances.text: This job pays for half of your medical , dental , and disability .
utterances.scene: The employer details specific components of the benefits package, focusing on health-related coverages. The tone is informative.

utterances.text: Do we get paid time off ?
utterances.scene: The individual asks about paid leave, a common and important benefit for employees. The tone is practical.

utterances.text: You have a total of 21 days paid time off which can be used for vacation , personal , or sick leave .
utterances.scene: The employer provides a clear and detailed answer regarding the amount and flexibility of paid time off. The tone is informative.

utterances.text: How about retirement ?
utterances.scene: The individual continues their comprehensive inquiry, now focusing on long-term financial planning and retirement benefits. The tone is forward-looking.

utterances.text: We still offer a traditional retirement plan that pays out if you stay with the company for 5 years or more .
utterances.scene: The employer explains the specific retirement plan offered, including a vesting period. The tone is informative and outlines conditions.

utterances.text: Can I get company provided specialized training ?
utterances.scene: The individual inquires about opportunities for professional development and skill enhancement provided by the company. The tone is ambitious and growth-oriented.

utterances.text: We offer full tuition reimbursement for job related classes .
utterances.scene: The employer details the company's policy on supporting employee education and training, specifically tuition reimbursement. The tone is supportive and encouraging.

utterances.text: Where is the benefits office ?
utterances.scene: Having gathered the necessary information, the individual asks for the physical location to manage or learn more about these benefits. The tone is practical and action-oriented.

utterances.text: It's on the second floor in Suite 201 .
utterances.scene: The employer provides the exact location of the benefits office. The tone is helpful and direct.

utterances.text: Welcome to IBA Bank , how can we be of service ?
utterances.scene: A bank employee greets a customer politely, initiating the interaction and offering assistance. The tone is professional and welcoming.

utterances.text: I spoke to a girl named Claire on the phone ; it's about losing my card and everything .
utterances.scene: The customer explains their reason for visiting, referencing a previous phone conversation and stating the critical issue of a lost bank card. The tone is slightly distressed and seeking help.

utterances.text: What I need you to do first is fill in these forms , with as much detail as possible . Then we can get you a new card .
utterances.scene: The bank employee outlines the initial procedural steps for reporting a lost card and getting a replacement. The tone is instructional and procedural.

utterances.text: So , I can get my new card today ?
utterances.scene: The customer, likely anxious to regain access to their funds, asks for immediate resolution regarding the replacement card. The tone is hopeful and impatient.

utterances.text: I'm sorry , Sir , the full procedure can take up to 7 days to process everything .
utterances.scene: The bank employee apologizes and informs the customer about the extended processing time for a new card, managing expectations. The tone is apologetic but firm about policy.

utterances.text: 7 days ! What am I supposed to do for money until then ?
utterances.scene: The customer reacts with strong frustration and distress, expressing concern about immediate financial access due to the delay. The tone is angry and desperate.

utterances.text: If you bring some ID with you , it's possible for you to make a withdrawal over the counter if you need to . But unfortunately , without your new card you cannot use the ATM , so all withdrawals must be made within working hours .
utterances.scene: The bank employee offers a temporary solution for accessing funds while waiting for the new card, explaining the limitations. The tone is helpful and empathetic, while still stating facts.

utterances.text: Hey , young lady , get back here and have some breakfast .
utterances.scene: A parent calls out to their child, urging them to come back and eat breakfast. The tone is authoritative but caring, with a hint of exasperation.

utterances.text: Dad ! I don't have time ! I'll be late for school !
utterances.scene: The child, in a hurry, protests against the demand to eat breakfast, expressing urgency about being late for school. The tone is rushed and slightly exasperated.

utterances.text: You won't make it through the day without breakfast .
utterances.scene: The parent reiterates the importance of breakfast, appealing to the child's well-being and energy levels. The tone is firm and concerned.

utterances.text: Dad , I never eat breakfast .
utterances.scene: The child challenges the parent's assumption, stating a long-standing habit of skipping breakfast. The tone is defiant and dismissive.

utterances.text: Breakfast is brain food . Maybe that's why your grades are Suffering .
utterances.scene: The parent escalates the argument by linking breakfast to academic performance, using a common idiom and a playful jab. The tone is persuasive and slightly teasing.

utterances.text: Uh ! Dad !
utterances.scene: The child reacts with exasperation and annoyance to the parent's comment, likely feeling unfairly targeted or annoyed by the teasing. The tone is frustrated and annoyed.

utterances.text: Don't ' Uh , Dad ' me . Sit down and have some lovely breakfast .
utterances.scene: The parent asserts their authority, dismissing the child's protest and firmly instructing them to eat. The tone is authoritative and resolute.

utterances.text: Alright . You win . Please pass the brain food .
utterances.scene: The child capitulates to the parent's demand, acknowledging defeat with a touch of sarcasm, adopting the parent's 'brain food' term. The tone is resigned but with a hint of playful sarcasm.

utterances.text: I'm getting a tattoo tomorrow .
utterances.scene: One person shares a personal decision to get a tattoo, perhaps expecting a reaction. The tone is declarative and a little excited or anticipatory.

utterances.text: Are you nuts ?
utterances.scene: The second person reacts with strong disbelief and disapproval, expressing shock at the first person's decision. The tone is incredulous, judgmental, and possibly worried.

utterances.text: John , I'm sorry , the air tickets for the International Day are sold out .
utterances.scene: One person delivers disappointing news to another, informing them that desired event tickets are unavailable. The tone is apologetic and regretful.

utterances.text: Really ? I didn't expect that .
utterances.scene: John expresses surprise and mild disappointment upon hearing the news, indicating a lack of foresight or underestimation of demand. The tone is surprised and slightly regretful.

utterances.text: It's possible because everyone wants to travel during the holiday weekend .
utterances.scene: The first person provides an explanation for the tickets being sold out, attributing it to high demand during a popular travel period. The tone is explanatory and understanding.

utterances.text: I should have booked the tickets in advance .
utterances.scene: John expresses self-reproach and regret for not having acted sooner, acknowledging his mistake. The tone is regretful and self-critical.

utterances.text: Take it easy . I'll like you know if anyone decides to cancel his reservation .
utterances.scene: The first person attempts to console John and offers a glimmer of hope, suggesting a potential solution if cancellations occur. The tone is comforting and helpful.

utterances.text: Can you tell me where it hurts ?
utterances.scene: A medical professional or first responder asks a patient to pinpoint the location of their pain. The tone is calm and diagnostic.

utterances.text: I am so glad they called you . It feels like something is really wrong with my stomach !
utterances.scene: The patient expresses relief at the medical professional's arrival and conveys intense worry and discomfort about their stomach pain. The tone is anxious and distressed.

utterances.text: Does it hurt when I push here ?
utterances.scene: The medical professional performs a physical examination, applying pressure to a specific area to assess the pain response. The tone is clinical and focused on diagnosis.

utterances.text: It ’ s mostly on my right side . Right here !
utterances.scene: The patient clearly indicates the specific area of most intense pain during the examination, confirming the location. The tone is descriptive and urgent.

utterances.text: Have you been feeling this way for awhile ?
utterances.scene: The medical professional asks about the duration of the symptoms to understand the timeline of the illness. The tone is investigative.

utterances.text: I started feeling kind of sick last night after dinner , but this morning the pain got really bad !
utterances.scene: The patient describes the onset and progression of their symptoms, highlighting a significant worsening of pain. The tone is descriptive and concerned.

utterances.text: Have you eaten anything unusual lately ?
utterances.scene: The medical professional inquires about recent dietary habits, looking for potential causes like food poisoning or irritation. The tone is investigative.

utterances.text: No , not that I remember .
utterances.scene: The patient denies having eaten anything out of the ordinary, ruling out a common cause. The tone is factual.

utterances.text: We are going to take you to an emergency room right now .
utterances.scene: The medical professional makes a decisive and urgent decision to transport the patient to an emergency room, indicating the seriousness of the condition. The tone is urgent and authoritative.

utterances.text: I will feel better when I know what the problem is . Thank you for the drugs .
utterances.scene: The patient expresses a desire for diagnosis and relief, and thanks the medical professional for any pain relief medication given. The tone is hopeful for resolution and grateful for comfort.

utterances.text: Good morning , sir . Can I help you ?
utterances.scene: An airline or airport staff member greets a passenger politely and offers assistance. The tone is professional and welcoming.

utterances.text: Yes , I need to check-in for the eleven 20 flight to New York , please .
utterances.scene: The passenger states their purpose, indicating they need to check in for a specific flight. The tone is direct and task-oriented.

utterances.text: O . K . Ticket , please .
utterances.scene: The staff member requests the passenger's ticket to proceed with the check-in process. The tone is procedural and efficient.

utterances.text: Here you are .
utterances.scene: The passenger hands over their ticket to the staff member. The tone is compliant and cooperative.

utterances.text: Would you like a window or an aisle seat , Mr . Smith ?
utterances.scene: The staff member asks about the passenger's seating preference, a common part of the check-in process. The tone is polite and helpful.

utterances.text: I want an aisle seat as close to the exit door as possible , please .
utterances.scene: The passenger states a specific and detailed seating preference, indicating a desire for easy access. The tone is polite but firm in its request.

utterances.text: Very well . Do you have any bags to check ?
utterances.scene: The staff member acknowledges the seating request and moves on to the next procedural step, inquiring about luggage. The tone is efficient and procedural.

utterances.text: No , I just have this one small bag .
utterances.scene: The passenger indicates they only have a carry-on bag and no luggage to check. The tone is factual and concise.

utterances.text: Here you are , seat 12c . Please go to gate 23 after passing through the security checkpoint .
utterances.scene: The staff member provides the boarding pass with the assigned seat and gives instructions for proceeding to the gate and security. The tone is informative and instructional.

utterances.text: Thank you .
utterances.scene: The passenger expresses gratitude for the assistance received during check-in. The tone is polite and appreciative.

utterances.text: Have a nice day .
utterances.scene: The staff member offers a polite closing remark, wishing the passenger well. The tone is courteous and professional.

utterances.text: You , too .
utterances.scene: The passenger reciprocates the polite farewell. The tone is courteous and reciprocal.

utterances.text: Let's come to an agreement to salary .
utterances.scene: A formal business discussion is commencing, focusing on the financial terms of employment. The tone is direct and professional, setting the stage for negotiation.

utterances.text: May I see the agreement first ?
utterances.scene: The potential employee, showing prudence and professionalism, requests to review the contract before proceeding. The tone is cautious and polite.

utterances.text: Of course . Here you are . Please read the agreement and sign it .
utterances.scene: The employer confidently presents the agreement, expecting the employee to read and sign it. The tone is straightforward and encouraging.

utterances.text: ( Read the agreement . ) There's a three-month period of probation for new recruits .
utterances.scene: The employee identifies a specific clause within the agreement, indicating careful review and initial understanding of the terms. The tone is observant and factual.

utterances.text: Yes . If you have any question , just ask . By the way , do you know your rights and obligations in this agreement ?
utterances.scene: The employer confirms the clause and proactively invites questions, emphasizing the importance of understanding legal rights and obligations. The tone is helpful and informative.

utterances.text: I think I know it . I wonder whether the agreement has the guarantee of law or not .
utterances.scene: The employee expresses a general understanding but raises a critical concern about the legal validity and enforceability of the agreement, seeking reassurance. The tone is inquisitive and slightly cautious.

utterances.text: Of course , you can believe us . Both sides should act according to the provisions of the agreement . Please sign the agreement .
utterances.scene: The employer provides strong reassurance about the agreement's legal standing and urges the employee to sign, stressing mutual adherence to the provisions. The tone is reassuring and authoritative.

utterances.text: ( Sign . ) OK , I signed the agreement with the signature of my name .
utterances.scene: The employee completes the signing process, indicating formal acceptance and finalization of the employment agreement. The tone is conclusive and compliant.

utterances.text: We are done with the agreement . After a three-month probationary period , you will be confirmed in your post .
utterances.scene: The employer formally concludes the agreement process and outlines the next steps, including the probationary period and eventual confirmation. The tone is formal and informative.

utterances.text: I see . Thank you very much .
utterances.scene: The employee acknowledges the information and expresses gratitude, marking the polite conclusion of the formal interaction. The tone is appreciative and understanding.

utterances.text: You are welcome .
utterances.scene: The employer responds politely, bringing the professional interaction to a courteous close. The tone is polite and customary.

utterances.text: What do you do besides work and watching TV ?
utterances.scene: An informal conversation begins with one person expressing curiosity about the other's personal life and hobbies outside of work. The tone is friendly and inquisitive.

utterances.text: When I have some time , I like to exercise .
utterances.scene: The person reveals a preference for physical activity during their free time, indicating a healthy lifestyle choice. The tone is informative and straightforward.

utterances.text: Do you go jogging or do you go to a health club ?
utterances.scene: The inquirer seeks more specific details about the type of exercise, showing continued interest in the other person's fitness routine. The tone is curious and conversational.

utterances.text: I joined Samsung Health Club a couple of months ago .
utterances.scene: The person provides a specific answer, indicating a commitment to a structured exercise environment. The tone is factual and slightly proud of the membership.

utterances.text: How do you exercise ?
utterances.scene: The inquirer asks for more detailed information about the actual exercises performed during workouts. The tone is inquisitive.

utterances.text: I usually spend 30 minutes on the bicycle for the Carpio , and then I lift weight for about 45 minutes .
utterances.scene: The person describes their detailed workout regimen, including specific activities and their durations. The tone is informative and precise.

utterances.text: How often do you go ?
utterances.scene: The inquirer asks about the frequency of the workouts, showing interest in the person's consistency. The tone is curious.

utterances.text: I want to go four times a week , but I'm too lazy . Last week , I only went to workout once .
utterances.scene: The person admits to a struggle with consistency due to laziness, contrasting their ideal goal with their actual behavior. The tone is honest and somewhat self-deprecating.

utterances.text: Hi , Mark ! Long time no see !
utterances.scene: Two friends greet each other warmly after a long time, expressing happiness and surprise at their reunion. The tone is enthusiastic and friendly.

utterances.text: Hi , Alex !
utterances.scene: Mark returns the friendly greeting to Alex, acknowledging their reunion. The tone is reciprocal and friendly.

utterances.text: Where have you been ?
utterances.scene: Alex expresses curiosity about Mark's recent whereabouts, indicating genuine interest in catching up with his friend. The tone is inquisitive and friendly.

utterances.text: I just got back from London .
utterances.scene: Mark reveals his recent international travel, providing the answer to Alex's question. The tone is informative and casual.

utterances.text: How was your flight ?
utterances.scene: Alex asks about the travel experience, showing continued interest in Mark's journey and well-being. The tone is solicitous.

utterances.text: It was OK . There was a lot of turbulence , though .
utterances.scene: Mark describes his flight as generally acceptable but mentions a specific negative detail, indicating minor discomfort during travel. The tone is factual with a hint of complaint.

utterances.text: That ’ s too bad . how long was the flight ?
utterances.scene: Alex expresses sympathy for the turbulence and asks for more details about the flight's duration, showing empathy and continued interest. The tone is empathetic and curious.

utterances.text: It was 10 hours .
utterances.scene: Mark provides the specific length of his flight. The tone is factual.

utterances.text: Did you have a layover ?
utterances.scene: Alex asks about a common aspect of long-haul international flights, showing knowledge of travel logistics. The tone is inquisitive.

utterances.text: Yes , in paris , France .
utterances.scene: Mark confirms having a layover and specifies the location, providing more details about his journey. The tone is informative.

utterances.text: Did you buy anything in the duty-free stores ?
utterances.scene: Alex shifts the conversation to a common activity during international travel, casually inquiring about souvenirs or gifts. The tone is casual and curious.

utterances.text: Yes . I bought two boxed of chocolate ? one for me and one for you !
utterances.scene: Mark reveals a thoughtful gesture, sharing a gift with Alex. The tone is generous and friendly, expressing affection.

utterances.text: Oh , you didn ’ t have to ...
utterances.scene: Alex expresses polite surprise and a mild protest, a common social convention when receiving a gift, while likely feeling pleased. The tone is polite and appreciative.

utterances.text: It was nothing .
utterances.scene: Mark dismisses Alex's polite protest, emphasizing that the gift was a small gesture of friendship. The tone is modest and reassuring.

utterances.text: May we see the wine list please ?
utterances.scene: A customer politely requests the wine menu in a restaurant or bar, indicating their intention to order drinks. The tone is polite and expectant.

utterances.text: Sure . Our special wine today is a 1989 Chardonnay .
utterances.scene: The server responds promptly and highlights a special wine recommendation, aiming to assist the customer with their choice. The tone is helpful and informative.

utterances.text: That sounds pretty good ! How much is it ?
utterances.scene: The customer expresses interest in the recommendation and immediately inquires about the price, showing practical consideration. The tone is interested and practical.

utterances.text: It's $ 4.25 cents by the glass . The whole bottle is $ 22.5 .
utterances.scene: The server provides detailed pricing options for the wine, offering choices for purchase by the glass or bottle. The tone is informative and clear.

utterances.text: I'd like a bottle please .
utterances.scene: The customer makes a clear decision to purchase a full bottle of the recommended wine. The tone is decisive and polite.

utterances.text: I'll need to see your ID please .
utterances.scene: The server makes a legal and necessary request to verify the customer's age, adhering to regulations for alcohol sales. The tone is formal and mandatory.

utterances.text: Here you go .
utterances.scene: The customer complies with the request, presenting their identification to the server. The tone is compliant.

utterances.text: Sorry about the inconvenience , you look so young . I had make sure you are over 21 years old .
utterances.scene: The server apologizes for the necessary inconvenience, explains the reason politely, and compliments the customer's youthful appearance. The tone is apologetic, professional, and slightly flattering.

utterances.text: OK , let's find somebody then .
utterances.scene: A decision is made to delegate a task, indicating a collaborative approach to problem-solving. The tone is decisive and proactive.

utterances.text: Good . I'll take care of it .
utterances.scene: One person volunteers to take responsibility for the task, showing initiative and confidence in their ability to handle it. The tone is eager and self-assured.

utterances.text: Wait a second , Vince . You know what ? Why don't you let me handle it ?
utterances.scene: The other person intervenes, suggesting they handle the task instead, possibly due to a specific reason or preference. The tone is interventional and persuasive.

utterances.text: Are you sure ? Do you have somebody in mind ?
utterances.scene: Vince expresses doubt and seeks clarification, questioning the other person's readiness or specific plan for the task. The tone is questioning and cautious.

utterances.text: Yeah . Let me see if he'll do it , and I'll get back to you .
utterances.scene: The person confirms their readiness and outlines a plan to contact a specific individual, promising a follow-up. The tone is confident and reassuring.

utterances.text: OK . Just keep in mind it has to be somebody who can get along with Elvin .
utterances.scene: Vince agrees but adds a crucial condition for the candidate, emphasizing the importance of interpersonal compatibility. The tone is agreeable but conditional.

utterances.text: Don't sweat it . I know just the guy .
utterances.scene: The person confidently reassures Vince, indicating they have the perfect candidate in mind and will handle the task effectively. The tone is confident and reassuring.

utterances.text: May I help you ?
utterances.scene: A service provider offers assistance to a customer, initiating a formal interaction. The tone is polite and helpful.

utterances.text: I needed to ask you a question .
utterances.scene: The customer states their purpose for the interaction, indicating a specific inquiry they need to make. The tone is direct and purposeful.

utterances.text: Ask away .
utterances.scene: The service provider encourages the customer to proceed with their question, indicating readiness to assist. The tone is welcoming and informal.

utterances.text: How many hours of the behind-the-wheel course do I need to take ?
utterances.scene: The customer asks a specific, practical question about the requirements for a driving course. The tone is inquisitive and focused.

utterances.text: Why do you need to take the course ?
utterances.scene: The service provider asks for the customer's motivation, likely to provide the most accurate information or confirm eligibility. The tone is clarifying and inquisitive.

utterances.text: I want to get my license .
utterances.scene: The customer states their clear objective for taking the course, providing the necessary context. The tone is direct and goal-oriented.

utterances.text: You have to do six hours behind the wheel .
utterances.scene: The service provider gives the direct answer to the customer's initial question, providing the required information. The tone is informative and authoritative.

utterances.text: How many days do I need to finish the course ?
utterances.scene: The customer asks another practical question, seeking to understand the time commitment for the course. The tone is inquisitive and planning-oriented.

utterances.text: You can't finish in less than three days .
utterances.scene: The service provider gives a minimum time frame for completing the course, setting expectations. The tone is informative and definitive.

utterances.text: Is that all ?
utterances.scene: The customer seeks confirmation that there are no other hidden requirements or complexities, expressing a desire for simplicity. The tone is inquisitive and slightly hopeful.

utterances.text: There's nothing else to it .
utterances.scene: The service provider confirms that the information provided is exhaustive and there are no further complications. The tone is reassuring and definitive.

utterances.text: That sounds easy enough .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses satisfaction and relief with the simplicity of the requirements, finding them manageable. The tone is relieved and positive.

utterances.text: Peter , go and tidy up your toys now .
utterances.scene: A parent issues a direct command to a child, expecting immediate obedience regarding a chore. The tone is authoritative and firm.

utterances.text: Wait a moment , mom .
utterances.scene: The child attempts to delay the chore, asking for a brief postponement. The tone is pleading and hesitant, characteristic of a child's procrastination.

utterances.text: I'm mad ! I said now ! Turn off the TV , and do it now .
utterances.scene: The parent expresses frustration and anger at the child's delay, reiterating the command with increased urgency and firmness. The tone is angry, frustrated, and demanding.

utterances.text: Mom , just ten more minutes . The show is going to be over soon .
utterances.scene: The child tries again to negotiate for a short extension, using the ongoing TV show as justification. The tone is pleading and hopeful, trying to buy more time.

utterances.text: Peter , if you don't do it soon , I will throw your toys in the trash can .
utterances.scene: The parent issues a severe warning and consequence, escalating the threat to enforce compliance. The tone is threatening, serious, and exasperated.

utterances.text: Excuse me . Do you speak English ?
utterances.scene: A hotel guest politely initiates a conversation with a staff member, checking for language compatibility before asking for assistance. The tone is polite and inquiring.

utterances.text: Yes , I do . How can I help you ?
utterances.scene: The staff member confirms language proficiency and immediately offers assistance, showing readiness to serve. The tone is helpful and welcoming.

utterances.text: Well , I've just arrived in my room , but there are no instructions in English about the facilities available ! Could you help me for a moment ?
utterances.scene: The guest explains their predicament – a lack of English instructions – and politely requests help with understanding hotel facilities. The tone is slightly frustrated but polite and seeking help.

utterances.text: Of course not . What exactly would you like to know ?
utterances.scene: The staff member reassures the guest and asks for specifics, indicating a willingness to provide detailed assistance. The tone is reassuring and helpful.

utterances.text: First , what is the number for room service ?
utterances.scene: The guest begins with a practical and common hotel amenity inquiry about room service. The tone is direct and task-oriented.

utterances.text: It's 1200 . Room service is available 24 hours a day .
utterances.scene: The staff member provides the requested information and adds a helpful detail about the availability of room service. The tone is informative and helpful.

utterances.text: Very good . Now , could you help me to adjust the air conditioning , please ? It's too hot in my room .
utterances.scene: The guest expresses satisfaction and then requests help with another immediate comfort issue, indicating discomfort due to the room temperature. The tone is appreciative and seeking comfort.

utterances.text: Yes , the control unit is on the wall next to the bathroom . Is 24 ° C all right ?
utterances.scene: The staff member provides instructions for the air conditioning and proactively suggests a comfortable temperature setting, demonstrating attentive service. The tone is helpful and attentive.

utterances.text: Yes , that's perfect . Another thing , if need more items for the mini-bar , which Number should I call ?
utterances.scene: The guest confirms satisfaction with the temperature and then asks about replenishing mini-bar items, showing an ongoing need for hotel services. The tone is satisfied and inquiring.

utterances.text: You should call the Housekeeping Department on 2300 . They will replace any stock for you immediately .
utterances.scene: The staff member provides the correct contact for mini-bar service and reassures the guest about prompt stock replacement. The tone is informative and reassuring.

utterances.text: I see . So , is it possible to make international phone calls from my room ?
utterances.scene: The guest acknowledges the information and then asks about another communication service, indicating a comprehensive approach to understanding room amenities. The tone is understanding and inquiring.

utterances.text: That's no problem . Just dial 9 to get an outside line , and then dial the number as usual .
utterances.scene: The staff member confirms the possibility and provides clear, simple instructions for making international calls. The tone is reassuring and instructive.

utterances.text: Well , thanks a lot for your help .
utterances.scene: The guest expresses sincere gratitude for the extensive assistance received. The tone is appreciative and thankful.

utterances.text: No problem , sir . If there's anything else you need , you can find me at the desk by the elevator , or you can call housekeeping if I'm not there .
utterances.scene: The staff member graciously accepts the thanks and offers further assistance, providing clear instructions on how to reach them or other departments. The tone is courteous, professional, and helpful.

utterances.text: OK , goodbye .
utterances.scene: The guest politely concludes the interaction with a farewell. The tone is polite and conclusive.

utterances.text: Goodbye , sir .
utterances.scene: The staff member reciprocates the farewell, ending the interaction professionally and courteously. The tone is polite and professional.

utterances.text: I need some flowers for my girlfriend .
utterances.scene: A customer states their purpose for visiting a florist, indicating a desire to purchase a gift for a loved one. The tone is direct and purposeful, with a romantic undertone.

utterances.text: No problem . Would you like some artificial carnations ?
utterances.scene: The florist offers a suggestion, attempting to guide the customer, though perhaps misjudging the desired quality or sentiment. The tone is helpful and suggestive.

utterances.text: Oh , no . Carnations are not very elegant . Artificial flowers have no passion .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses a clear preference and rejects the suggestion, articulating their desire for elegance and genuine sentiment. The tone is discerning and slightly dismissive of the artificial option.

utterances.text: How much did you want to spend ?
utterances.scene: The florist shifts to a practical question about budget, aiming to narrow down options based on price range. The tone is practical and business-oriented.

utterances.text: Money is no object .
utterances.scene: The customer indicates a willingness to spend freely, prioritizing quality and sentiment over cost. The tone is extravagant and confident.

utterances.text: Our most elegant flower is Golden Lily .
utterances.scene: The florist, understanding the customer's preference for elegance and a generous budget, recommends a premium flower. The tone is suggestive and highlights quality.

utterances.text: I will take ten .
utterances.scene: The customer makes a quick, decisive purchase decision for a significant quantity of the recommended premium flowers. The tone is decisive and generous.

utterances.text: Do you want to add some baby's breath for that ? They are equally popular now .
utterances.scene: The florist suggests an additional decorative element (upsell), aiming to enhance the bouquet and increase the sale. The tone is suggestive and helpful.

utterances.text: Of course . Can I have it delivered to my girlfriend's house this afternoon ?
utterances.scene: The customer agrees to the addition and then inquires about delivery services, indicating a desire for convenience and timely presentation. The tone is agreeable and practical.

utterances.text: Yes , but there is a five dollars delivery charge .
utterances.scene: The florist confirms the delivery service but informs the customer about an additional fee. The tone is informative and business-like.

utterances.text: That's ok . Here is the address .
utterances.scene: The customer accepts the delivery charge and provides the necessary information for the service. The tone is accepting and cooperative.

utterances.text: Good Morning . What can I do for you ?
utterances.scene: A medical receptionist or clerk greets a patient and offers assistance, initiating the registration or consultation process. The tone is polite and professional.

utterances.text: Good Morning , I have a bad cough , and I want to see an internist .
utterances.scene: The patient states their symptom and expresses their preference for a specific type of doctor. The tone is direct and seeking medical help.

utterances.text: Do you have a registration card ?
utterances.scene: The receptionist asks about the patient's existing registration status, a standard administrative procedure in a medical setting. The tone is routine and administrative.

utterances.text: No , I don ’ t . I ' m a tourist .
utterances.scene: The patient clarifies their status, indicating they are a new, temporary patient (a tourist). The tone is informative and slightly apologetic for not having a card.

utterances.text: Then you need to register as a new patient . Can I have a look at you ID card ? I need your name , age , occupation , address and contacting number .
utterances.scene: The receptionist explains the necessary registration process for a new patient and requests personal identification and contact details. The tone is administrative and instructive.

utterances.text: Here you are .
utterances.scene: The patient complies with the request, providing their identification to the receptionist. The tone is compliant.

utterances.text: Thanks . Which kind of medicine do you prefer , western medicine or traditional Chinese medicine ?
utterances.scene: The receptionist thanks the patient and then asks about their preference for a type of medical treatment, offering a choice. The tone is polite and inquiring about treatment preference.

utterances.text: I ’ d like to try traditional Chinese medicine . I heard it really works quite well if you know what you're doing .
utterances.scene: The patient expresses a preference for traditional Chinese medicine, citing its positive reputation and indicating a willingness to try alternative treatments. The tone is curious and open-minded.

utterances.text: All right . Yes , he does . The registration fee is 7 yuan , please .
utterances.scene: The receptionist acknowledges the patient's choice (implicitly confirming the availability of such a doctor) and then states the registration fee, concluding the administrative process. The tone is administrative and informative.

utterances.text: Hey there Chris , what are you up to ?
utterances.scene: A casual greeting between two friends, initiating a friendly conversation. The tone is relaxed and inquisitive.

utterances.text: I'm just poring over some brochures about various car models .
utterances.scene: Chris reveals he is busy researching car models, indicating a practical and somewhat focused activity. The tone is informative.

utterances.text: Oh , so you're thinking about buying a new car ?
utterances.scene: The other speaker expresses mild surprise and curiosity, making an inference about Chris's activity. The tone is curious and engaged.

utterances.text: Yeah , it looks that way . My wife has been bugging me about it . I thought we could probably survive without one , but with a baby on the way , maybe it is time to get a car .
utterances.scene: Chris confirms his intention, expressing a mix of resignation to his wife's insistence and a pragmatic acceptance of the need for a car due to an upcoming family change (baby). There's a hint of underlying stress or reluctance, but also a sense of responsibility.

utterances.text: So this would be your first automobile ?
utterances.scene: The speaker expresses surprise and curiosity, realizing the significance of this potential purchase for Chris. The tone is inquisitive.

utterances.text: That's right . For quite a few years , I rode a bicycle to work . Then I got a motorbike .
utterances.scene: Chris explains his past transportation choices, indicating a history of not owning a car. The tone is factual and reflective.

utterances.text: Yeah , I think I can understand your wife's position . Asking her to ride on a motorcycle when she's pregnant is a tall order .
utterances.scene: The speaker expresses empathy and understanding for Chris's wife, highlighting the practical and safety concerns related to pregnancy and transportation. The tone is supportive and understanding.

utterances.text: Oh ... I don't let her ride with me . It's just too dangerous . She takes the bus to work , but it is sometimes difficult to get a seat and it's crowded and hot .
utterances.scene: Chris clarifies his wife's current situation, showing concern for her safety and comfort, which reinforces the practical need for a car. He expresses a sense of responsibility and care.

utterances.text: So it's time to buy your very first car ! Wow , that's exciting !
utterances.scene: The speaker expresses genuine excitement and enthusiasm for Chris's upcoming major life event. The tone is celebratory and encouraging.

utterances.text: Yes , but it's also a pretty big financial responsibility .
utterances.scene: Chris acknowledges the excitement but quickly shifts to a more pragmatic and slightly concerned tone, highlighting the financial burden. He expresses a sense of apprehension mixed with realism.

utterances.text: Yeah . I still remember my first car . It was an old clunker that my dad gave me when I turned 17 . I drove it around for a couple of years until I scraped together enough money to buy a better secondhand car .
utterances.scene: The speaker empathizes by sharing a personal anecdote about their own first car, normalizing the experience and subtly acknowledging the financial aspect. The tone is nostalgic and relatable.

utterances.text: I'm having a hard time deciding which model is best for us .
utterances.scene: Chris expresses his current dilemma and frustration with the decision-making process, seeking advice or understanding. The tone is one of mild stress or indecision.

utterances.text: Yeah , it is a tough call . Each one has its pros and cons . Are you looking for a sedan ?
utterances.scene: The speaker acknowledges Chris's difficulty and offers a practical question to help narrow down the choices, showing willingness to assist. The tone is helpful and understanding.

utterances.text: Yes , I'd like a Jeep , but my wife says we have to get a comfortable sedan for long drives home to see her relatives .
utterances.scene: Chris reveals a personal preference (Jeep) that conflicts with his wife's practical requirement (comfortable sedan for family travel), indicating a compromise or a potential point of contention. The tone is slightly resigned but understanding of his wife's needs.

utterances.text: I'd advise you to listen to your wife . She will be sitting in the back taking care of the kids so whatever she prefers is probably the best choice .
utterances.scene: The speaker offers direct advice, emphasizing the wife's future role with the baby and her comfort as paramount, reinforcing the practical and family-oriented decision. The tone is advisory and practical.

utterances.text: Can I help you ?
utterances.scene: A service person offers assistance to a customer in a professional and polite manner. The tone is helpful and formal.

utterances.text: I'd like to send a fax to Shenzhen .
utterances.scene: The customer states their specific request clearly and directly. The tone is business-like and direct.

utterances.text: Is it a photograph or a document ?
utterances.scene: The service person asks a clarifying question to understand the nature of the items to be faxed. The tone is professional and inquisitive.

utterances.text: Each of both .
utterances.scene: The customer confirms that they have both types of items. The tone is concise and factual.

utterances.text: Could I see both of them ?
utterances.scene: The service person requests to inspect the items before proceeding. The tone is professional and procedural.

utterances.text: Here you are .
utterances.scene: The customer hands over the items as requested. The tone is cooperative.

utterances.text: You can't send this document ; it is not clear enough to send . The photograph is all right .
utterances.scene: The service person provides an assessment, rejecting one item due to quality issues but accepting the other. The tone is professional and informative, with a hint of concern regarding the document.

utterances.text: Well , how long will it take to arrive in Shenzhen ?
utterances.scene: The customer, accepting the feedback, shifts focus to the practicalities of the successful part of their request. The tone is pragmatic and inquisitive.

utterances.text: Couple of minutes .
utterances.scene: The service person provides a quick and reassuring answer regarding the transmission time. The tone is informative and efficient.

utterances.text: Great . How much ?
utterances.scene: The customer expresses satisfaction with the speed and then inquires about the cost. The tone is positive and direct.

utterances.text: 5 $ . You should change another much clearer photograph for fax .
utterances.scene: The service person states the price and, perhaps mistakenly, repeats advice about the *photograph* instead of the *document*. The tone is factual and advisory.

utterances.text: Thank you . I will deal with it .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses gratitude and acknowledges the advice, indicating they will resolve the issue with the unclear item. The tone is appreciative and resolute.

utterances.text: Good morning , can I see your passport , please ?
utterances.scene: A customs or immigration officer greets a traveler and politely requests their passport. The tone is formal and procedural.

utterances.text: Here you are .
utterances.scene: The traveler hands over their passport as requested. The tone is compliant and polite.

utterances.text: For business or pleasure ?
utterances.scene: The officer asks a standard clarifying question about the purpose of the visit. The tone is routine and professional.

utterances.text: Business .
utterances.scene: The traveler provides a concise and direct answer. The tone is factual.

utterances.text: Thank you . Have a pleasant stay .
utterances.scene: The officer concludes the interaction by thanking the traveler and wishing them a good stay, indicating the process is complete. The tone is polite and formal.

utterances.text: Take care , Peter . Don't run so fast . Are you tired ?
utterances.scene: An adult expresses concern and care for a child named Peter, advising caution and checking on his well-being. The tone is nurturing and slightly admonishing.

utterances.text: Oh , yes . May I sit on the grass ?
utterances.scene: Peter, feeling tired, asks for permission to sit on the grass, indicating a desire for rest and comfort. The tone is weary and polite.

utterances.text: No , you mustn't sit on the grass . Don't you see the notes ?
utterances.scene: The adult firmly denies Peter's request, citing a rule or sign, and gently scolds him for not noticing it. The tone is firm and instructive.

utterances.text: Yes , I can see it . But what's on it ?
utterances.scene: Peter acknowledges seeing the sign but admits he cannot read or understand it, showing curiosity. The tone is inquisitive and slightly innocent.

utterances.text: It says ' Keep off the grass ! '
utterances.scene: The adult reads the sign aloud, explaining the rule to Peter. The tone is informative and direct.

utterances.text: Well , there's a bench under the tree . We can sit there .
utterances.scene: Peter, being resourceful, suggests an alternative seating option, showing problem-solving. The tone is hopeful and practical.

utterances.text: Be careful . You can't smoke here .
utterances.scene: The adult cautions Peter again, this time regarding smoking, indicating another public rule. The tone is cautionary and instructive.

utterances.text: Why not ?
utterances.scene: Peter asks for the reason behind the prohibition, displaying continued curiosity. The tone is inquisitive.

utterances.text: Can't you see the notes there ? It says ' No smoking here ' .
utterances.scene: The adult points to another sign, explaining the rule by reading it. The tone is slightly exasperated but still informative.

utterances.text: I'd like a double room .
utterances.scene: A customer makes a specific request for a hotel room type. The tone is direct and polite.

utterances.text: Do you have a reservation ?
utterances.scene: The hotel staff member asks a standard procedural question to locate the customer's booking. The tone is professional and routine.

utterances.text: Yes , I called you last week from New York . My name is George Lee .
utterances.scene: The customer confirms their reservation and provides identifying details, including a helpful reference to a previous call. The tone is informative and helpful.

utterances.text: Wait a second , PLS . Yes , Mr . Lee , we have a room reserved for you . How long do you plan to stay ?
utterances.scene: The staff member takes a moment to check and then confirms the reservation, proceeding with a standard check-in question. The tone is professional and efficient.

utterances.text: Probably two days . My wife will join me tomorrow . Then we will decide when to leave for Seattle .
utterances.scene: Mr. Lee provides an estimated length of stay and additional information about his travel plans, indicating flexibility and shared decision-making with his wife. The tone is informative and planning-oriented.

utterances.text: Would you sign the register , PLS ?
utterances.scene: The staff member requests the customer to complete a standard check-in formality. The tone is polite and procedural.

utterances.text: By the way , does my room have a private bath ?
utterances.scene: Mr. Lee asks a clarifying question about a specific room amenity, showing a concern for comfort and privacy. The tone is inquisitive and anticipatory.

utterances.text: Certainly , every room in this hotel has a private bath .
utterances.scene: The staff member provides a reassuring and definitive answer, confirming a standard feature of the hotel. The tone is confident and informative.

utterances.text: Does my room have twin beds or a double ? I prefer a room with twin beds .
utterances.scene: Mr. Lee asks another specific question about room configuration, expressing a personal preference. The tone is inquisitive and particular.

utterances.text: Your room has twin beds , Mr.Lee . It also has a view . I am sure you will like it . This is your key . It's on the eighth floor room 801 . The elevator's over there .
utterances.scene: The staff member confirms the preferred bed type, adds extra positive information about the room (view), expresses confidence in his satisfaction, and provides practical information for accessing the room. The tone is helpful, reassuring, and welcoming.

utterances.text: Thank you . One more thing , where is your restaurant ?
utterances.scene: Mr. Lee expresses gratitude and then asks about another hotel amenity, planning for his stay. The tone is polite and anticipatory.

utterances.text: The restaurant is on the second floor . We also have a cafeteria on the top floor . If you would like something to drink , you can either call room service or come down here . The bar is right behind the lobby .
utterances.scene: The staff member provides comprehensive information about dining and drinking options within the hotel, offering various choices. The tone is helpful and detailed.

utterances.text: Thank you , you are very kind !
utterances.scene: Mr. Lee expresses strong appreciation for the staff member's thorough assistance. The tone is genuinely grateful and complimentary.

utterances.text: You are welcome !
utterances.scene: The staff member responds politely to the compliment, concluding the interaction. The tone is gracious and professional.

utterances.text: I need to find a bus that'll take me to the Gold Line .
utterances.scene: A person expresses a need for public transportation to a specific destination. The tone is direct and seeking assistance.

utterances.text: Where do you live ?
utterances.scene: The other person asks a clarifying question to better provide assistance, indicating a helpful intent. The tone is inquisitive and helpful.

utterances.text: I live up in Altadena .
utterances.scene: The first person provides their residential location. The tone is factual.

utterances.text: The 264 will take you there .
utterances.scene: The second person provides the specific bus route number. The tone is informative and direct.

utterances.text: It goes all the way there ?
utterances.scene: The first person seeks confirmation, perhaps expressing slight disbelief or a need for reassurance. The tone is inquisitive and slightly doubtful.

utterances.text: I know for a fact that it goes to the station .
utterances.scene: The second person confidently confirms the information, emphasizing its accuracy. The tone is assured and definitive.

utterances.text: What street would I catch it on ?
utterances.scene: The first person asks for more specific details about the boarding location. The tone is practical and inquisitive.

utterances.text: If you go to Altadena Drive , you can catch it there .
utterances.scene: The second person provides the specific street for catching the bus. The tone is informative and helpful.

utterances.text: I didn't know that bus went to the Gold Line station .
utterances.scene: The first person expresses surprise and new understanding, indicating they learned something useful. The tone is appreciative and slightly surprised.

utterances.text: Yup , it does .
utterances.scene: The second person gives a casual confirmation. The tone is informal and reassuring.

utterances.text: Well , thanks for letting me know .
utterances.scene: The first person expresses gratitude for the valuable information. The tone is appreciative.

utterances.text: It was my pleasure .
utterances.scene: The second person responds politely to the thanks, indicating willingness to help. The tone is courteous and gracious.

utterances.text: May I help you ?
utterances.scene: A service person offers assistance to a customer in a polite and professional manner. The tone is helpful and formal.

utterances.text: I have a problem .
utterances.scene: The customer states their reason for seeking help directly, indicating distress or concern. The tone is serious and troubled.

utterances.text: What ’ s the problem ?
utterances.scene: The service person asks for details to understand the issue, maintaining a professional and ready-to-assist demeanor. The tone is inquisitive and professional.

utterances.text: Someone else is making charges on my debit card .
utterances.scene: The customer explains the specific and serious nature of their problem, indicating fraud or unauthorized activity. The tone is worried and urgent.

utterances.text: I need to see a statement for your debit card .
utterances.scene: The service person requests a document necessary for investigation, following standard procedure. The tone is procedural and professional.

utterances.text: I have it right here .
utterances.scene: The customer confirms immediate availability of the requested document, showing preparedness. The tone is cooperative and ready.

utterances.text: Can you show me which charges you ’ re referring to ?
utterances.scene: The service person asks the customer to identify the fraudulent charges on the statement. The tone is precise and investigative.

utterances.text: The last four charges .
utterances.scene: The customer clearly points out the problematic charges. The tone is direct and factual.

utterances.text: We will need to do an investigation on this .
utterances.scene: The service person informs the customer of the necessary next step, which is a formal investigation. The tone is professional and serious.

utterances.text: How long will that take ?
utterances.scene: The customer inquires about the duration of the investigation, expressing a desire for a timeline or resolution. The tone is anxious and seeking clarity.

utterances.text: We ’ ll have to freeze payment on those charges until the investigation is finished .
utterances.scene: The service person explains an immediate protective measure (freezing payments) while the investigation is ongoing. The tone is informative and reassuring about action being taken.

utterances.text: I really appreciate your help .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses sincere gratitude for the assistance and the steps being taken to resolve their problem. The tone is appreciative and relieved.

utterances.text: Do you think we can go driving right now ?
utterances.scene: A learner driver eagerly asks for a driving lesson, expressing enthusiasm. The tone is eager and hopeful.

utterances.text: Yeah , sure . Let's go .
utterances.scene: The instructor agrees readily and encourages the start of the lesson. The tone is positive and encouraging.

utterances.text: Buckle up .
utterances.scene: The instructor gives a safety instruction, a standard first step before driving. The tone is instructional and safety-focused.

utterances.text: All right . Now what ?
utterances.scene: The learner driver complies with the instruction and then asks for the next step, showing readiness to learn. The tone is compliant and inquisitive.

utterances.text: Now you put the key in the ignition and start the car .
utterances.scene: The instructor provides the next basic step in starting the car. The tone is instructional and patient.

utterances.text: Which direction should I take ?
utterances.scene: The learner driver asks for navigational guidance, indicating they are ready to drive. The tone is inquisitive and ready.

utterances.text: Make a left on this next street .
utterances.scene: The instructor gives a specific driving direction. The tone is clear and guiding.

utterances.text: Tell me how far to go .
utterances.scene: The learner driver requests continuous guidance on distance, indicating reliance on the instructor. The tone is reliant and seeking clarity.

utterances.text: Keep going until I tell you to stop .
utterances.scene: The instructor gives a general instruction for continued driving, maintaining control over the lesson's duration. The tone is authoritative and guiding.

utterances.text: Okay , but let me know ahead of time .
utterances.scene: The learner driver agrees but requests a heads-up before stopping, indicating a desire to be prepared. The tone is cooperative but also seeking preparation.

utterances.text: That's all for today , so park right there .
utterances.scene: The instructor signals the end of the lesson and gives the final parking instruction. The tone is conclusive and instructional.

utterances.text: That was great . Thanks for taking me driving .
utterances.scene: The learner driver expresses enjoyment and gratitude for the driving lesson. The tone is enthusiastic and appreciative.

utterances.text: I'm after some chinese incense burner ? How's this one ?
utterances.scene: A customer expresses interest in a specific item (Chinese incense burner) and asks for an opinion on one. The tone is inquisitive and seeking advice.

utterances.text: How's this one ?
utterances.scene: The shop assistant or another person suggests an item and asks for the customer's opinion. The tone is helpful and inquisitive.

utterances.text: Oh , I need a small one , otherwise my luggage will be overweight .
utterances.scene: The customer clarifies their requirement, citing a practical constraint (luggage weight) for needing a smaller item. The tone is informative and practical.

utterances.text: What about this one ?
utterances.scene: The shop assistant suggests another item, presumably a smaller one, based on the customer's clarified need. The tone is helpful and suggestive.

utterances.text: Oh , this is fine .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses satisfaction with the suggested item, indicating it meets their criteria. The tone is accepting and content.

utterances.text: Hello . This is the Holiday Inn . Can I help you ?
utterances.scene: A hotel representative answers the phone and offers assistance in a professional and polite manner. The tone is helpful and formal.

utterances.text: Hi . Is there a special rate for a group reservation ?
utterances.scene: The caller inquires about a specific type of discount for a group booking. The tone is inquisitive and business-oriented.

utterances.text: Yes . There is a 20 % to 40 % discount . It depends on the season.During the summer the discount is 20 % . During the winter it is 40 % .
utterances.scene: The hotel representative confirms the existence of discounts and explains the variable rates based on season. The tone is informative and helpful.

utterances.text: I need five single rooms in October . How much of a discount can I get ?
utterances.scene: The caller provides specific details for their group booking and asks for the applicable discount. The tone is direct and calculative.

utterances.text: Our summer season ended in September . So the discount will be 40 % . That ’ s a good deal . Would you prefer rooms with a front view or rear view ?
utterances.scene: The representative applies the seasonal discount, highlights it as a good deal, and then asks for a room preference. The tone is helpful, encouraging, and attentive to detail.

utterances.text: Front view , please .
utterances.scene: The caller states their preference for the room view. The tone is polite and specific.

utterances.text: What date and time will you be checking in ?
utterances.scene: The representative asks for the specific check-in details to finalize the booking. The tone is procedural and precise.

utterances.text: October 25th around 2:00 in the afternoon .
utterances.scene: The caller provides the exact date and estimated time for check-in. The tone is factual and precise.

utterances.text: We need you to send a deposit for 1/3 of the bill . You can send the check , or you can use the credit card .
utterances.scene: The representative informs the caller about the required deposit and offers payment options. The tone is procedural and informative.

utterances.text: Ok . I ’ ll send a check .
utterances.scene: The caller agrees to the deposit and specifies their preferred payment method. The tone is compliant and decisive.

utterances.text: Could you tell me your name , address and phone number , please ?
utterances.scene: The representative requests personal contact information to complete the booking. The tone is polite and procedural.

utterances.text: Sure . My name is Anderson . My address is 109 Ferguson East , Holton . And my phone number is 309 789 1267 .
utterances.scene: The caller provides all the requested personal and contact information. The tone is cooperative and factual.

utterances.text: Thanks .
utterances.scene: The representative acknowledges receiving the information. The tone is appreciative and concise.

utterances.text: How much further do we have to walk ?
utterances.scene: A person, likely feeling weary or impatient, is inquiring about the remaining distance of a walk. The emotional tone suggests fatigue.

utterances.text: It's about 3 kilometers .
utterances.scene: A companion provides a factual and neutral response regarding the remaining distance.

utterances.text: Shall we have a rest here ? I am tired out .
utterances.scene: The first speaker expresses significant exhaustion and suggests taking a break, clearly feeling 'tired out'.

utterances.text: Well , the best thing to do is to go down to the front desk and ask for a duplicate key .

utterances.text: You mean at the mall ? Was there a sale ?

utterances.text: Cool !

utterances.text: Do you have a swimming pool in this hotel ?

utterances.text: It's just a deep bathtub with a current of water that you swim against .

utterances.text: Holy cow ! I never heard of such a thing . How much do they cost ?

utterances.text: This sounds better every second . Now , when can I use the stations ?

utterances.text: If you want to swim , you can visit the gym any day between 7 a . m . and 10 p . m .

utterances.text: Oh , boy ! This is going to be great . I'm going to the gym right now !
utterances.scene: The guest expresses immense excitement and immediate resolve to use the swim station, showing strong anticipation and happiness.

utterances.text: I'm sure you'll enjoy your workout , sir . Everyone seems to like the swim stations .

utterances.text: I'd like to buy a bottle of Centrum , a dozen tooth brushes , some baby's wipes , and a small bottle of aspirin .

utterances.text: Give me one bottle of one hundred tablets .

utterances.text: Can I have a look at them ?
utterances.scene: The customer requests to physically examine the toothbrushes before deciding, indicating a desire to compare.

utterances.text: Sure . This brand is supposed to be very good , but they're expensive . Those are new products . They come in several colors and sizes . There is also hard , soft , and medium .

utterances.text: Are they cheaper ?

utterances.text: This one is 10 % off . That one has no reduction , but you can get a free tube of toothpaste with six toothbrushes .

utterances.text: That's right .
utterances.scene: The sales assistant confirms the customer's understanding of the promotion.

utterances.text: Good . I ' ll take a dozen of them then .
utterances.scene: The customer expresses satisfaction with the deal and decides to purchase the dozen toothbrushes, influenced by the promotion.

utterances.text: And here is your aspirin . What else did you say you want ?

utterances.text: Baby's wipes . Johnson's .

utterances.text: Sure . Here you are . This one is excellent . Just mix one drop of it with milk .

utterances.text: Thanks . That'll be all .

utterances.text: Excuse me , did you see a set of keys ?

utterances.text: What kind of keys ?

utterances.text: Five keys and a small foot ornament .

utterances.text: Well , can you help me look for it ? That's my first time here .
utterances.scene: The person, feeling a sense of helplessness and perhaps desperation, explicitly requests assistance, explaining their unfamiliarity with the place.

utterances.text: Sure . It's my pleasure . I'd like to help you look for the missing keys .

utterances.text: It's very kind of you .

utterances.text: It's not a big deal.Hey , I found them .

utterances.text: You're welcome .

utterances.text: Good coming , sir . What can I do for you ?

utterances.scene: The customer makes a decision based on the information provided, choosing a specific type of account.

utterances.text: Good morning , Mr . Smith . Welcome to Wuhan .

utterances.text: Good morning !

utterances.text: I just feel a little tired . You know , it took me 16 hours to get here .
utterances.scene: Mr. Smith honestly expresses his fatigue, explaining the long duration of his travel.

utterances.text: You must take a rest today .
utterances.scene: The host expresses genuine concern and strongly advises Mr. Smith to rest, showing consideration for his well-being.

utterances.text: That's very kind of you , but I can do without a rest . I have long wanted to have a talk with you about the possibility of business between us .
utterances.scene: Mr. Smith politely thanks the host but declines the rest, expressing eagerness and determination to discuss business matters immediately.

utterances.text: We welcome good business . Anyhow , we know you must get tired by the flight , so we arrange a meeting tomorrow . Today you can have a good rest .
utterances.scene: The host acknowledges Mr. Smith's eagerness for business but firmly reiterates the importance of rest, showing continued hospitality and a planned schedule.

utterances.text: Thank you very much .
utterances.scene: Mr. Smith expresses sincere gratitude, accepting the host's arrangements and kindness.

utterances.text: We hope your stay here a pleasant one !

utterances.text: I believe I will .
utterances.scene: Mr. Smith responds optimistically, indicating his positive anticipation for his stay.

utterances.text: Excuse me ! What time is it ? My watch stopped .

utterances.text: Let me see . It's 9

utterances.text: The ATM machine outside won't give me back my card .

utterances.text: Let's go take a look at it . Do you have your ID with you ?

utterances.text: Yes , here it is .

utterances.text: Okay , I see the problem . You forgot your code , didn't you ?

utterances.text: How did you know ?
utterances.scene: The customer expresses surprise or mild embarrassment that their mistake was so easily deduced.

utterances.text: The machine gives you three attempts to enter the correct code and after that it assumes that you are not the real owner and confiscates it .
utterances.scene: The employee explains the ATM's security protocol, clarifying why the card was retained, in an informative and professional manner.

utterances.text: Oh . But can I have my card back now ?

utterances.text: Yes , I can get it for you but I need to go back inside the bank .

utterances.text: It's four o'clock in the morning in Chicago now , but it's time to go to bed in Shanghai .

utterances.text: Don't think so much . Take a good sleep and you'll feel better soon .

utterances.text: Good morning , May . Good girl , you are reading English books again .

utterances.text: Yes . Just look at her colorful feathers . What else can it be ?

utterances.text: Lulu . Lulu . Say hello . hello . Oh , she is so smart . Good bird .

utterances.text: Good ! Here , let me help you with your bag . Is it your first time to Seattle ? I'd be happy to take you around this city and show you the sights tonight if you're up to it .

utterances.text: I've already made a hotel reservation for you , let's go to the hotel first and drop off your things . Then , I'd like to have a drink so that we can get better acquainted . I've booked a table at an exclusive restaurant downtown . Afterwards , I've made arrangements to take you to see the city lights . Seattle ’ s nightlife can be really quite exciting . How does that schedule sound to you ?

utterances.text: Thanks for the warning .

utterances.text: Happy Birthday , this is for you , Brian .
utterances.scene: Someone warmly wishes Brian a happy birthday and presents a gift, expressing celebratory joy and affection.

utterances.text: I'm so happy you remember , please come in and enjoy the party . Everyone's here , I'm sure you have a good time .
